loans.name: Joerida

texts.en:
Joerida has spent considerable time and energy preparing for the post harvest operations of her business in Liloy. She wants to ensure that she will have ample time for the  threshing, drying, storage and processing of her harvest to make way for another growing season. She presented her proposal to Paglaum MPC and requested a loan.  Joerida hopes to see all her children finish their degree and have stable careers.

Joerida learned Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. She previously borrowed a loan to jump start her rice production business. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Joerida feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business. 

She requests a new a loan to purchase farm supplies and fertilizer for the next growing season. Joerida wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply rice in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to pay for post harvest operations

loans.name: Carminda

texts.es: Doña Carminda, tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijas, con quienes vive en el Municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. En busca de tener sus propios ingresos para sostener a su familia hace 3 años decidió poner su propio negocio de venta de mercadería de zapatos, blusas, pantalones, sandalias, camisas, jeans y Short. Es una señora trabajadora vende su mercadería de forma ambulante visitando a sus clientes todos los días. Ha mantenido el negocio mediante varios prestamos, con la institución a obtenido 9 ciclos con este actual que es por un monto de 21,000 lempiras. Con este dinero ha pensado comprar pantalones, camisas y calzado para hombres ya que va tener una temporada de mayor venta. Su meta es crecer como comerciante, llegar a tener un local propio y darles buena educación a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Carminda, 49 years old, is a single mother with two daughters, who lives in the city of Azecualpa, Santa Barbara.  Looking for a way to have her own income to support her family three years ago she decided to start her own business selling shoes, blouses, pants, sandals, shirts, jeans and shorts.  She is a hard-working woman, and sells merchandise as a street vendor, visting her customers daily.   

Carminda has assisted her business with several loans with the same organization, obtaining nine loan cycles with the current one, which is for 21,000 lempiras.  With this money she plans to buy pants, shirts and shoes for men since a period of high sales is approaching.  Her goal is to grow as a business person, succeed in having her own business location and give her daughters a good education.

loans.use: to buy men's pants, shirts and shoes to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a new Irrigation system in the farm.

loans.name: Rina Damaris

texts.es: Rina tiene 26 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hijo de 5 años de edad y su compañero de vida. Rina se gana la vida por medio de la compra y venta de chatarra. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que junto a su compañero de vida llevan el sustento a su hogar. Nuevamente solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en esta ocasión en la mejora del techo de su vivienda dado que se encuentra en mal estado. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, madera, hierro, polines y pagará la mano de obra para la reparación del techo. Agradece el apoyo que recibió en el pasado para su negocio de chatarra.
texts.en: Rina, 26, lives with her husband and 5-year old son.  She earns a living buying and selling scrap metal.  She and her husband work hard to maintain their little family.  Rina is applying for a new FUSAI loan that she will use to fix her roof.  The roof is in a bad state now and needs to be repaired.  She will use the loan to pay for the labor and roofing materials she needs to carry out the work.  Rina wants you to know too that she is grateful for your past support in helping her to build her scrap metals business.

loans.use: to fix her roof.

loans.name: Anita Del Rocio

texts.es: Anita es una señora casada, tiene 5 hijos, todos viven con ella pero son 4 los que asisten a algun centro educativo, su esposo trabaja en una mecánica, Anita se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo, como son cremas para el cuidado de la piel, perfumes, cosméticos  entre otros, el crédito lo necesita para comprar cosméticos y sus demás productos que ofrece, la aspiración de Anita es mejorar sus ventas para aumentar sus incrementar sus ingresos y por medio de este darles a sus hijos lo necesario para que  estudien y lleguen a tener su profesión y un buen trabajo.
texts.en:
Anita is a married woman. She has 5 children, all of whom live with her, but only 4 attend an educational center. Her husband works as a mechanic. Anita makes a living selling products by catalog, such as creams for skin care, perfumes, and cosmetics, among other things.

She needs a loan to buy cosmetics and the other products that she offers. Anita's dream is to improve her sales in order to increase her earnings and, in this way, to give her children what they need to study so that one day they can have careers and good jobs.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline, age 37, is from Baybay Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and has two children. PMPC supported her by providing the capital to start her fish-vending business in 2013. She sold one lot of fish at a time, helping the family survive. She gives her best efforts in order to sell all her fish continuously.
 
Evangeline is now trying to expand her fish-vending business and has also decided to venture into swine production with a small piggery. She presented her project proposal to Paglaum MPC to finance the project and has applied for a loan of 8,000 PHP. She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs. In addition, she wanted her business to be well known and well managed for her loyal customers. With her extra income, she wishes to send her children to school so they may have stable careers.

loans.use: to buy bags of feed for swine

loans.name: Bertha Fanny

texts.es: Fanny tiene 45 años, ella esta casada  y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 2 aun se encuentran estudiando, su esposo trabaja de chofer, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y a cultivar pequeños huertos de papas y otros productos propios de su tierra, Fanny necesita el crédito en la compra de pollos para ponerlos en un galponcito que ella misma construyo para criar a sus animaletos, la aspiración de Fanny  es readecuar sus galpones  para poder criar pollos en mayor cantidad y asi tener mas ingresos para darles el estudio a sus hijos
texts.en:
Fanny is 45 years old, married, with 4 children, of whom two are in school.  Her husband works as a chauffeur.

 Fanny works at raising small animals and growing a garden of potatoes and other products that do well in the soil in their area.  Fanny needs the loan to buy chickens to place in a shelter she herself built for nurturing small birds or animals.    Fanny's goal is to improve her animal shelters in order to care for chickens in a larger quantity and thus have more income to provide her children an education.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Merrylou

texts.en:
Merrylou makes a living through her retailing business. She sells dry goods and ready-to-wear items such as Avon, Natasha and MSE products and earns a promising income to support her family. 

She joined PMPC to gain access to capital.  She wants to increase her inventory and requests a loan to purchase stock items to sell. Merrylou hopes to sustain her business and dreams of sending all her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock items.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is from Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. He is 55 years old and has 3 children. 

He joined Paglaum MPC and he appreciates the programs and services of the co-op. He wishes  to help the family and has sold fish in different barangays in Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte for 2 years. 

He uses his motorcycle to reach the different barangays and sell fish. He needs additional working capital and requests 10,000 PHP  financial assistance from Paglaum MPC  to purchase fish. Through this, he hopes to increase his income and provide for the daily needs of his family.  He is happy to educate  his children which is his main priority.

loans.use: to purchase  fish to sell to increase his income.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is a single man who lives in  Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur with his parents. 

He has grown rice  to make a living for  seven years earning enough to support his family. He successfully repaid his previous loan that he used for their farm. 

He took a new loan recently to purchase organic fertilizer  to have a productive harvest and meet his needs. He plans to cultivate more rice fields and become a productive farmer in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Russel

texts.en:
Russel is a 27-year-old  married man with two children. They are currently living in a rural community. 

He earns additional income offering  transportation services within his village. He wants to improve the living status of his family and give his children a better future.  He needs  additional capital of 20,000.00 PHP to buy gasoline, spare parts, and accessories for his motorcycle. This financial assistance will enable Russel to continuously operate his motorcycle and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, spare parts, and accessories needed for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 39 and a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Anthony, a fruit vendor, and they have children still in elementary school. She manages a fruit stand and her income from the business helps with their everyday needs and expenditures, including the cost to school their children.

Josephine buys fresh fruit such as lanzones, rambutans, and calamansi, and her husband sells them. Lanzones are a famous fruit commonly grown in Southeast Asia like the Philippines. They are rich in vitamins which help keep skin healthy and boost the immune system. Rambutans are naturally red in color but sometimes are yellow or orange; research has shown that their content and benefits are similar to oranges and apples. Calamansi are small citrus fruit that are known to be a great source of Vitamin C, and their juice is popular for cleansing the body of toxins. Her fruit is marketable not only for its yummy taste but also health benefits. Josephine's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 24,000 PHP in monthly sales. 

While these kinds of fruit are always in demand, Josephine believes that sales will improve even more if she adds other food items to her selection. She is requesting a 35,000 PHP loan to purchase more fruit and to add processed meat to her inventory. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.
 
Josephine dreams to become more successful in her business so that her children can get the best education and go to college. She wants her family to continue to love and serve the Lord together. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and some processed meat to sell.

loans.name: Lory

texts.en:
Lory is a 49-year-old married woman with eleven children from Iloilo, Philippines. Lory has had a fishing business with her husband for almost 17 years. Lory earns additional income through her sari-sari or variety store business. 

Lory has decided to borrow from CEVI to buy new fishing nets and canned goods, noodles, soap, detergent, soda, and beverages. A loan could really help her to improve her store and fishing business. Lory also wants to save money for the school expenses of her children  to provide better education and learning opportunities.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and canned goods, noodles, soap, detergent, soda and beverages.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma has repaid  her previous loan which she used for her business. She has had a retail herbal medicines and food supplements business for ten years, and she earns well from this. She sustains all her needs through her business and helps her family. She also works hard and is determined to have a better income.

To improve sales, Gemma requests 30,000 PHP to purchase more quantities of coffee and herbal products to expand her product inventory. She sincerely expresses her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Gemma hopes that she and her family will be financially secure. She dreams of growing her business and she also desires to engage in other business activities. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work  and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for herbal medicines and food supplements to sell.

loans.name: Elina

texts.en:
Elina, a 28-year-old married mother blessed with six children, has had a fish selling business in Mombasa for the past year. She has requested this loan to buy more stocks of fish to sell, and will use the anticipated profits to buy more fish for her enterprise.

This is Elina's first loan term from VisionFund Kenya. In future she hopes to have a successful business as well as a happy family.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of fish to sell.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio, a responsible father, is from the city of Maloro, Tangub. He has been a welder for 7 years and supports his family through his welding shop.  He earns 15,000.00 PHP each month. 

He has requested a loan to purchase additional equipment for his welding shop. Rogelio has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Rogelio hopes to expand his shop by offering other services like radiator repair.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment for his welding shop.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne, 24, is married and has 2 children. She has run a tailoring business  for 6 years. 

She plans to use this loan to buy  textile materials, thread, and buttons for sewing blouses, shorts, trousers, skirts, and school uniforms to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

This is her fourth loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she successfully repaid her previous loans.   Her future hopes are to grow her business, be successful, and have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a specialized sewing machine so she can take on more work

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is a 52-year-old widow with four children.  She became a member of Paglaum MPC in 2008 and took several loans. She successful repaid them. 

Cresencia has a shop to provide manicures, pedicures and spa services. This is her primary source of income, Cresencia has been in this business for almost five years. 

She is now supervising the renovation of her home and hopes to live comfortably.  She will use the loan to purchase a new roof. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record.  She is thankful that the financing of her business was supported by PMPC.

loans.use: for renovate her house.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for ten years and she earns well from this. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her child. She had to work hard, with the determination of having better income, to provide their child with better education. 

To improve sales, Mary Grace would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 50,000, she could purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Mary Grace hopes to grow her business and wishes to have her own place for her store. She also dreams that her child will be able to complete his schooling. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 25 year old woman married to John, who adds additional income to support their family.  They are blessed with three children.  Lilian has been a tailor for a period of four years, earning an income of KES.10,000 at the end of every month.

Lilian was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES.20,000.  She intends to buy threads, needles and materials to add to her current stock, which is running out.

Lilian plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees to her children and hopes to become a successful businesswoman with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy threads, materials, needles and materials

loans.name: Alicia De Jesus

texts.es:
Alicia, ha optado por montar un negocio de comidas cerca a su casa ubicada en el municipio de Medellín, en este negocio vende pasteles de pollo, empanadas, buñuelos, entre otros.

Alicia trabaja todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta la 1 de la tarde, es una mujer muy responsable, juiciosa y aplicada con su negocio.

Entre sus sueños más latentes esta el poder tener un restaurante en el que ofrezcan distintos tipos de alimentos y puede ofrecer empleos.

Ella pide un aliento económico para capitalizar su negocio y comprar insumos como pollo, aceite, harina, entre otros, además de realizar mejoras a su sitio de trabajo.

El crédito impactara su vida y su negocio de un modo muy favorable pues podrá cumplir con su sueño y tendrá una mayor variedad de alimentos para ofrecer a sus clientes, además de que de este negocio dependen sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Alicia has chosen to embark upon a catering business near her home in the town of Medellin. In this business, she sells chicken pies, pastries and donuts, among other products. 

Alicia works every day from 6 am to 1 pm. She is a very responsible, sensible and applied business woman. 

Among her most latent dreams, she wants to be able to have a restaurant that offers different types of food and can provide jobs. 

She is asking for economic help to capitalize her business and buy supplies like chicken, oil, flour, etc., and make improvements to her workplace. 

The loan will impact her life and her business in a very positive way because she can fulfill her dream and have a greater variety of food to offer to customers, as her two children depend on this business.

loans.use: capitalize her business and buy supplies like chicken, oil, flour, etc., and make improvements to her workplace.

loans.name: Edgar De Jesús

texts.es:
Edgar es un veterano con mucha experiencia en el campo. 

Es humilde y sencillo, tiene un gran don de gente y energía suficiente para poder cualquier cultivo a producir.

El tiene un cultivo de café el cual trabaja todos los días para vender sus cosechas en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Sonsón.

Gracias a sus años de experiencia y enseñanzas que le dio su padre desde niño, tiene plena capacidad para trabajar y para asesorar en estos temas a los demás agricultores de la zona que necesiten ayuda con su producción.

El solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, semillas de plátano y pesticidas, de esta manera inyectara capital a su actividad y mejorara sus cosechas de una manera significativa.

Tiene mucha fe en su negocio y grandes esperanzas en las personas solidarias que apoyan a los campesinos trabajadores

.Apoya a un humilde agricultor para que pueda sacar adelante sus tierras.
texts.en:
Edgar has been a farmer for a long time and knows what it takes to succeed.

He is a modest man with a gift for people and the energy it takes to make a living from farming.

Edgar harvested his coffee crop recently and is now working to sell it in the local market at Sonsón.

Thanks to his years of experience, beginning as a boy at his father's knee, Edgar is the go-to guy for advice about the farming business for other local farmers.

Edgar is applying for a loan that he will use to supplies--fertilizers and seeds, for example--that he needs for his next crop.  The investment will allow him to carry on his farming business and significantly improve his harvest.

Edgar is optimistic about his business and has great hopes of the people that are helping him and the other hard-working farmers here.

Please support this modest man so that he can continue working his land.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Dashdavaa

texts.en: Mr. Dashdavaa, 47 years old, lives with his wife in Erdenet, third largest city of Mongolia. He has been working as maintenance engineer at a mining company since 2000. His wife is a janitor and works at a private firm. Their son studies at technology university in Ulaanbaatar, while their daughter studies medicine at university in China. Mr. Dashdavaa is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to pay tuition fee of his daughter. As a result, his daughter will study hard without worrying about tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay tuition fee of his daughter

loans.name: Koemyek

texts.en: Koemyek is a 21 year-old student at a university. She lives with her parents in Tbong Khmum province, Cambodia. Due to a lack of financial support, Koemyek would like to request a loan to pay for her tuition fees. This loan will help her graduate. In the future, she is going to find a good job in any private company in the city.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees

loans.name: Numan

texts.en:
Numan is an 18-year-old single young man from the city of Rafah. His father is employed in a local firm and earns a low income which is the only source of income for the family. 

Numan is a student is his first year and studies medical analysis. He would like to finish his studies and find a job in a medical lab. 

Numan requested a loan from FATEN to buy a new laptop for his studies. This loan will help Numan to do his home work and write the reports easily.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Chandugu

texts.en:
Chandugu has operated a retail shop in the town of Mombasa for 1 year. He is 24 years old, married and has 2 children.

He will use this loan to buy flour, rice, and cooking oil. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in the future, he hopes to have a prosperous business and a happy family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of goods for sell.

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
Generosa is a 59-year-old married woman with four adult  children. She has been is a member in good standing  of PMPC for four years. 

Generosa is very hardworking and has always been known to provide the best for her family. She and her husband have been  farmers for 16 years and plant rice. Their monthly  income is 8,000. Generosa wants to increase sales and has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer and other items so that she can  continue to put bread on the table.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 27-year-old married man from the city of Gaza. He lives with his wife and child in a very simple house. Mohammad owns a small grocery store in the city to sell rice, sugar, and oils. it is a good business and provides a good income. 

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN to buy more products for his grocery store to resell. This loan will help Mohammad's sales and income to increase.

loans.use: to buy more products for his grocery store to resell.

loans.name: Amada

texts.en: Amada has an only child who lives with her in the village of Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She has been operating a retail store for over three years and is earning well from this business. Recently, she took a new loan from Gata Daku MPC to purchase rice and corn grits in addition to her stock in order to increase her sales.  She is hoping that with her revenue, she can expand her business to ensure a better source of income in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn grits in addition to her stock

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 49 years old and married.  She has five children, two of whom are in school.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Maria is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Maria has been raising pigs for nine years and also earns additional income from food vending.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 57 years old and married.  She has five children, one of whom is in school.  Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more canned goods, spices and other groceries.

Erlinda has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from restaurant.  Erlinda aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more canned goods, spices and other groceries.

loans.name: Ana Del Rocio

texts.es: Ana es una señora casada, tiene 3 hijos de 14, 17 y 21 años de edad que están estudiando, su esposo trabaja de albañil y en ocasiones se va por contratos de un mes y en ese tiempo no mira a su familia, Ana se dedica a vender papas en los días de feria de las ciudades mas cercanas , y los demás días trabaja cuidando una niña, Ana  va a invertir el crédito en la compra de papas para revender en su puesto en el mercado y espera tener mejores ventas, la aspiración de ella es atraer mas clientela para que  mejoren sus ventas y por medio de todo el esfuerzo suyo y de su esposo comprar una casa
texts.en:
Ana is a married woman with 3 children aged 14, 17 and 21 who are all studying. Her husband is a builder and is sometimes contracted for a month and during time does not see his family.
Ana sells potatoes on market days in the closest cities, and other days, looks after a young girl.
Ana will invest the loan to buy potatoes for resale on her market stall and hopes to have better sales. Her aspiration is to attract more customers to improve sales and through all her and her husband's efforts, buy a house of their own.

loans.use: to buy potatoes.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth has repaid her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for ten years and she earns well. She has 4 children who attend school and they requires more effort to provide for their needs. She had to work hard and is determined to have a  better income and  provide her children with better education. 

To improve sales, Lilibeth would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She will use 20,000 PHP to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. She sends her thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Lilibeth hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies. 

*All CCT community partners /clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Lorife

texts.en:
Lorife is 29 years old and operates a Sari-Sari store (Grocery Store) business in the city of  Tangub.  she is married and has 3 children. Her husband works in an oil company. 

Lorife decided to start a transportation business for added income and she acquired a vehicle through installment basis. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales everyday.  She requests a loan to pay for a motorcycle franchise and license. She dreams of owning several motor units to provide for the family.

loans.use: to pay a motorcycle franchise and license.

loans.name: Tsagaantsooj

texts.en:
Tsagaantsooj, 52 years old, lives with her husband in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. She has been working as a quality inspector at a carpet factory since 1982. Her husband works as electrician at a power plant. Two of their daughters are married and live on their own. Their youngest daughter studies at the university in Ulaanbaatar (the capital city of Mongolia). 

She requests 2,000,000 MNT to buy planks to fence her land. After fencing her land, she will grow vegetables for home use and won't need to buy vegetables from other sources.

loans.use: to fence her land in order to grow vegetables.

loans.name: César Augusto

texts.es:
El trabajo del campo es una de las labores más difíciles hoy en día por el gran esfuerzo que se debe hacer para progresar, pero cesar es un hombre que nunca se ha rendido a pesar del clima o las circunstancias que puedan pasar, el siempre está dispuesto a conseguir los recursos para su familia.

Se levanta desde primera hora de la mañana para desplazarse a distintas fincar para cumplir con obligaciones laborales. 

Este oficio lo alterna con la venta de leche que obtiene de sus propias vacas y adicional a esto tiene un negocio pequeño de cría de aves.

El desea aumentar su capital de trabajo para garantizar el sostenimiento de sus negocios y es esta la razón que lo lleva a solicitar un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de insumos una ternera y materiales para construir un galpón para sus pollos.
texts.en:
Working on the land is one of the hardest jobs there is these days because of the great effort you have to make to progress. However, Cesar is a man who never gives up despite the weather or situations that happen. He always manages to meet the requirements of his family.

He gets up very early in the morning to travel to the various farms where he works. As well he sells milk that he gets from his own cows, and he also has a small business raising poultry.

Now Cesar is seeking a loan to strengthen his various businesses. He wishes to buy a calf and construction material to build a shed for his chickens.

loans.use: Buy a calf and construction supplies to build a shed for his chickens

loans.name: Johana Andrea

texts.es:
La señora Johana desde muy joven se dedico a las funciones del campo tales como agricultura y ganadería, actividades que le enseño su padre para que saliera adelante en su vida.

Hoy en día su actividad principal es la agricultura y la ganadería y tiene como objetivo mejorar su capital comprando algunos lotes de ganado que le permitan abastecerse y generar mejores ingresos, y esta es la razón por la cual solicita un préstamo.

Es madre responsable y amorosa con su hijo, vive en una finca con el y su esposo quien ha sido su más grande compañía.

Sueña con poder otorgarles a sus hijos una educación de calidad para que más adelante se puedan defender solos y sean independientes.

Todos los días asiste su negocio y procura por hacer las cosas muy bien.
texts.en:
Johana has worked in the field since she was very young, with things such as agriculture and livestock activities that her father taught her and has helped her later in life. 

Today, her main work is agriculture and livestock and she aims to improve her capital by buying some lots of cattle and supplies that will allow her to generate more income, and this is the reason why she is applying for a loan. 

She is a responsible and loving mother of a son. She lives on a farm with her ​​husband who has been her greatest company. 

She dreams of giving her children a quality education so that later they can succeed and be independent. 

She works every day and tries to do things very well.

loans.use: buy some lots of cattle and supplies that will allow her to generate more income.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita, a widow, works as a babysitter in the city of Garang, Tangub. She joined Paglaum MPC in 2008 and actively participated the various programs and services offered by the Co-op.

 Margarita has decided to start a transportation business and she acquired a vehicle through installment basis; her son is the driver. Margarita hopes to have a stable income because she could  not be a baby sitter for the the rest of her life. 

She applied for 10,500 PHP to pay for her motor franchise and license. Margarita prays that her business will grow and wishes to own additional vehicles  to increase her income and provide for her family and grand children.

loans.use: to pay for her motor franchise and license.

loans.name: Nigeria Group

texts.en:
Ester, who is 33 years old, is not married and has twin boys who are at school. She is a businesswoman managing a genge selling fruits, vegetables, rice and other foods. She has been in this project for one and half years now. She wakes up very early in the morning(4am) when she boards a bus to the market to buy stocks for her genge. It's so hard, especially waking so early everyday, but she has to do so for her family. Ester's business ends at 8pm each working day.  She is able to realize a fair monthly profit. 

For the sake of improving her genge, she approached Tujijenge as Kiva partner to request business financial support. Her desire is to improve business and family, to be able to build a house and manage a big genge. This is her third credit request since she has been with Tujijenge. She managed to repay all previous loans successfully. Ester used these credits to maintain her business and covered school fees for her kids. She is the only parent responsible with her family, makeing sure that meals, medical and shelter expenses are covered. With a struggle, she managed to get an extra income which she used to buy a home TV,DVD deck and covered hospital expenses. She will use this credit to buy fruits and vegetables to resell. 

Ester will share this loan with her group, NIGERIA, consisting of six members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is 30 years old. He is married and has four children between 10 and 3 years.  Three of them go to school. He has a shop and has been running a business for the past five years. With the loan, he would like to buy more rice, sugar and millet for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and millet to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
This is Norma, 58, resident of Manila City, Philippines. She is a widow and she manages their own household while operating a business. She also has a child who is supporting and helping her with their everyday expenses. She works hard to sustain herself and continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Norma operates a mini drug store business. What she basically does is buy generic medicines from the company, sell them piecemeal with a little profit. Products can range from vitamins to pain relievers and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of medicine products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Norma hopes that her business will continue to be successful. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional medicine products to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is 63 years old and married.  She has three children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Alejandra is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Alejandra has been raising pigs for 18 years and also earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Norma Liliana

texts.es: A sus 23 años  de edad Liliana es casada y tiene 2 hijas de 2 y 6 años de las mismas que la mayor asiste a la escuela, su esposo trabaja en una vulcanizadora arreglando llantas, son 2 años que criando chanchos, dice que  empezó con el anterior crédito que lo otorgo Fodemi, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos, lo que Liliana espera de este negocio es que le deje  buenas ganancias para seguir adelante dándole a sus hijas la vestimenta salud y sobre todo la educación para que tengan un buen futuro.
texts.en: At 23 years of age, Liliana is married and has two daughters, ages two and six, and the eldest of the two goes to school. Her husband works in a shop repairing tires. She has raised pigs for two years, and she says that she started with the previous loan that Fodemi granted her. She is going to invest the loan in the purchase of pigs. What Liliana hopes from this business is that it allows her better earnings to get ahead, giving her daughters the clothing, health, and above all, the education so that they may have a good future.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Carla Patricia

texts.es:
Carla es una joven mujer de 19 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la fabricación y venta de chocolates artesanales.
Ella es independiente, emprendedora, inteligente, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ‘El Torno’ un sitio caracterizado por el creciente comercio en todas las áreas, allí se encuentran productores de todo tipo; desde industriales hasta caseros.
Carla es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo, su lengua materna es el español y conoce el guaraní por herencia familiar. Su negocio es la producción, elaboración y distribución de chocolates artesanales como; paletas con llamativas formas, bombones con rellenos de frutas, esculturas en chocolate y la atención de fuentes de chocolate para  todo tipo de ocasión. Su vida la comparte con su padres que siempre la alientan a seguir adelante, ella sueña con tener una tienda estable y un negocio reconocido, su deseo es ampliar su negocio realizando la compra de fuentes, moldes, muebles para tienda, y cacao por mayor.
Es por esos motivos que Carla solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para comercializar y ampliar su producción de chocolate.
texts.en:
Carla is a young woman of 19, single, and without children. She makes and sells chocolate. She is independent, enterprising, intelligent, responsible, and hardworking. Her business is located in the El Torno area, a neighbourhood known for its increasing number of commercial enterprises. All kinds of producers are found there, from industrial to home-based suppliers.

Carla is dark skinned, small, and has long black hair. Her native language is Spanish although she also knows Guaraní because of her family background. Her business is making and distributing different types of handmade chocolate such as ones with unusual shapes, some filled with fruit, and chocolate fountains for special occasions.

Carla lives with her parents who always encourage in her efforts to get ahead. Her dream is to have a stable, well-known business, so she wishes to buy fountains, molds, furniture for the store, and cocoa in bulk. It is for these purchases that Carla is seeking a loan so she can increase her production of chocolates.

loans.use: buy chocoate fountains, molds, furniture for the store, and cocoa for her handmade chocolate business

loans.name: Afet

texts.en:
Afet is divorced.  Her husband left Afet with two children and since then she has raised her children alone.  Now she is living with her lovely family at Fuzuli region as refugees.  The family members are IDP’s(internally displaced persons) and have been in Fuzuli city for 22 years.  Afet has a daily products store. 

Today Afet is planning to support her business and for that she needs 2100 AZN(Azerbaijan New Manat) to increase the area of the store. She says thanks to Kiva organization and lenders for a loan and help.

loans.use: to increase area of store

loans.name: Emie

texts.en: Due to hardship of living, Emie helps her husband in gaining income to sustain the necessities of their family. She was engaged in cooking and selling street foods within their community. She aims to cook and sell more kinds of snack recipes but she does not have enough capital. For this reason, she wants to avail herself of additional capital of PHP20,000 to buy more fish balls, pork and chicken barbecue, seasonings, hot dogs, breads and ingredients for refreshment foods to sell. Being a kind and industrious mother, she believes that she will be able to make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more fish balls, pork and chicken barbecue, seasonings, hot dogs, breads and ingredients for refreshment foods

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a 42 year old, married, woman and a mother of five children from Iloilo, Philippines. She has been engaged in the fishing business with her husband for more than 10 years now. Fishing is the main source of living in their area. 

Marilou works hard to support her husband in their fishing venture. With that, she would like to take a loan from CEVI to finance their business. A loan will be used to buy materials like plywood, epoxy, nails, paints and pay for the labor to build a fishing boat. 

Marilou dreams of making their fishing business more sustainable and profitable so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy materials like plywood, epoxy, nails, paints and to pay for labor for building a fishing boat.

loans.name: Sheree-Ann

texts.en:
Sheree-Ann is 36 years of age, married with three children and lives in Bagumbang, Bonifacio. She's gaining a profit through her rice production business in addition to her husband's income. 

Sheree-Ann is in need of working capital for her chosen business. She asked for financial assistance from Paglaum MPC in the amount of PHP 30,000. The loan is intended to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer. She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs. 

In addition, she would like to own another hectare of rice field to increase her income. With her extra income, she deeply wishes to provide her children a good education.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam has a food stall in Mombasa town and has been running it for 14 years now. She is 49 years old, is married and, together with her spouse, has been blessed with four children.

She will use this loan to buy more stock of flour, rice and cooking oil for use in her business. This will enable her to serve more customers and make more income. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

This is her seventh loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loans successfully. In the future she hopes to have a successful business and a happy family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of flour, rice and cooking oil for use in her business.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
For the last 14 years, Aida has been selling a variety of second-hand and new clothes to her customers. She earns a monthly income of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). She is widowed and blessed with two school-going children.

She has applied for her third loan of 30,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya and intends to use the loan to buy more stock of assorted clothes for sale.

Aida will use the anticipated profits to provide for her family's basic needs. She hopes to grow her business to be successful.

loans.use: to add more stock of assorted clothes

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
As a married mother of nine children, Consolacion works hard to support her family. She has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines and also earns income from selling fruits. Consolacion is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle transportation business.

Consolacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 58 years old and married with one child in school. 

Rosita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosita has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rosita would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Morita

texts.en:
Morita is 44 years old and has four children.  She is married and has two children who are in school.  Morita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Morita requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Morita has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  In the future, Morita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal is a 23-year-old single young man from Al Yamon, a village near Jenin city. He has been working in his barber shop for the past few years. It is a very good business and very profitable. Kamal would like to improve his business and expand it in the future.

Kamal has taken a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new chair for his barber shop. By taking this loan, Kamal will be able to improve his business and attract more clients.

Kamal appears in the photo in his barber shop

loans.use: to buy a new chair for his barber shop.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon is 28 years old and lives in Labuyo, Tangub City. He is married, with one child. Gideon has a store that sells spare motor parts and accessories. He has had this business for four years. Just recently, he joined PMPC and requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to restock inventory for his store. 

In the future, Gideon hopes that his business will grow and be well known in neighboring towns so that he may have an adequate income to live a better quality of life and be able to generate savings for future needs.

loans.use: to restock inventory of spare parts and accessories for his store

loans.name: Novembrita

texts.en:
Novembrita is a hard working mother. She is 56 years old and married with 2 school age children.  She live in Sepac, Sapang Dalaga, Philippines. 

Novembrita want to help her husband through selling a variety of ornamental flowers.  She applied for a loan from Paglaum Cooperative to purchase additional seedlings of ornamental flowers and fertilizer. 

In the future, Novembrita wishes to own a flower shop.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of flowers and fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Linda

texts.en:
Ma. Linda, 55, a resident of Coron, Palawan is married to Romeo, a retired government employee, and has four children.  One is in high school, two others are in the elementary level and the other is already working. She and her husband manage their household and are partners, as well, in her business.  Her earnings from her business is great help in their daily needs.

Ma. Linda buys fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. She buys fish at the local fish port early in the morning. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness. Her store is located in a temporary fish market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php5,800 in sales every day.

To help continue and expand her business she is requesting a Php 45,000 loan. She will use it to buy more barrels of fish.  Coron, Palawan is one of the best islands in the Philippines. It not only offers the best beaches in the world but also offers a fresh and sweetest supply of fish. The steadiness of her earnings in her fish stall is a great help in meeting their everyday needs and for the schooling of her children.

Ma. Linda dreams for her business to flourish so she can afford to send her children to the best school until college. She also wants her family to lead a happy and quiet life. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

 *All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for barrels of fish to sell.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en: In 2012,  Cheryl learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Cheryl tried her luck in doing a business focusing on her rice farming activities. She feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Cheryl is borrowing another amount to buy sacks of fertilizer. This will help her rice farming income with a big boost. Cheryl looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Gina Fe

texts.en:
Gina Fe is 36 years old. She is known in the Tangub City area as a vendor of crabs and shrimp. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the co-op offers. 

She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks. She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for, that all her financing needs of her business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house.

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en:
Genevieve is 36 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 7 and 2 years, one of them goes to school. 

She is a decorator and has been working in the business for 4 years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more clothes, flowers and tents for decorations sales. 

The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in same business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes, flowers and tents for decoration sales

loans.name: Manar

texts.en:
Manar is a 21 year old, married lady from Alyamon, a village near Jenin city. She lives there with her husband and two kids; a boy and a girl. her husband is an empolyee in a local firm where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all their needs. Manar and her husband would like to buy all the things needed for the home. 

Manar took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank. By taking this loan, Manar will be able to provide hot water for her family without using electricity. 

Manar appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank.

loans.name: Donato

texts.en:
Donato is a farmer who settled for a living in the village of Bayabas, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 54,  has six children and has been a farmer for many years. He cultivates corn, coconut and other crops in order to make a living. 

He joined GDMPC in 2013 and had taken a loan to purchase manure fertilizer for his corn production this cropping season to restore farm nutrients and have a productive harvest. 

He wants to improve the general living situation of his family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase manure fertilizer for his corn production this season.

loans.name: Flordeluna

texts.en:
Flordeluna is 49 years old from Palompon, Leyte. She is married and has one son. For eight years now, Flordeluna and her husband have relied on the hog raising business and cooking local Filipino dish for her customers in the community. She usually cooks sauteed vegetables and vegetables with coconut milk which usually sell at lunch time and dinner. 

She is asking for a loan to buy different type of feed for her hogs such as starter feed, grower feed, finisher feed and also pay for the renovation and improvement of her eatery. 

She hopes that someday she can continue to expand her business and make her eatery more attractive.

loans.use: to buy grower, starter and finisher feed for her pigs and improve her eatery.

loans.name: Frazia

texts.en:
Frazia aged 33. She is married with 3 children aged between 7 and 2 years, two of them go to school. 

She sells charcoal and has been selling in a business for 3 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more charcoal for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa is a 27 year old mother who owns and manages a small retail store within her community. Due financial difficulty, she aims to improve her business and make it profitable in order to sustain their daily necessities. She wants to acquire more stocks of grocery items to sell but she has limited capital. For this reason, she would like to avail an additional capital of PHP10,000.00 to buy more stocks of canned goods, detergent soaps, assorted candies, seasonings, beverages, snack foods and soft drinks to resell. Through hard work and strong determination, Marissa believes that she will further improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of canned goods, detergent soaps, assorted candies, seasonings, beverages, snack foods and soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
A 37 year old married woman and a mother of two children, Aileen works hard to support her husband to meet the needs of the family. Aileen has been engaged in the fishing business with her husband for more than 10 years now.
Aileen also earns an additional income through her sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Aileen is asking for a loan to buy epoxy, plywood and nails for the fishing boat and additional stocks like canned goods, noodles, soap and detergents. In  this future, Aileen hopes of making her business so that it will become more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy epoxy, plywood and nails for the fishing boat and additional stocks like canned goods, noodles, soap and detergents

loans.name: Almend

texts.en: In 2010, Almend learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives.  She has been preparing for the post harvest operations of her palay in Sapang Dalaga. She wants to ensure that she will have ample time for the  threshing, drying, storage and processing of her harvest to make way for another cropping season. She presented her proposal to Paglaum MPC and took a loan.  Almend hopes to see all her children finish their degree and have stable careers.

loans.use: to pay for post harvest operations

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 36 years, married with 2 children. She live in Bonifacio, Calamba, Philippines. She is currently engaged in gardening. She enjoys herself engaging in gardening because she earns an income and helps support the daily expenses of her children. 

She applied for a loan from Paglaum Cooperative, to purchase additional seedlings and compost to expand her garden business. 

She hopes, that someday, she will supply the neighboring market.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and compost.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a 56-year-old widow who lives in Silangit, Tangub City. She is focused on her farming activities. She's earning an income by selling her harvest. 

Recently, she requested a loan to purchase fertilizer for her coconut plantation. In the future, Marcelina hopes to live a comfortable life and that her children will have a stable income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is married with five children settled for a living in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Her husband sells fish while she sells self-woven nipa huts in their village to make a living. She used to buy raw materials for this business. In order to have more sales, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase more raw materials for nipa making to sell in town. 

She hopes that in the near future, her business will expand and she will become one of the nipa hut suppliers in town.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for nipa making to sell in town

loans.name: Bemelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Bemelyn works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from charcoal selling. Bemelyn is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Bemelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Aregnaz

texts.en:
Aregnaz lives in Sasnashen village of the Aragatsotn region with her parents-in-law and husband. The family earns its living by running a farm. On the farm they keep livestock of cows, sheep, calves, hens and 12 colonies of bees. Besides agriculture, a teacher by profession, Aregnaz works at a local school. She hardly manages to take care of the household and help the family to run the farm. 

Realizing that agriculture is a very important source of income for the family, Aregnaz needs some financial support to enlarge it. She asks for this loan of USD 1500 to purchase a mother pig, and feed for the livestock. 
This hard-working woman, with great credit experience behind her, hopes for lenders' support and goodwill.

loans.use: to purchase a mother pig, and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Janeta

texts.en:
This is Janeta. Her previous loan was a big help for her business, as she was able to purchase products for her direct selling business. The loan also helped with her everyday needs and expenses.

She would like to apply for another 17,000 PHP loan. It will be used to buy additional supplies and merchandise, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her expenditures and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Janeta hopes that her business will continue to become successful. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. At the age of 44 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. 

She grabbed the opportunity to become a full fledged member of PMPC. She credits her capital that supports her gardening activities to the cooperative. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase seedlings and compost. 

In the future, Marilyn wishes to become a supplier of vegetables in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and compost.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is a married woman with two children, aged 11 and 8. She lives with her family in the province of Iloilo, Philippines. Dolores is a hard working woman. For the past 11 years, she has worked and helped her husband in their fishing business. This venture has provided for their daily needs, such as food, and paid for their children's education.

As of this time, she wants to improve their way of living. Dolores has decided to apply for a loan from CEVI to buy a new boat engine and plywood to repair of their fishing boat.

Dolores is hopeful that one day their fishing business will grow and generate more income. She also wishes to save money for the ongoing studies of her two children.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine and plywood to repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 43 years old and has three children.  Aida is married and all of her children are in school.

Aida is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Aida requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Aida has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed ten times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Aida would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Adeliphine

texts.en:
Adeliphine is 24 years old. She is married with 2 children, ages 5 years and 8 months. The 5-yr-old goes to school. She sells clothes and has been running the business for the past 3 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more shirts and trousers to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more shirts and trousers to sell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a 55-year-old married woman from Palompon, Leyte. She works the land. She grows and sells sweet potato and taro. She has been growing these crops for many years now. She also raises hogs to earn a living.  

To sustain her farming activity, Francisca requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy piglets, fertilizer and pesticides to improve her harvest and bring higher earnings. Francisca hopes to have a bountiful harvest and save for her youngest who is 17 years old. She is determined to make her business profitable so she can continue to support her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Amabel

texts.en:
Amabel, age 38, has always dreamed of opening her own shop to support her family. PMPC supported her opening of a shop that offers services like welding, vulcanizing, engine repair and others. 

She is married and lives in Labuyo, Tangub City. Recently, she borrowed an amount of PHP40,000 and used her loan to purchase additional materials and equipment for her shop. She is now on her way to repaying the loan with her new profits.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and equipment for her shop.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida lives in Ishkhanasar village with her retired parents-in-law, her husband and their 26-year-old son. 

For 25 years Aida and her husband have been involved in a farming business. They run a big and beautiful farm which includes livestock consisting of 100 sheep, 24 cows, calves, one piglet, hens, and 28 colonies of bees.
 
Her husband also provides tractoring and harvesting services to his co- villagers, using his own agro machines. Their farm is the only source of income for this family. They take care of it with great love and pleasure. 

Aida, like every farmer, is currently getting ready for the winter. She needs some financial support to invest in her agribusiness. The requested loan of USD 3,000 will be a big support for her to purchase forage for feeding the livestock. She and her whole family hopes for your support.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura, en su incansable búsqueda de una mejor vida y una mejor estabilidad económica, inicio con un negocio de arreglo de uñas y cepillado de cabello prestando su servicio a domicilio en el municipio de Itagui, Antioquia, un municipio donde el empuje y verraquera es un referente muy importante de los habitantes de esta zona.

Ella trabaja todos los días en horarios muy variados y siempre está ocupada en algún servicio ya que es muy solicitada por su buen trabajo.

Solicita un aliento económico para realizar la compra de una silla para hacer uñas y una lámpara, así podrá prestar un mejor servicio y podrá mantener a flote su servicio.

Hoy en día se siente feliz por el buen trabajo que hasta ahora ha realizado y que le ha permitido gozar de un trabajo más estable.

Con un crédito podrás apoyar a Laura a continuar con su proyecto de vida!
texts.en:
Laura, in her tireless search of a better life and better economic stability, started her business of fixing nails and brushing hair, lending her service from her home in the municipality of Itagui, Antioquia, a municipality where drive and tenacity are very important examples of the residents of this zone. 

She works everyday in very different schedules, and she is always busy in some service since she is requested a lot for her good work.

She requests economic support in order to buy a chair to do nails and a lamp, so that she will be able to provide better service and keep her business afloat.

Today she feels happy for the good work that she has achieved to this point and that has allowed her to enjoy a more stable job.

With a loan you can support Laura in continuing her life project!

loans.use: to buy a chair to do nails and a lamp, so that she will be able to provide better service and keep her business afloat.

loans.name: Annalie

texts.en:
This is Annalie, 35, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Michael, an engineer, and a mother to her two children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, Annalie is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Annalie operates an "Piso-Net" business. Piso Net is basically a merge of PC rental and Arcade rental services wherein customers can pay for the services by inserting coins into the machine. There is more need now than before for services like these as customers’ demand increases. 

Her main patrons are students who require her services for school assignments. She also has people who need to rent computers for business purposes, like writing a resume or creating office documentation, as well as people who would just love to surf the net and access a social network. 

Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 450 in profit every day. To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 9,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy an additional Piso Net unit for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Annalie dreams to give her family a better and more sustainable livelihood. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for an additional Piso Net unit for her business.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 50 years old and a single mother of 4 children. She has green grocery business which she has been running for the past 10 years. 

She plans to use this loan to buy more stock of tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

This is her fifth loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she paid off her previous loans well. Her future hopes are to grow her business and be successful, make more income and to educate her children to higher levels.

loans.use: To buy more stock of tomatoes, potatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah settled for a living in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, with her family. She has raised piglets in her piggery for many years and has improved her business little by little. She earns well from her piggery and she is able to support her family. 

As a new member of GDMPC, she borrowed a new loan to purchase feeding supplies to boost her pigs' growth. She is hoping to expand her business with her revenue from this investment.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies to boost her pigs' growth.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 57 years old and married with seven children. With six children in school, Lucia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lucia has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as soap, shampoo, soft-drinks, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Lucia would like to save enough money so she could both continue to send her children to college and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 42 years old and a married woman with six children. Four of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

She has a personal products retail business in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase items like body lotion, perfume, shampoo and other personal items.

Rosalie has been in this business for five years. In the future, Rosalie would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase items like body lotion, perfume, shampoo and other personal items.

loans.name: Khetam

texts.en:
Khetam, 48, is a married woman from Jenin city. She is the mother of two sons and six daughters. She has a restaurant where she sells light sandwiches and drinks. It has been open for the past two years. Khetam would like to improve her restaurant and expand it.

Khetam took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a grill for her restaurant so she can sell barbecue sandwiches. By taking this loan, Khetam will be able to improve her business and increase her sales.

Khetam appears in the photo in her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy a grill for her restaurant so she can sell barbecue sandwiches.

loans.name: Cristine Mae

texts.en:
38-year-old Cristine Mae is from Palompon, Leyte. She is married with  four children between the ages of 4 and 14. Her husband works as an electrician while Cristine Mae is engaged in selling clothes, sausage and fish intended for aquarium display. She is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks of clothes, sausage and fish. This funds will definitely improve her profitability since she sometimes run out of stock. Her income will be spent on her children's school fees and healthy meals for her family. 

In the future, she hopes to see her children successful.

loans.use: to buy clothes, sausage and fish for her aquarium.

loans.name: Gloria Piedad

texts.es: Piedad es madre soltera, tiene 29 años de edad y su hija 8 años y se encuentra asistiendo a la escuela, Comenta Piedad que se dedica a la crianza de vaconas y también vacas con cría que estén dando leche para obtener ingresos de la comercialización de este producto, Piedad va a invertir en la compra de una vaca para tenerla en un terreno donde su padre le hace tener sus vacas y no le cobra de la hierba, la mas grande aspiración de Piedad es mejorar su negocio para darle lo necesario a su hija ya que el padre de la niña no le apoya con nada.
texts.en:
Piedad is a 29 year old single mother. Her daughter is 8 years old and is attending school. Piedad says that she raises young cows and cows with calves so that she can make money by selling their milk. 

Piedad is going to buy a cow and keep it in a field which belongs to her father. He allows her to keep her cows there without charging her for the grass. Piedad's greatest aspiration is to improve her business so that she can make sure her daughter has what she needs, as the girl's father does not support her at all.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Con la ilusión de salir adelante y superarse, Yolanda desea montar un negocio de comidas rápidas en un local ubicado al frente de su casa en el municipio de El Carmen De Viboral.

Esta idea surge a partir de la motivación que le dio su hijo mayor que la impulsa para montar este negocio y así generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Aunque ella siempre ha querido ser independiente, nunca había tenido el valor de arriesgarse a iniciar con un negocio; pero ahora se siente con la fuerza y capacidad para hacerlo.

Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar todos los elementos necesarios para el montaje de su negocio tales como 1 carrito de comidas con freidora, insumos e ingredientes para la preparación de comidas.

Con estos elementos podrá iniciar con este proyecto y podrá cumplir así su sueño de ser independiente.

Con el apoyo a este crédito estarás impulsando las ideas emprendedoras de una madre colombiana!
texts.en:
With a desire for advancement and self-improvement, Yolanda wants to set up a fast food business at a place in front of her house in the municipality of El Carmen De Viboral.

This idea comes in part from her eldest son's encouragement to set up this business and generate income needed to support their household.  Although she has always wanted to be independent, she had never had the courage to take the risk of starting a business; but now she feels she has the strength and ability to do it. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase all of the things she needs to set up her business, such as 1 food cart with a fryer, supplies and ingredients to prepare meals. With these items she can start this project and achieve her dream of independence.  

By supporting this loan you will be supporting the entrepreneurial ideas of a Colombian mother!

loans.use: to purchase a food cart and ingredients to start her business.

loans.name: Dora Mariela

texts.es:
Dora es una persona muy trabajadora que gracias a su esfuerzo diario ha logrado sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos brindándoles una educación de buena calidad. 

Dora es madre soltera cabeza de hogar debido a que es viuda desde hace un tiempo y esto ha hecho que su situación económica sea muy difícil, pero con su negocio ha tenido una gran fortaleza y ha podido salir adelante. 

Desde hace mucho tiempo comenzó a vender productos de uso personal y cuando su esposo murió le tocó incrementar sus ventas para poder sostener todos los gastos de su hogar, y para lograrlo le tocó trabajar muy fuerte y luchar durante muchos días fuertemente. 

Actualmente Dora tiene unos grandes pedidos por parte de sus clientes y debido a que no cuenta con un gran capital busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal y responder a los grandes pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es salir adelante con su negocio y desde este poder ofrecerles a sus 3 hijos una buena calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Dora is a very hardworking person who, thanks to her daily efforts, has successfully raised her 3 children and provided them with a good education. 

Dora is a single mother and head of the household since she was widowed some time ago.  This has made her financial situation very difficult, but her business has provided strength for her to move forward.

Many years ago she began selling items for personal use and when her husband died she had to increase her sales in order to cover household expenses.  In order to succeed she had to work very hard for many days.  

Dora currently has some big orders from her customers and since she does not have much capital she is seeking a loan to purchase products to fill her customers' orders.

Her greatest dream is for her business to succeed so that she can offer her 3 children a good quality of life and better financial stability.

loans.use: purchase products to meet the large orders from her customers.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
