Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Роза обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку новой коллекции одежды. Расширение ассортимента товара позволит привлечь новых покупателей и сделать бизнес более прибыльным, так как Роза хочет достроить дом для ее семьи.
texts.en: Roza is 34 years old, married, and has two children. Roza has a higher education. Since 2009 she has earned her family's primary source of income by selling women's clothing. She has her own sales location, and her turnover is 700,000 som (KGS). Roza orders clothing to be delivered from wholesale sellers from the country's wholesale market, then sells it at the local market. Roza is known as a principled, honest, respectable and reliable person. Her monthly income is up to 50,000 som (KGS). To further develop the business Roza came to the Bai-Tushum bank for a 150,000 som (KGS) loan to buy a new collection of clothing. Expanding her inventory will allow her to attract new customers and make her business more profitable, which will allow her to finish building her family's home.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sale to expand her shop's inventory

loans.name: Daylin

texts.en:
Daylin is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She is from Concepcion, Iloilo. Daylin has been working together with her husband in their fishing business for more than four years now. 

Daylin is asking for a loan to buy materials, such as plywood, nails, hull, epoxy, and paints, for the repair of the fishing boat. This loan would be a great help for Daylin and her husband in improving their catch, which they will then sell to the market for a good price. 

In the future, Daylin hopes to make her business a successful one.

loans.use: to buy materials, such as plywood, nails, hull, epoxy, and paints, for the repair of the fishing boat.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
This is Grace, 34, a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Allan, and they have children who are still in the elementary level. She manages their household while operating the business. He works hard to continually provide income for their daily living expenses.

Grace operates an electronics store. She buys DVD players and speakers from a supplier and sells them per unit with a profit. Her regular customers are workers and employees in the community. She earns a minimum of 26,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales a month.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 35,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stocks of DVDs, speaker units, and TVs. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 
 
Grace hopes for her business to be more successful so she can provide the best education for her children until college.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for tvs, dvds, and speakers to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is managing a retail business near a school. Aside from selling grocery items, she also cooks native cakes for snacks to sell. But recently, she temporarily stopped cooking snacks due to a lack of capital. She wishes to have enough capital to continue cooking snacks to sell. 

She need to do it since she has two children who are in college. Agnes's husband is a retired government employee. At present her husband is engaged in a farming business. 

In connection to her wishes, Agnes is requesting a loan of PHP 33,000 to buy raw ingredients and materials needs in cooking snack foods. She will also use some of her loan to buy grocery items for her retailing business. Agnes will look forward towards the success of her business and her children too.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients and materials needed in cooking snack foods.

loans.name: Mwanavita

texts.en:
Mwanavita is a married woman; she has two children, all of whom attend school. Mwanavita owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanavita has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other firewood and charcoal operators.
 
With the Kshs 100,000, she wants to purchase 50 sacks of charcoal for resale to add to her stock. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 50 sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Milton Jose

texts.es:
Todos los días Milton prepara su taxi para empezar su jornada laboral, la cual le ha permitido superarse personal y profesionalmente desde hace 10 años. Gracias a su arduo trabajo y esfuerzo, está por convertirse en Licenciado en Comunicación Social a sus 38 años de edad. Su actitud proactiva y sociable, fue la principal causa de la elección de su carrera, donde se siente completamente seguro de su decisión.
Actualmente está llevando su curso de titulación, el último paso para concluir con sus estudios universitarios. Por esta razón solicita un préstamo para pagar su título de la carrera. Con este avance, podrá optar por trabajos acorde a su licenciatura. En sus planes está estudiar un posgrado para seguir incrementando sus conocimientos y así seguir tocando más puertas en el campo de la comunicación social.
texts.en:
Every day Milton prepares his taxi for the start of the workday.  This has allowed him to better himself personally and professionally for the last 10 years.  Thanks to his efforts and hard work, Milton, who is 38, is about to earn a bachelor's degree in communication.  His main reason for choosing this field was his proactive and social attitude, and he feels completely confident with his decision.  

Milton is currently taking his certification course, the last step to completing his undergraduate studies.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan to pay his graduation fees.  This will allow him to find work as a graduate in his field.  His plans include going to graduate school to continue increasing his knowledge so he can go further in the communications field.

loans.use: to pay his university graduation fees

loans.name: Marie Florence

texts.en:
Marie Florence is 35 years old. She is married with two children aged between four and two years. They do not go to school yet. 

She is a tailor and has been working in a business for eight years. With the loan, she would like to buy more buttons and clothes for tailoring. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest for the family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy more buttons and clothes for tailoring.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Concepcion, Iloilo. Melba has been engaged in the fishing business with her husband for more than 20 years now. 

Fishing has provided them the income that they need.  Melba is asking for a loan to buy materials for the repair of their fishing boat like plywood, paint and a hull. With this loan, Melba will be able to improve their daily catch thus allowing them to sell more to the market.

loans.use: to buy materials like plywood, paint and a hull to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Саодат добрая и жизнерадостная женщина. Ей 25 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Саодат окончила педагогический колледж и работает в средней школе своего района преподавательницей. Она всегда старается, чтобы усовершенствовать свои знания. Она хочет, чтобы ее ученики получили хорошие знания. С такой целью она поступила в Педагогический колледж. Саодат теперь и работает и учится. Она обратилась за займом, потому что ее муж получает недостаточный доход от выращивания сельхоз культур. Саодат запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Saodat is a kind and cheerful lady.  She is 25, married, and raising two children.  Saodat has graduated from a vocational school for teachers, and now teaches at a secondary school in her area.  She is always striving to learn and likes seeing her students learn in turn, which is why she enrolled in her teaching school in the first place.  She continues to study in addition to working, and is seeking a loan to help pay her tuition as her husband doesn't earn enough money from growing crops to help her pay.  She is counting on your kindness and charity.

loans.use: pay for tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goats to sell.

loans.name: Elius

texts.en:
Elius is 54 years old and married to Lidia.  They are blessed with two children who are adults. He has been running a quarry business for the last four years and earns a monthly income of KES.50,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	 		
He has applied for his fourth loan of 80,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan to buy more tools for quarry work and to add one casual worker so that he can meet the demand of his customers.                                                                                          

Elius will use the anticipated profits to invest back into the business and also provide for his family's basic needs. He hopes to grow his business and become financially stable.

loans.use: to  buy more tools for quarry work and to add one casual worker

loans.name: Manuel Jr.

texts.en: Manuel Jr. is single and lives with his parents in the village of Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He runs a cafeteria in town selling viands to make a living. He has been doing this for over five years after he finished studying. He chose to have his own business instead of applying for a job. He became a member of Gata Daku MPC and borrowed a new loan to purchase additional raw ingredients to prepare food in order to offer more to his customers . He is hoping that with this investment, he will be able to earn more income for the expansion of his business. He wants to have a restaurant in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients to prepare food in order to offer more to his customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make repairs to her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beams, galvanized sheet metal, doors, etc. to repair a small room.

loans.name: Mercy Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda esta casada y tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 10 años  que se encuentran estudiando, ella vive en el campo y dice que en este lugar la fuente de ingresos es la crianza de animales y el trabajo en el campo, su esposo se dedica, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para criarlos en una chanchera, lo que Yolanda aspira mejora su negocio y seguir adelante luchando para que sus hijos  tengan lo necesario y sean buenos estudiantes.
texts.en: Yolanda is married and has 2 children ages 5 and 10 that are currently in school. She lives out in the country and says that out there the sources of income are raising animals and working on the farm as her husband does. The loan will be used to buy pigs in order to raise them on a pig farm. Yolanda wants to improve her business and keep moving forward so that her children have what they need and are good students.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es: Jose es un señor casado y tiene 2 hijos  de 5 meses y de 6 años de edad, el tiene nacionalidad colombiana, vive ya 5 años en Ecuador y dice que en este país no existen conflictos y que se puede tener una mejor calidad de vida junto a su esposa e hijos, comenta que se dedica a la agricultura desde que era muy joven y que antes trabajaba al jornal y de ahí aprendió y se dedica a sembrar pequeños huertos de papas y arveja, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de fungicidas para tener sanos sus cultivos, mismos de los que aspira tener una buena cosecha y seguir sembrando en mayor cantidad todo para bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en: Jose is a married man and has two children who are 5 months and 6 years of age. He is Colombian, has lived in Ecuador for five years and says that there are no conflicts in this country and that he will be able to have a better quality of life with his wife and children. He says that he has made a living in agriculture since he was very young and that he used to work as a day laborer. He learned from this work and dedicated himself to planting small gardens of potatoes and peas. He is going to invest the loan in buying fungicides to keep his crops healthy, as he aspires to have a good harvest and to keep planting in greater quantities, all for his children's well being.

loans.use: to buy fungicides

loans.name: Fati

texts.fr: Madame Fati vit avec son conjoint et leurs 05 enfants à SOKODE. Le premier enfant a 25ans et le dernier 07ans. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente des ustensiles de cuisine , des poissons fumés et divers produits. Elle s'approvisionne au même lieu. Elle est à son quatrième prêt de WAGES pour pouvoir acheter des marchandises afin de satisfaire les demandes des clients. Madame Fati espère à l'avenir assurer une bonne éducation à ses enfants et agrandir son activité. Elle est âgée de 42ans avec 02ans d'ancienneté.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fati lives with her spouse and their five children in Sokode. Their eldest child is twenty-five, the youngest is seven.

As a profit-generating activity, she sells kitchen utensils, smoked fish, and various other products. She gets all her supplies from one place. This is her fourth loan with WAGES to purchase merchandise and meet demand from her customers.

For the future, Mrs. Fati hopes to guarantee her children a good education and to grow her business. She is 42 years old and has two years in the business.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils, smoked fish, and various products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized steel sheets, bricks and other materials.

loans.name: Assanatou

texts.fr: Veuve de 52ans,Assanatou malgré son age ne cesse de se battre pour subvenir à ses besoins.Pour cela, elle revend des petits cake qu'elle prépare elle - même à domicile. Elle est une ancienne cliente de WAGES et est à ses septième prêt. Les 6 derniers sont soldés sans aucun souci. Cet argent lui servira d'acheter du sucre, de la farine de blé et de l'huile. Le profit l'aidera à subvenir à ses besoins et devenir une grande fournisseur de petits cake.
texts.en:
Assanatou is a 52-year-old widow who, despite her age, keeps on fighting to provide for herself. To do so, she retails little cakes that she makes herself at home.

She is an old customer for WAGES: this is her seventh loan, and the six previous to it have been repaid without the slightest incident. This money will be used to purchase sugar, what flour, and oil.

Profits will help her provide for herself and become a notable supplier for little cakes.

loans.use: to buy ingredients (wheat, sugar, flour)

loans.name: Gnanyome

texts.fr: Gnanyome jeune femme de 25ans est mariée avec 01 enfant en charge. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente des céréales au marché de SOKODE. Elle sollicite un second crédit pour acheter des céréales. Elle espère s'occuper de sa famille tout en rendant pérenne son activité.
texts.en:
Gnanyome is a 25-year-old married woman with one dependent child.

Her business is retailing cereals on the market in Sokode. She is requesting a second loan to purchase cereals.

She hopes to take care of her family by solidly establishing her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda, a married woman, has been blessed with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. School fees are her greatest monthly expense. 

Hilda sells goat meat, a business that has been operational for over four years. Disease outbreaks causing losses are her major challenge.

Hilda joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business, and has requested a loan of Kshs 50,000 to purchase ten goats for her enterprise. She dreams of becoming a wholesaler of goats in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ten goats for resale.

loans.name: Maristela

texts.es:
Maristela, vive con su esposo y sus seis hijos, su nivel de educación es mínimo debido a la falta de recursos económicos de sus padres y la imperiosa necesidad de tener que trabajar a una corta edad para ayudar con el costo del hogar. Ella desde joven le ha gustado toda actividad relacionada al comercio y con mayor énfasis a lo que respecta la compra y venta de mariscos, actividad que considera sumamente rentable y accesible al vivir a cuatro kilómetros de la zona costera. 

Todos los días se traslada a tempranas horas de la mañana via autobús a la localidad en donde compra a pescadores artesanales de la zona pescado, quienes por la noche lo extraen del mar y es la señora la encargada de comercializarlo de casa en casa, dicha rutina la repite todos los días, siempre y cuando exista producto que vender ella lo compra para revenderlo, cuenta con el equipo adecuado para la conservación del marisco (hieleras). 

El crédito que solicita lo necesita para comprar pesacdo, camarones, langostas, conchas y curiles, debido a que no cuenta con capital suficiente para comprar mayores cantidades de producto; ya que sus clientes han aumentado y necesita tener mayor inventario para cubrir los pedidos que le realizan. Maristela es una persona sumamente trabajadora y que junto a su esposo han sabido sacar adelante a sus hijos inculcándole valores morales sólidos y esforzándose porque estudien y se preparen para poder tener mejores oportunidades laborales a futuro. 

Maristela tiene idea que después que pague este crédito, solicitara una de mayor monto para realizar mejoras a la vivienda (ampliación) ya que hace pocos meses uno de sus hijos se acompañado y quiere hacer un pequeño cuarto para que tenga privacidad de pareja.
texts.en:
Maristela lives with her husband and six children. Her educational level is minimal due to the lack of financial resources of her parents and the overwhelming need to work from an early age in order to help with household expenses.

She has enjoyed all activities related to trade since she was young, in particular the buying and selling of seafood which she considers to be highly profitable as well as accessible as she lives within four kilometers of the seashore.

Every day in the early morning hours she takes a bus to the zone where she buys from local artisanal fishermen who have returned with the night's catch. She then sells with door to door service. She repeats this routine every day, and as long as she finds product for sale, she will buy for reselling. She has the appropiate equipment for seafood conservation (ice buckets).

She needs the loan she is requesting to buy fish, shrimp, lobster, mollusks and clams, since she does not have the capital to buy in greater quantities. Her client base has increased and she needs a larger inventory to meet the demand.

Maristela is a tenacious worker and with her husband they have managed to provide for their children, instilling solid moral values in them and striving to give them an education so that they may be prepared and encounter better work opportunities in the future.

Maristela is thinking that after this loan is repaid, she will solicit a bigger loan to upgrade her home (enlargement), since a few months ago one of her children found a life partner, and she would like to add a small bedroom so they may enjoy privacy as a couple.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, lobster, mollusks and clams, since she does not have sufficient capital to buy in greater quantities.

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.en: Emmilienne is a 32-year-old married mother of three children between 12 and three years of age, all of whom go to school. She has been selling spare parts for two years, and has requested this loan to buy more spare parts. Emmilienne will use her business profits to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts to sell

loans.name: Khusrav

texts.ru: Хусрав очень добрый человек из сельской местности. Он родился в 1992 году. Хусрав после окончания средней школы не имел возможности поступить в университет, так как они жили крайне бедно. Хусрав помогал своему отцу по скотоводству и выращивания сельхоз культур. Хусрав в этом году успешно поступил в университет. В свободное время он подрабатывает разнорабочим. Хусрав таким образом оплачивает съемную квартиру и покупает продукты питания для себя. Он обратился в ИМОН за займом, чтобы оплатить за учебный договор. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Khusrav is a kind young man from the countryside.  He was born in 1992, and didn't have a chance to go to college after finishing secondary school as his family was poor.  He helped his father raise cattle and grow crops on their farm.  This year, he has successfully enrolled at a university, and works odd jobs in his free time to pay rent for his apartment and buy food for himself.  Khusrav is seeking a loan from IMON to help pay for his tuition, and is counting on your kindness and charity.

loans.use: pay his university tuition

loans.name: Hawa

texts.fr:
Madame Hawa, mariée et mère de famille, évolue dans le secteur du commerce depuis plus de cinq ans. Elle n’a jamais eu à bénéficier de crédit à l’IMCEC et veut actuellement acheter des chaussures, des habits pour enfants et dès fois  des bijoux pour revendre et pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle.
Elle n’a pas de charges et les bénéfices de son activité lui servent à renforcer son capital. 
Hawa aimerait réaliser un jour son projet d’ouvrir une grande boutique de ventes de produits cosmétiques. Elle pense pouvoir y réussir avec l’appui de l’IMCEC.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hawa is married and a mother. She has been in retail for over five years. She has never benefited from an IMCEC loan before.

She currently wants to purchase shoes, children clothing, and jewelry to retail and meet her customers’ expectations. She has no fixed expenses and her business profits are used to bolster her capital.

Hawa would like one day to make her dream come true by opening a large store of cosmetics. She thinks that she can do it with support from IMCEC.

loans.use: to buy shoes, children clothing, and jewelry for retail.

loans.name: Bakati

texts.en:
Bakari, a married mother of five children, all of whom attend school, owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, Bakari has owned a food stall business patronized by neighbours and town dwellers. With this Kshs 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase goods such as sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat. She dreams of opening a modern café in the future.

loans.use: to purchase goods such as sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Madiagne

texts.fr:
Monsieur Madiagne, s’active dans le commerce depuis plus de 15 ans. Il est marié et père de famille. Il s’est spécialisé dans la vente de produits agricoles, de tout ce qui est lié à l’agriculture. Il possède un petit espace dans le marché, où il exerce son activité. Il vient solliciter un crédit pour acheter des semences diverses, des intrants agricoles, et du petit matériel agricole comme des hilaires, des râteaux, des houes pour mettre dans sa cantine et revendre. 
Madiagne a de grands enfants qui l’appuient dans les charges de la maison, il s’occupe néanmoins de la dépense quotidienne. Avec les bénéfices de l’activité, il veut améliorer son commerce et élargir son espace.
texts.en:
Mr. Madiagne has been in retail for over fifteen years. He is married and a father. He specializes in the retail of agricultural supplies, dealing in everything agricultural. He owns a small retail space at the market, where he does business.

He is requesting a loan to purchase a variety of seeds, fertilizers, and small agricultural equipment such as harrows, rakes, or hoes. He will include them in his inventory and retail them.

Madiagne has grown children who help him with the household expenses; he nonetheless takes care of daily costs. With his business profits, he wants to improve his trade and increase his retail space.

loans.use: to buy products related to agriculture and meant for retail: seeds, fertilizer, and small tools.

loans.name: Fama

texts.fr:
Fama est une demoiselle qui s’active dans le commerce depuis plus de trois ans déjà. Elle est célibataire sans enfant et vit avec ses parents. Elle a déjà eu à bénéficier d’un crédit à l’IMCEC. Elle veut un renouvellement afin de faire sa commande de poussins. Elle va acheter une bande de 100 sujets et de l’aliment volaille pour les nourrir pendant la durée requise pour qu’ils soient à terme. Fama possède une clientèle assez régulière qu’elle ne peut d’ailleurs pas satisfaire vu la quantité qu’elle élève.
Fama participe à la dépense quotidienne de la famille et s’occupe elle-même de ses propres besoins.
Elle envisage dans un futur proche, d’augmenter le nombre de sujets à élever afin de maximiser son profit et satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Fama is a young woman who has been active in retail for three years already. She is single with no children and lives with her parents.

She already benefited from one IMCEC loan. She wants to extend it to order more chicks. She will purchase one hundred of them, as well as poultry feed to raise them until maturity. Fama has a relatively loyal clientele that she cannot quite satisfy given ho many chickens she currently raise.

In the near future, she is considering increasing the number of chicken she raises to maximize her profits and satisfy her clientele.

loans.use: to buy chicks and poultry feed to raise them before reselling them.

loans.name: Veronique

texts.en: Veronique is 64 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 28 and 25 years, and both of them go to school. She has been in business for the past 3 years selling vegetables. With the loan, she would like to buy more carrots and cabbages to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more carrots and cabbages for sale.

loans.name: Sitora

texts.en:
Sitora is a kind woman from north Tajikistan. She was born in 1990. Sitora is married and is raising 2 children who are little. She is also a business lady who has been selling food items for more than 6 years. Sitora's food shop is located in the center of her region, and she tries to sell high quality food items. She manages the business alone.

Sitora’s husband is an entrepreneur who needs his car for a developing business. Sitora plans to repair her husband's car because it is broken, so she is asking for a loan of 2000 TJS. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To repair the car of her husband.

loans.name: Melissa Alejandra

texts.es:
Las computadoras y los cables han sido los principales elementos de Melissa, ella cursa el quinto año de la carrera de ingeniería en sistemas los días Domingo. Tiene 23 años de edad y esta soltera. Le gusta la carrera que escogió porque le brindara muchas oportunidades de trabajo, su papa le apoya en sus estudios. 
Solicita el crédito para pagar sus módulos y así poder obtener su título. El crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que así se podrá realizar profesionalmente. Dentro de sus metas está culminar su carrera y conseguir un trabajo para obtener experiencia. Su plan futuro es establecer su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Computers and wires have been major focuses for Melissa. She is in her fifth year of studies to become a systems engineer, and her classes are on Sundays. She is 23 years old and single. She likes the major she has chosen because it will provide her with many opportunities for work. Her father supports her in her studies.

Melissa is requesting a loan to pay for her courses to be able to finish her degree. The loan will be very helpful since she will then be able to work professionally. Among her goals are finishing the degree and obtaining a job to gain experience. Her future plan is to establish her own business.

loans.use: to pay for her courses to be able to finish her degree.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, zinc metal sheeting, and other construction materials

loans.name: Maitha

texts.en:
Maitha  is a married man with two children, all of whom attend school. He lives at his own house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, he has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge with the high cost of transportation but dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that he is requesting of KES 50,000, he wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ceramic tiles and zinc metal sheeting

loans.name: Diloro

texts.ru: Дилоро женщина с высшим образованием. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Дилоро работает в государственном учреждении. Она работает там уже более 7 лет. Дилоро является одной из активных работников. Она трудится упорно, чтобы зарабатывать на жизнь. Дилоро и ее муж стараются, чтобы их дети получили хорошее образование. Дилоро обратилась за займом в сумме 2000 сомони для покупки книг, тетрадей и других школьных принадлежностей. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Diloro is a woman with a higher education. She is married and has three children. She has been working in a government institution for more than seven years. She is among the more active staff and works hard to earn a living. She and her husband are trying to give their children a good education. She is requesting a loan of 2,000 somoni to purchase books, notebooks and other school supplies. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to buy books, notebooks and other school supplies for her children

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
Haydee, 43, is a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. Married to Zaldy, she has five children. Two are already working, two are in elementary school and one is not of school age yet. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment her family's income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs and to send her children to school. 

Haydee has operated a variety store for ten years. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this, she also has a business where she sells pre-paid mobile phones. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 500 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as fresh meat, sacks of rice, charcoal , soda and other grocery stuff. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings are her family's source of income to meet their daily expenses and to send her children to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Haydee hopes to maintain and grow her business, so she and her family can have a better life. She strives hard to give her children the best education possible and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Meoliole

texts.en:
Meoliole is 40 years old and married. Together with his spouse, they have been blessed with 6 children. 

Meoliole has a livestock trading business, and the business has been profitable. He plans to use this loan to buy more stock of goats and sheep to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

This is his third loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and he paid his previous loans well. His future hopes are to grow his business, make more income and be self sustainable.

loans.use: To buy more stock of goats and sheep to sell.

loans.name: Hilda Fabiola

texts.es: Fabiola tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera y  sus 3  hijos tiene 1, 10 y 15 años de los cuales los 2 mayores están estudiando, Fabiola se dedica 18 años a la elaboración de prendas de  vestir, comenta que arrienda un pequeño local para que funcione  su negocio, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de tela para elaborar ropa, lo que Fabiola aspira es readecuar  su negocio y atraer  mas clientela para mejorar sus ventas y seguir  trabajando y a la vez  cuidando  a su hijo pequeño y darles el estudio a los mayores.
texts.en:
Fabiola is a 34-year-old single mother.  Her 3 children are 1, 10, and 15 years old, and the 2 oldest are in school.  She has made a living making clothing for 18 years.  She rents a small space that functions as her business.  

Fabiola will use the loan to buy fabric for making clothes.  She aspires to readapt her business and attract more clients to improve her sales and continue working while taking care of her small son and giving her older children an education.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es: Gloria  es madre soltera, tiene 39 años y sus hijos 14 y 18 años de edad y que se encuentran estudiando, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales y también trabaja de ayudante de una señora que vende productos en el mercado, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para criarlos y después venderlos obteniendo algo de ganancia que esta sirva para darles a sus hijos lo necesario para que estudien.
texts.en:
Gloria is a 39-year-old single mother.  Her children are 14 and 18 and they are in school.  She makes a living raising animals and also works as an assistant to a woman who sells products at the market.  

She will use the loan to by chickens to raise and then sell to make some profit in order to give her children what they need to study.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent, aged 28, is married with one child, who is 3 years old and does not yet go to school. He sells food stuffs and has been running a business for 4 years.

After getting his loan, he would like to buy more beans and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Harvey Arafat

texts.es: El manejo de las computadoras le apasiona desde que estaba pequeño, poco a poco se fue interesando en los diversos componentes que estas tenían, es por eso que decidió estudiar ingeniería en sistema actualmente cursa el cuarto año de la carrera. Sus padres le ayudan a suplir los costos de su educación para que logre cumplir sus metas. Solicita el crédito para comprarse una computadora y también para pagar las últimas mensualidades de su carrera. La computadora le será de mucha ayuda para realizar sus clases prácticas. Sus metas son encontrar un trabajo en donde pueda aplicar los conocimientos adquiridos. Sus planes futuros son terminar su carrera y seguir estudiando lo relacionado a su carrera.
texts.en:
Working with computers has been Harvey's passion since he was little.  He gradually became interested in the various components of computers and therefore he decided to study systems engineering.  Presently, he is in the 4th year of his degree.  His parents help him to pay for his education expenses so that he can successfully achieve his goals.  

He is asking for a loan to buy a computer and also make the final payments on his tuition.  The computer will be very helpful in his computer lab classes.  His goal is to find a job where he can apply the knowledge that he has gained.  His future plans are to finish his degree and continue studying within the same field.

loans.use: to buy a computer and also make the final payments on his tuition

loans.name: Norizhon

texts.en: Norizhon is a young and industrious woman. She is 21 years old and married. Her husband doesn’t work anywhere. Four months ago, she began a new business. She sells fabrics in a local market. Little by little, Norizhon has improved the business. She is going to increase her working capital for the new business and with this aim, she is asking for a loan. Norizhon took part in a course ‘To Get Ahead’ from a women's organization and got a certificate. She is asking for a loan of 1,500 Somoni to buy fabrics for increasing her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for her new business

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard lives in Nizami village with her husband and 19-year-old daughter. 

On their farm, Alvard keeps two cows, two calves and hens. She also owns two greenhouses where greens and peppers are cultivated. Alvard also cultivates potatoes but for family use only. 

The requested loan is very important for Alvard to enlarge the cultivation of the potatoes and sell them in the local market during the cold season. The loan of USD 1,500 will greatly help Alvard to purchase a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse and potato seeds. 

She will be very grateful to the lenders for their support and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse and potato seeds

loans.name: Lucero Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LUCERO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Eulalia ella es soltera  tiene 59 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de materiales de construcción como ladrillos, cemento entre otros, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.  
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cementos y otros.
Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, venta de cereales, trabajadores de empresa privada.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partners belong to the LUCERO communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco.

One of the partners is Eulalia. She is a 59-year-old single woman who has two children. She combines her daily activities with the sale of construction materials such as bricks and cement, among others. She has been in this business for several years and does well thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day. She wishes to be able to continue working to support her family.

She is requesting the loan to buy cement and other materials. 

The other partners work selling groceries, cereals, and work in private companies. 

Eulalia thanks those that are part of this dream and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy cement and other materials.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a business making and selling brooms in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Nelia is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF in order to purchase raw materials for her broom-making business.

Nelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her broom-making business.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a single man, and he lives in a rental house.

He has had a motorcycle transport business for more than three years now. He is a very self-sacrificing man, and he operates from door to door. Previously he did side jobs, with which he earned his other source of living.

He is requesting the loan to purchase a secondhand motorcycle, and so meet his customers' needs.

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand motorcycle.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en: Nasiba was born in 1969. She is a married parent of three children. She always cares for her children. Nasiba always wanted to start her own business. She is going to realize her dream now. Nasiba took part in a course ‘To Get Ahead’ for women and got a certificate. Nasiba is going to start a business in animal husbandry. Her children will help her with managing the business. She will sell cattle in a local market after feeding them for some months. Nasiba is asking for a loan of 4,000 Somoni to buy cattle for her new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle for a new business.

loans.name: Sobira

texts.ru: Собира добрая женщина. Ей 23 года. Она замужем и воспитывает одного маленького ребенка. Она живет вместе с мужем, ребенком и родителями мужа. Собира и ее семья живут в сельской местности. Она очень трудолюбивая женщина. Собира окончила Педагогический Колледж и работает в средней школе учительницей. Она хочет усовершенствовать свои знания. С такой целью она поступила в Педагогический университет в этом году. Собира учится заочно. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Sobira is a kind woman of 23. She is married and has one small child. She lives with her husband, child and husband's parents in a rural area. She is a very hardworking woman who graduated from pedagogical college and teaches in a high school. She wants to upgrade her skills and has enrolled in a correspondence program this year at the pedagogical university. She is requesting a loan to pay her tuition. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita has been in her piggery business for many years in order to make a living. She sells pigs and she is one of the suppliers in town. Her piggery is doing well and she is able to sustain her business and support her family needs as well. She respectfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC that she used for buying piglets. Recently, she took a new loan to buy feeding supplies and construction materials to repair her fence to expand her piggery. She wants to expand her piggery to earn more for a better future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies and construction materials to expand her piggery

loans.name: Gisele

texts.en:
Gisele is aged 36. She is married with three children aged between 14 and 4 years; all of them go to school. She is a tailor and has been working in a business for four years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for tailoring. The profits from the business will be used to buy a new house.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for tailoring.

loans.name: Honorinee

texts.en: Honorinee is 42 years. She is married with six children between 15 and 2 years old, five of whom go to school. She sells foodstuffs and has been running the business for one year. With the loan, she would like to buy potatoes, beans, bananas and maize flour to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, beans, bananas and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Turgunbu

texts.ru: Тургунбу, 58 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Тургунбу среднее образование, с 1975 года в качестве основного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 7 коров, 7 лошадей, 100 овец и 30 коз, а также 2,06 ГА собственной земли, где Тургунбу выращивает арбузы и хлопок. Тургунбу известна, как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек. На сегодняшний день ее деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) от продажи молока, скота и преимущественно от реализации сельскохозяйственной продукции. В этом году Тургунбу решила утеплить и отремонтировать свой дом. Поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 1,850 долларов США (USD), который направит на покупку пластиковых окон и дверей на сумму около 1,000 долларов США (KGS), остальная часть средств будет потрачена на покупку строительных материалов для ремонта. Проведенные мероприятия по утеплению и ремонту дома позволят создать в доме тепло и уют и в будущем экономить на оплате за коммунальные услуги. В свою очередь доходы от бизнеса Тургунбу направит на дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Turgunbu is 58 and married with three children. She has a high school education and has been working as a farmer since 1975 as the primary source of income for her family. She currently has seven cows, seven horses, 100 sheep and 30 goats, as well as 2.06 hectares of her own land where she grows watermelon and cotton. Turgunbu is known as a principled, honest, fair and trustworthy person. Her business currently brings in a monthly profit of 35,000 KGS from sales of milk and livestock and primarily from selling her crops.

This year, Turgunbu has decided to insulate and renovate her house. Therefore she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of $1,850 USD, about $1,000 of which will go toward buying plastic windows and doors. The rest will be used to purchase building materials for the renovations. These home improvements will make her home warm and comfortable and, in the future, help her save money on utility bills. As for profits from her farm, Turgunbu will be able to put them into further development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase energy-efficient plastic windows and doors and construction materials to insulate and renovate her house, so that her family will be more comfortable and conserve energy

loans.name: Vedaste

texts.en: Vedaste is 32 years old. He is married with four children between 13 and 4 years old, all of whom go to school.  He has a shop and has been running this business for 10 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more rice, sugar, soaps and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar, soaps and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more goats and sheep to sell.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.es: Vanessa de 20  años  se dedica a la confección de bolsos y carteras para damas y productos derivados de estos. Ella inició su negocio en el mes de Junio del 2007, trabajando en un taller ubicado en el centro de la ciudad y posteriormente se fue especializando en varios talleres donde trabajó y finalmente tomó la decisión de independizarse, gracias a su gran experiencia. Ella fue muy ahorradora durante su  vida laboral dependiente y por eso logró su primer capital con recursos propios, comprando materiales e insumos y maquinarias y equipos  y apoyada por familiares, a quienes hoy, les ofrece el negocio la oportunidad de generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de sus familias.  El día laboral de Vanessa inicia a las 8 de la mañana y finaliza a las 6 de la tarde vendiendo de contado y comprando también de contado en almacenes del centro de la ciudad que son especializados en el arte que practica Vanessa. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una máquina plana y de codo, y materias primas e insumos, para el diseño de nuevos modelos de bolsos y carteras. Con esta inversión aumentará su producción y mejorará el acabado de las prendas que produce., haciendo de su credikiva una inversión que mejora las condiciones de su negocio, con el que tiene el sueño futuro de comprar un local propio , adquirir una vivienda ay tener un transporte para su reparto. Su mayor desafío es lograr fuentes de financiamiento y aumentar el volumen de sus ahorros, lo cual a futuro, cuando alcance sus logros, será cosa del pasado.
texts.en:
Vanessa is 20 years old and works making bags and purses for women. She began her occupation in June 2007, working in a workshop located in the city center. She later specialized in several other workshops where she worked and finally made the decision to become independent, thanks to her experience. She was a big saver when she worked for others and that is why she was able to collect her first sum of money to buy materials, supplies, machinery and equipment. She had support from her relatives and her business today generates income that helps support their families. 

Vanessa's work day beings at 8:00 a.m. and ends at 6:00 p.m. She buys and sells in shops in the city center that specialize in her type of products. She is currently applying for a Kiva loan. This is her first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo foundation. With the loan, she will buy a flat sewing machine, a double chain stitch sewing machine, materials and supplies to make new models of bags and purses. With this investment she will increase her production and improve the finishing of her products. Her Kiva loan is an investment that will improve her business conditions. Her dream is to buy her own store, a home, and to have transportation for her deliveries. Her biggest challenge is to find sources of financing and increase the volume of her savings, which in the future, when she achieves her goals, will be a thing of the past.

loans.use: to buy a flat sewing machine, a double chain stitch sewing machine, materials and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy material like cement, bricks and other items

loans.name: Malick

texts.fr:
Notre emprunteur s’appelle Malick, il est marié et père de famille. Il exerce le métier de chauffeur depuis des années durant. Il est sociétaire à l’IMCEC depuis 3 ans où il a eu à bénéficier de deux crédits payés convenablement, suite à cela, il sollicite un troisième qui va lui permettre d’appuyer sa femme qui fait du commerce de tissus et de draps. Malick s’occupe ses charges de la maison, mais il pourra aussi être appuyé par son épouse qui dès que l’activité génèrera des bénéfices, donnera sa participation dans la gestion du foyer.
Malick envisage de se payer un autre véhicule dès que ce crédit sera soldé ; il pourra donc maximiser ses revenus pour songer à acquérir sa propre maison un jour.
texts.en:
Our borrower's name is Malick. He is married and a father. He has been a driver for years. For the past three years, he's been a member of IMCEC (a Senegalese microfinance institution), and has properly repaid two loans. Now he’s requested a third loan that will allow him to support his wife who sells fabric and sheets. 

Malick takes care of the household expenses, but once his wife starts to make money, she could also help him manage the household.

Malick would like to buy another vehicle as soon as this loan is paid off. He will be able to maximize his revenues and start dreaming of buying a house one day.

loans.use: support his wife who will buy fabric and sheets for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Arpik

texts.en:
Arpik, a young agronomist, lives in Zorak village with her husband. This couple is engaged in keeping livestock. The current livestock the family owns includes 15 cows and 6 calves. Arpik and her husband sell the gathered meat and milk products locally. Using his own truck, Arpik's husband also provides transportation service to his co-villagers.
 
The requested loan of USD 3,000 is very important for Arpik to purchase grass as a forage for the livestock. This loan will enable her to feed the livestock during the winter season. 

Arpik greatly hopes for the lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for grass as forage for livestock

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 33 years old. She is married with five children between 14 and 5 years old, all of whom go to school. She has a shop and has been running this business for five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, lotions and soaps to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar, lotions and soaps to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 30 years old. She is married with one child who is eight months old. She sells vegetables and has been running the business for five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more vegetables to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús es una mujer trabajadora que luego de perder a su esposo ha tenido que salir adelante por sus propios medios. Ella habita en vivienda propia desde hace 33 años y se gana la vida elaborando y vendiendo queso fresco, además tiene crianza de gallinas las cuales distribuye en su cantón dos veces por semana. Jesús desea darle una mayor seguridad a su vivienda ya que su negocio de gallinas se encuentra en su domicilio, y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y hierro para construir un muro perimetral en su vivienda y así lograr que su vivienda tenga una mayor seguridad.
texts.en: Jesús is a hardworking woman who has had to get ahead on her own after losing her husband. She lives in a house she has owned for 33 years and makes a living by making and selling fresh cheese. She also raises chickens that she distributes in her canton twice a week. Jesús wants to make her house more secure, as her chicken business is in her home. For this reason she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in brick, cement, sand, gravel and iron to build a wall around her home so it will be more secure.

loans.use: to invest in brick, cement, sand, gravel and iron to build a wall around her home.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush lives with her husband in Vardavank village in the Kapan region. They both are engaged in agriculture. More specifically, Anush and her husband keep livestock of six cows, two calves and hens. Anush is a nurse by profession and works at a local medical center.
 
She needs the requested loan of USD 1,500 to be able to purchase a cow and an ox. Together with her husband, Anush works hard on her farm to make it bigger and more profitable. She is sure that this loan will bring success to her farm and she hopes for the lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and an ox

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush lives in Kapan, Syunik region with her husband and two sons. Her elder son has served in the army and came back last month. He currently works in auto repair service and helps his parents financially. 
Anush and her husband are beekeepers. They currently keep 25 colonies of bees and get high quality honey. This is the main activity that brings income to family, so Anush would like to enlarge their business. She asks for this loan of USD 2500 to be able to purchase 17 more bee colonies and enlarge the production of honey.  
Anush has previously taken a loan from a local financial institution, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to her hard work recently, she has been able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, Anush has now been approved for a loan, within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for 17 colonies of bees

loans.name: Maria Adela

texts.es: María de 44 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo, sus dos hijas mayores de edad y su nieto. En el hogar de María la principal fuente de ingresos es su negocio de venta de medicinas el cual realiza de forma ambulante en los cantones cercanos, además sus hijas y su esposo también aportan a la economía familiar. María desea construir un cuarto para la cocina ya que actualmente el espacio en el que se encuentra no es el más apropiado y es por ello que ha decidido adquirir un crédito para construir un cuarto para la cocina. Por lo anterior ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, hierro y pagar mano de obra para construir un cuarto para la cocina en su vivienda.
texts.en:
María, 44, lives in her own home with her spouse, two grown daughters and her grandson. Maria's household's main source of income is her business selling medicines door to door in neighborhoods nearby. Her daughters and husband also help support the family.

Maria wants to build a kitchen since the space she has is no longer adequate. She has decided to ask for a loan to construct a new room. She asked FUSAI to help her buy cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron and to pay for labor to build her new kitchen.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick, iron and to pay for labor to build a kitchen in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy floor bricks, cement and sand to put in a new brick floor in her home.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en: Adelina is 23 years old and single. She lives with her parents who receive small pensions and Adelina works selling shoes for a small salary just to earn a living and to help her parents. Now, she has decided to request a loan to renovate their house. Her parents never had the opportunity to improve their home in the past. She would like to get married and find a better job in the future and wants to thank the lenders for their support. She promises to pay on time and become a good client.

loans.use: To renovate their house, as her parents never had the opportunity to improve their home in the past

loans.name: Selvete

texts.en: Selvete is 36 years old and the mother of a 3 year old daughter. Although her husband is a construction worker, his salary is low and they live under poor conditions. Selvete works as a cleaner in order to help provide income to their family and even that is only enough to meet their daily needs.( Picture shows Sevete with her husband). As their toilette is in urgent need of repair, they have not been able to save enough money to fix it and she is asking for a loan or 500 euros for the renovation. Selvete is very happy for this opportunity because she is able to address some basic needs without having to ask others for money. Once she is able to finish the renovations, their living conditions will be improved and she hopes to be able to find a better paying job.

loans.use: To renovate the toillete

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabrics to increase her working capital

loans.name: Patujucilla Group

texts.es:
Florinda es una mujer de 55 años de edad, casada, madre de dos hijos, y su negocio es la venta de zapatos.
Elles es buena madre, emprendedora, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona sur de su ciudad, un sitio abarrotado por el comercio en todas las áreas.
Florinda es de tez trigueña, cabello negro largo, estatura alta, su lengua materna es el español y conoce el guaraní por herencia familiar (fila de atrás al medio, blusa floreada, pantalón color beige). Su vida la comparte junto a sus hijos que estudian en la universidad y su marido que también se dedica al comercio. Debido a la necesidad de mejorar sus ingresos económicos para ayudar a sus hijos a terminar la universidad, formó una banca de personas para solicitar un préstamo y prosperar en sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de ropa y zapatos de forma ambulante, ella junto a su esposo; cada día se dirigen a diferentes mercados y ferias de la zona sur de su ciudad, cargados de sacos llenos de su mercadería. Ella sueña con su tienda propia porque ya van 25 años que se dedica al comercio ambulante. Debido a la demanda que tiene ella desea aumentar su capital de trabajo y realizar la compra de zapatos de temporada por mayor.
Es por esos motivos que Florinda solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa y zapatos por mayor y con los beneficios ayudar a sus hijos a terminar la universidad.
texts.en:
Florinda, 55, is married and has two children. She has a business selling shoes. She is a good mother - hardworking, steadfast, responsible and dedicated. She has her business in the southern part of the city, an area crowded with commerce. Florinda has a dark complexion, long black hair, and is of tall stature; her native tongue is Spanish but she also knows Guarani through her family heritage. In the picture, she is in the middle of the back row in a floral blouse and beige pants.

She has two children who are in university and a husband who is also a merchant. She started a lending group so that she could ask for a loan because she needs more income in order to support her children until they finish their university degrees.

She sells clothing and shoes from door to door, together with her spouse. Every day they go to different markets and fairs in the city carrying sacks of merchandise. She dreams of one day having her own store because they have been selling door-to-door for 25 years now. Thanks to increased demand, she wants to augment her capital by buying seasonal shoes in bulk. For that reason, Florinda asks for a loan to buy shoes and clothing at wholesale, and will use the profits to help her children finish college.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes at wholesale so that she can help her children finish college.

loans.name: Arjeta

texts.en: Arjeta, 32, is the mother of three children between 11 and 14 years old. All three of her children attend school and Arjeta is able to earn a living by babysitting, while her husband works as a driver. Together, they have managed to build a new house since their old one was very worn and falling apart. However, they have yet to complete the house and need to level the floor and paint the home. She is requesting a loan for this work and is very happy for the opportunity from the lenders. She can’t wait to see her new beautiful home and reach her goal of providing a better environment for her family.

loans.use: To level the floor and paint her house

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel de 47 años  con una familia que mantener se a decidido realizar otro segundo préstamo porque la demanda de papas a crecido en estos últimos meses es por ello que ella quiere aprovechar estas oportunidades que se les están presentando en la vida, para poder sembrar mas papas en sus terrenos disponibles y también para que le generan más ganancias para ella y para el beneficio de su familia.

Cuando no tenía acceso a préstamos las condiciones de vida no eran adecuadas no producía casi nada de papas pero todo eso cambio porque  ahora cuanta con mas siembras de papas y las ganancias son mejores como antes y eso a podido cambiar un poco en las condiciones de vida de Raquel.

La inversión que ella realizara para el nuevo préstamo es para la compra de semilla de papas y fertilizantes químicos y orgánicos, para luego sembrarlas en sus terrenos disponibles, los cambios que ha obtenido Raquel son muy importantes porque en la actualidad tiene más siembras de papas.

Las metas de ella es la construcción de su propia casa para tener condicione de vidas adecuadas en conjunto con su familia y darles educación a sus hijos para que lleguen a profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
Raquel, 47, has a family to take care of. She decided to ask for a second loan because the demand for potatoes has increased in recent months and she wants to take advantage of opportunities as they present themselves. She wants to plant more potatoes on her available land so that she can make more profits to benefit herself and her family.

When she didn't have access to loans, her living conditions were not adequate and she wasn't producing a lot of potatoes, but all that has changed because now she has more potato plants and her income is higher. This has allowed Raquel to improve her living conditions little by little.

This new loan will be used to buy potato seeds and chemical and natural fertilizers, so that she can later plant on her land. Her goals are to build her own house so that her family has better living conditions,and to educate her children so that they can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and organic and chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Sefa

texts.en: Sefa lives with his entire family. He is a hardworking man who does a lot in order to earn a living and help provide for them. He works very hard to save for his future by working as a welder and owning a pool hall where people come to play billiards. For the first time, he is requesting a loan in order to add some extra snacks and beverages such as chocolate and candy in order to generate more income. He knows that he can sell these items to his customers and he will be able to satisfy them more because of it. He is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To add extra snacks and beverages such as chocolate and candy to his business in order to generate more income

loans.name: Moises Proceso

texts.es:
Mr. Moises describes himself as a  responsable person which has accomplish to grow his business and gain the confidence and support from many recurring clients. He is very grateful to those who help him to accomplish new goals. 
About Moises workplace, it is a metal shop located in his own house, and many of his clients are neighbors or people recommend it by them.  The metal shop is open  from 8 am to 7pm monday-friday. He is asking for a loan to buy metal scrap and be more ready to provide a faster service to his clients. He believes these will increase his sales and profits.
texts.en:
Moises describes himself as a responsible person who has been able to grow his business and gain the confidence and support of many recurring customers. He is very grateful to those who have helped him to accomplish new goals.

Moises works in a metal shop located in his own house, and many of his customers are neighbors or people recommend by them. The metal shop is open from 8 am to 7pm Monday-Friday. He is asking for a loan to buy metal scrap so that he is ready to provide faster service to his clients. He believes this will increase his sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy stock for the metal shop.

loans.name: Aferdita

texts.en: Aferdita wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan, which she used to purchase seven goats. Her goats enabled her to earn a living by selling the milk and the milk products and breeding them. She is very satisfied with the loan process and the results and has been able to continue to see success in her business. Now, she is requesting a second loan to renovate the stable. Her current stable is very old and damaged and she would like to be able to provide better conditions for her farm and business. She loves what she does and is very thankful for the opportunities that the lenders give to her.

loans.use: To renovate her stable

loans.name: Arsim

texts.en: Arsim is 26 and already married with two children. He lives in a very poor minority Ashkali community and earns a living like most people there by transporting goods for others. His wife stays home to care for the house and children, but she is optimistic and hopes to start working as a cleaner for a private residence. Arsim starts his day very early in the morning and returns home after a long day very late at night. He takes any opportunity he can to work or find ways to support his family. For the first time, he is requesting a loan in order to complete general renovations to his home, which is very old and unhealthy for living. He is very grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To complete general renovations to his home

loans.name: Zurafete

texts.en:
Zurafete comes from an Ashkali community, which is very poor and typically has high unemployment rates. She is the mother of nine children but still manages to work carrying fruits and vegetables while her husband collects plastic bags and iron to recycle for money. They both receive a very low income from their work but always remain positive. 

Now, she is requesting a loan in order to renovate their house. She promises to pay on time and hopes in the future to be able to start her own business. She appreciates the help from the lenders to provide her children more comfortable and better living conditions.

loans.use: To renovate her house to improve her living conditions

loans.name: Kumrije

texts.en: Kumrije continues to enjoy the success of her fruit business and has been fortunate enough to have a very bountiful crop this year that she will need to store and protect before she is able to sell it. Kumrije is asking for her fourth loan now to invest in her business by renovating her storage unit for the picked fruits. As with the last three times that she has borrowed, her return on her investment has been worth it and she has continuously seen her business grow and expand. She really loves what she does and feels very lucky to be able to continue to have success and stay in business. Once again, she is very happy with the Kiva lenders and all of their support for her and her business.

loans.use: To renovate the unit she uses to store the picked fruits

loans.name: Aliou

texts.fr:
Aliou est un jeune qui s’active dans l’agriculture depuis le jeune âge. Il apportait à manger à son père dans les champs, c’est petit à petit, qu’il a pu comprendre comment son père travaillait. 
Aliou est célibataire et habite avec ses parents. Il vient pour la cinquième fois solliciter un crédit pour acheter des intrants agricoles (semences, engrais..) destinés à l’exploitation de son champ. Après chaque récolte, Aliou prend en charge la dépense quotidienne pendant au moins un à deux mois, et cela grâce aux revenus récoltés. 
Aliou veut démarrer avec les cultures maraichères et envisage d’acheter une parcelle pour en faire un verger.
texts.en:
Aliou is a young man who began working in agriculture at a young age. He brought food to his father in the field, and over time he learned how his father worked.

Aliou is single and lives with his parents. This is the fifth time he's requesting a loan to buy farm inputs (seeds, fertilizer, etc.) that he will put to use in his field. After each harvest, he uses his revenues to take care of the daily expenses for a month or two.

Aliou just started market gardening and would like to buy a parcel of land to plant an orchard.

loans.use: buy farm inputs for his field.

loans.name: Hizri

texts.en:
Hizri is 32 years old and the father of three children. In order to earn a living, he has to work long hours in a local restaurant. He is grateful that the restaurant is very popular in his area and has a lot of customers since he earns a little more income through the tips that customers leave him. Hizri is asking for a loan to renovate his house, which he is not able to accomplish on just his salary alone. He has not been able to find anyone else to borrow from and greatly appreciates the support from the lenders.
 
The loan will help Hizri to improve his living conditions and offer a better life to his children. His goal is to open his own restaurant in the future.

loans.use: To renovate his house

loans.name: Mamerta

texts.en:
Mamerta has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for years and she earns well from this. She sustains all her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. She also works hard with the determination of having a better income.

To improve sales, Mamerta would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 10,000, she could already purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Mamerta wants her business to continue to flourish. She also dreams of having her own house. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a farmer. She lives with her in-laws, husband and two children. With the help of her family members, Anna runs a farm. It includes livestock (hens, pig, cows and calves), and they also grow different kinds of fruit trees (peach, cherry, apple and pear). 

The gathered harvest, Anna's father-in-law sells locally, thus gathering income for the family's living. 

Realizing how important agriculture is for their family, Anna would like to purchase a truck needed for the transportation of the harvest. This will make their work more cost effective, so Anna hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for a truck for transporting the agricultural products to the market

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 59 years old and married with four children.

Concepcion earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine lives in Yenoqavan village with her parents, brother and two children. She is a divorced woman running her family's small farm. On the farm, she keeps livestock of sheep, cows, calves and hens, and cultivates wheat and potatoes. Armine's brother helps her to sell the gathered harvest in the market. 

By applying for this loan, Armine asks for financial support from Kiva lenders to invest in her farm. She needs this loan of USD 1,200 to purchase  wheat seeds, to purchase forage for the livestock and to rent a tractor for land cultivation. 

Armine relies on the lenders' goodwill and support, and with the good credit history behind her, she hopes for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for wheat seeds, purchase forage for the livestock and rent a tractor for land cultivation

loans.name: Golap Mahila Samuha Group

texts.en:
Bina, Sunita, Gudiya, Kaushalya and Gayatri are a part of the Golap Mahila Samuha group. All of them are living in Sankarpur village, Deoghar district, Jharkhand.    

Bina is the featured borrower of this group. She is living with her husband and three children. Her husband is into agriculture and he also manufactures bricks. Bina helps her husband in her free time. 
 
Bina wants to increase the volume of business, which they are struggling to establish on a large scale. Bina is requesting loan to invest in her husband’s business. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, etc. for agriculture. She hopes to secure a good livelihood for her family and give a good education to her children.
 
Like Bina, other members are also seeking a loan to improve their livelihood. To improve their business on a large scale, they need sufficient capital. So they are seeking a loan, which they will invest in their respective endeavors. Your loan will help five hardworking and deserving families take a big step towards improving their livelihoods and lives.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for agriculture

loans.name: Usharani

texts.en:
Usharani is a homemaker from Dhupguri. She is 50 years old and the mother of one grown-up son, who was deprived of a high school education due to their poverty and now is unemployed. Usharani has a primary education. They live in the rural village Baroghoria in Jalpaiguri district.

Her husband, 54-year-old and uneducated Khelaram, is associated with paddy cultivation. Together with her husband, who takes care of the hardest maintenance chores, she works every day fertilizing and cleaning their cropland since it is the only source of income for the family. From a very early age Usharani's husband learned to work in agriculture with his parents, who taught him all about planting and applying compost correctly in order to avoid causing harm. The land she and her husband work on is their own. They are giving hard efforts and sacrifice in getting ahead and working independently. Usharani's plans for the future are to increase paddy rice production by purchasing more agricultural inputs. This is how she can cultivate paddy on a large scale.

The loan she is requesting from Kiva's partner BJS is to buy farm supplies (paddy seeds, fertilizers) to help increase productivity of her paddy crop. The aim is to produce better quality paddy and increase acceptability of her products to her customers in order to better her income to provide financial sustenance to her family. She has a dream of making a concrete-made house for them.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Aghavni

texts.en:
After successfully paying back her first loan, Aghavni now asks her second loan from Kiva lenders. The first loan greatly helped her to enlarge the cultivation of potatoes.

As Aghavni's family increased over this years (her son got married), the family's living costs also has increased. So to be able to enlarge her farming business, Aghavni needs to renovate her barn and purchase animals. The requested loan of USD $2,500 will help her to purchase three calves,10 piglets and partial renovation of the barn. 

She will be thankful to Kiva lenders if they support her loan one more time. As a very responsible borrower, Aghavni hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for three calves, 10 piglets and partial renovation of the barn

loans.name: Mujeres De Palabra Group

texts.es: Este es la Nueva Alcancía Comunal “Mujeres De Palabra”  la cual lo conforma 05 personas responsables y emprendedoras. Eulalia de 46 años de edad es casada y tiene 02 hijos dependientes. Ella lleva más de 03 años  dedicándose  a la venta de cebolla al por mayor en un puesto de mercado.
