Su mayor deseo es poner su propio local en su casa lo cual le generara mayores ganancia asegura Ella. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de cebollas. El grupo  “Mujeres De Palabra” agradecen el crédito brindado. Eulalia es la primera del lado izquierdo viste chaleco marrón.
texts.en: This is the new communal loan group "Mujeres de Palabra," which is made up of 5 responsible and enterprising people. Eulalia is 46 years old. She is married and has 2 dependent children. For more than 3 years, she has been selling onions at wholesale price from a stand in the market. Her greatest wish is to open her own store in her house, which would earn her more income, as she explained. She is requesting the loan to buy onions. The "Mujers de Palabra" group is grateful for the loan that has been granted. Eulalia is the first from the left, wearing a vest.

loans.use: to buy onions.

loans.name: Lipi

texts.en:
Lipi hails from Dhupguri. She is 27 years old. She completed a college education and has a bachelor's of arts. She is married, and her husband has worked for many years producing vegetables and paddy. They are raising one small daughter who reads in grade 1. The family lives in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Lipi's husband is the one who manages the property (he does maintenance and applies the inputs, among other activities). Lipi also helps him in his work. He has worked for many years growing paddy, beans and potatoes. He depends on this job for all aspects; it is the main source of family income since in the region where they live, there is no other source of income rather than working in the field or livestock breeding. His goal market for the sale of these products is local. These are sold to different markets of the city and the surroundings at the price set by the demand for it. 

Now for a better income they want to cultivate paddy on a large scale. Therefore, Lipi is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to buy manure, fertilizers, and good quality paddy seeds in order to help their paddy crops. Her goals are to improve her quality of life, support her daughter with her education and to grow her property so that she can generate more earnings. She has an aspiration to purchase a motorbike for her husband.

She is thankful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: To pay for seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for growing paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Consejo

texts.en:
Consejo is 55 years old and widowed with eight children, three of whom are in school.

Consejo earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from farming rice. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Las Florecitas Group

texts.es:
Magdalena es una mujer de 50 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene dos hijos de 14 y 17 años de edad, y su negocio es la venta de pollo frito.
Ella es buena madre, responsable, dedicada, constante y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’, un sitio caracterizado por el creciente desarrollo del comercio en todas las áreas,  integrado por colonias de guarayos y campesinos del occidente, las principales víctimas de una ideología de marginación que ha impedido compartir recursos municipales y ha negado ayuda a todo ese conglomerado de personas que no cuentan aún con los servicios básicos.
Magdalena es de tez trigueña, cabello castaño, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el español y conoce el guaraní por herencia familiar (fila de atrás, la tercera de la derecha, blusa blanca). Debido a la necesidad de continuar con su labor y ayudar con los gastos escolares de sus dos hijos, ella formó una banca de personas para solicitar un préstamo. Su vida la comparte con su pareja y sus dos hijos que asisten a la escuela. Su negocio es la venta de pollo frito, su negocio es próspero y tiene muchos clientes, su horario de trabajo es a partir de la seis de la tarde, durante la mañana se encarga de comprar, transportar y preparar la comida para que esté lista en la noche. Su negocio es al aire libre, sólo cuenta con una cocina y no tiene refrigerador, por lo que la comida no puede ser congelada ni guardada. Ella sueña con tener un techo para su negocio y un cuarto más donde poder almacenar sus víveres. Su deseo es realizar la compra de una congeladora para guardar el pollo y comprar víveres por mayor.
Es por esos motivos que Magdalena solicita un préstamo para la compra de una congeladora y víveres por mayor para la ampliación de su negocio.
texts.en:
Magdalena is a 50-year-old woman who lives with her partner and has two children who are 14 and 17 years old. She makes a living selling fried chicken. She is a good mother, responsible, dedicated, consistent and hardworking. 

Her business is located in the "Plan 3000" zone, an area characterized by the growing development of all types of commerce. The area is home to people from Guarayo province and farmers from the west, the principal victims of an ideology of marginalization that have impeded the sharing of municipal resources and has denied help to this group of people who do not have even basic services.

Magdalena has a dark complexion, brown hair and average height. Her native language is Spanish and she knows Guaraní through her family heritage (back row, third from right, white blouse). Because she has to continue working and support her children's school expenses, she formed a communal bank to request a loan. She shares her life with her partner and two children who attend school. Her business is the sale of fried chicken. It is prosperous and she has many customers. Her business is open from 6 in the evening. In the morning she is responsible for buying, transporting and preparing the food so that it is ready for the night. 

Her business is out in the open air. She only has a kitchen but not a refrigerator, so she cannot freeze or store food. She dreams of having a roof for her business and a room where she can store provisions. Her wish is to buy a freezer to store the chicken and to buy provisions at wholesale. For those reasons Magdalena is requesting a loan to buy a freezer and wholesale provisions to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and provisions at wholesale to expand her business

loans.name: Prosperidad Group

texts.es: Orfelinda de 29 años de edad es separada y tiene 02 hijos dependientes. Ella Pertenece a la Nueva Alcancía Comunal “Prosperidad”  la cual lo conforman 05 mujeres con deseos de salir adelante en sus negocios. Orfelinda lleva más de 01 año  dedicándose  a la venta de comidas en un centro educativo. Gracias a su constante dedicación a logrado salir adelante y de esta manera puede cubrir con los gastos del hogar.  Su mayor deseo es de ver a sus hijos realizados profesionalmente. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de arroz, aceite, papa y pescado. El grupo  “Prosperidad” agradecen a los Inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo brindado. Orfelinda es la segunda del lado derecho y viste polo morado.
texts.en: Orfelinda is 29 years old. She is separated and has 2 dependent children. She belongs to the new communal bank "Prosperidad," which is made up of 5 women who want to get ahead with their businesses. Orfelinda has been selling foods in a school for more than 1 year. Thanks to her constant dedication, she has managed to get ahead and is able to cover her household expenses. Her greatest wish is to see her children become professionals. She requested the loan to buy rice, cooking oil, potatoes,and fish. The "Prosperidad" group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the support they have provided. Orfelinda is the second from the right, wearing a purple shirt.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil, potatoes,and fish.

loans.name: Zhenya

texts.en: Zhenya is young agronomist from Aregnadem village in the Shirak region. She lives with her husband and mother-in-law. The farm that Zhenya and her family run includes livestock of cows, sheep, calves and hens, and also arable land where wheat and some fruit trees are cultivated. To be able to cover farming costs, Zhenya is asking for this loan. The requested loan of USD 3,000 is very important for Zhenya to pay for renovation of the barn and cover harvest gathering costs. This young and hardworking woman is relying on lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the barn and cover harvest gathering costs

loans.name: Llapallanchis Purisunchis Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LLAPANCHIS PURISUNCHIS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio José Antonio continua brindando el servicio de taxi, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, el socio continua trabajando durante el día transportando a sus pasajeros a los destinos que ellos le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito 
Los socios que salen adjuntos en la foto pidieron permiso para llegar tarde por motivos de trabajo.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, carpintería y negocio de venta de comida.
El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "Llapanchis Purisunchis." This bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco, in the department of Cusco.

The member José Antonio continues providing taxi services. He is a very responsible and enterprising person. He continues working during the day, transporting his passengers to the destinations they request. This is the way he provides for his family. 

He is requesting a loan. The members that are added to the photo requested permission to arrive late due to work.

The other members have a business selling clothing, a busienss selling crafts, a business selling grocery items, carpentry, and a business selling food.

The member is greatful to those who are part of this dream through this program. He pledges to make his repayments in the established timeframe.

loans.use: to do maintenance work on his vehicle.

loans.name: Catalina Rosa

texts.es: Catalina de 65 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija y su nieta, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal y tiene mucha clientela por los buenos precios, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas frutas y verduras por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejore ingresos.
texts.en:
Catalina is 65 years old and lives in her own home along with her daughter and granddaughter. She sells fruits and vegetables from her business that is located at the municipal market. Catalina has many customers because of the good prices.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy more fruits and vegetables in bulk. This will enable her to continue her sales and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: German Salet

texts.es:
German de 42 años de edad, quien lucha día a día junto a su esposa por sacar adelante a su familia, actualmente son padres de familia de 2 pequeñas de 5 y 7 años. Hoy en día German es emprendedor de su propio negocio, Posen una venta de productos básicos que distribuyen en pequeñas tiendas de las cercanías de su ciudad, todo esto con la ayuda de un pequeño vehiculo que posen y una venta de ropa.

German y su esposa ya tienen un año de dedicarse a su propio negocio, anteriormente él se dedicaba a la labor de vigilancia privada en un sector del lugar de residencia, pero al cabo de un tiempo German se quedo sin empleo y fue eso lo que le motivo a independizarse y ejercer su propio negocio.

Ahora German y su esposa invertirán el efectivo para comprar pantalones, blusas, camisas para hombres, faldas, entre otros. Y también invertirá en su venta de productos básicos; aceites, arroz, frijoles, jabón, papel higiénico todo esto con el fin de hacer crecer mas su negocio y así poder satisfacer las diferentes necesidades que sus clientes les demandan. Ya que su negocio ha crecido y pues a mayor distribución mejores serán las ganancias.

Los planes de los esposos a futuro son comprar un vehículo mas grande para mejorar la distribución de sus productos, ademas darles una mejor educación a sus hijas para que un día tengan un futuro prometedor.
texts.en:
German, age 42, and his wife strive day after day to get ahead on behalf of their family. They are currently the parents of two young children, ages 5 and 7. Today German is an entrepreneur and manages his own business. He has a sales business in which he distributes basic products to small stores that are located near his city. German is able conduct his business with the help of a small vehicle that he owns. He also sells clothes.

German and his wife have already managed their business for one year. He previously did private security work in a neighborhood in the area where he lives. After some time, he lost his job so German was motivated to become independent and pursue his own business.

Now German and his wife invest their cash in the purchase of trousers, blouses, men’s shirts, skirts, and other items. They also invest in the sale of basic products such as oil, rice, beans, soap, toilet paper, and other products in hopes of growing their business even more and satisfying the different needs of their customers. Since the business has grown, greater distribution will also improve their earnings.

The couple’s plans for the future include buying a larger vehicle so that they can improve the distribution of their products. In addition, they will be able to provide a better education for their daughters so that they can have a promising future someday.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, men's shirts, skirts, oil, rice, beans, soap, toilet paper, and a variety of other products.

loans.name: Dargah

texts.en: Dargah is a 44-year-old man who is married and has a child. His son graduated school this year and is preparing for the university. They are living in Ahmadbayli village of the Fuzuli region, but they are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from the same city. Dargah has been in the animal breeding business for 12 years. He has several cows and bulls. To vaccinate them Dargah needs a loan in the amount of 1,200 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). Dargah is thankful for the help and support of dear Kiva organization and lenders.

loans.use: to vaccinate several cows and bulls.

loans.name: Claudia Vanessa's Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Los Antojitos lo integran tres mujeres microempresarias esforzadas por mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, es coordinado por la señora Lina, quien tiene la edad de 52 años, soltera madre de cinco hijos de los cuales solamente uno depende de ella de la edad de 16 años, es propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio, es primer ciclo que solicita los financiamientos de la institución y solicita el crédito para la compra de granos básicos como es arroz sellado, frijoles, pastas, papel higiénico, toallas sanitarias, servilletas, gaseosas, medicamentos, leche centrolac, etc. Otra de las socias es la señora Sora María, quien tiene la edad de 53 años y se dedica a la comercialización de los derivados del maíz como es pinol, pinolillo, tamales pisques, tamales rellenos, tortillas, etc., este negocio lo impulso hace veinte años y los comercializa en su comunidad, y la joven Claudia de 20 años de edad, su negocio es el destace de cerdo y lo realiza en la casa de su mamá desde hace tres años.
texts.en:
The communal bank Los Antojitos is a group of three small business owners striving to improve their family's living conditions.  It is coordinated by Lina, 52, a single mother of five children although only her 16-year-old is dependent on her.  She runs a grocery store out of her home and this is the first loan she is requesting through the institution.  The loan is to buy basic grains such as rice, beans, pastas and toilet paper, sanitary napkins, napkins, sodas, medicines, Centrolac milk, etc.

Another member of the group is María who is 53 years old.  She sells corn-based items such as pinol (drink), pinolillo (drink), tamales, stuffed tamales, tortillas, etc.  She has been in business for 20 years in her community.

Claudia is 20 years old and runs a pork butchery business out of her mother's home where she has been in business for three years.

loans.use: To buy basic grains.

loans.name: Marleny De Jesus

texts.es: Marleny de 39 años de edad se dedica a la venta de charamuscas, chocobananos, hielo y gelatinas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por ser un producto muy vendible, Marleny vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de frutas por mayor, azúcar, chocolate, etc. y comprar un hielera para poder seguir con sus ventas y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Marleny, 39, sells candy, chocolate covered bananas, ice and gelatins.  She runs her business from home and has many customers because of the popularity of her products.  Marleny lives in her own home with her husband and four children.  The loan she is requesting is to buy wholesale fruit, sugar, chocolate, etc. and a cooler so she can continue with her sales activity and earn more profit.

loans.use: To buy wholesale fruits, sugar, chocolate, etc. and a cooler.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es: Maria de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella posee una panadería ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 10 años, vende con los vecinos y tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, 	Maria está solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar, jaleas y otros ingredientes para poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria, 47, lives in her own house with her husband and two children.  She runs a bakery from home and has been in business for ten years.  She sells to her neighbors and has many customers, using the income from sales to cover some of the household expenses.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy flour, sugar, jellies and other ingredients to continue her work and generate a good profit.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, jellies and other ingredients.

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is a 30-year-old married woman from Mtskheta district. She lives with her school-aged son and daughter and husband, who works at a private company and gets 500 GEL monthly. Lali married at an early age and wasn’t able to get an education and so she has no university degree, which is one of the main reasons for her unemployment.

As it becomes harder to earn a living only with her husband's income, Lali wants to start her own activity in order to more effectively meet the daily costs of the family. She received the credit in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo--a Start-up Program that gives people the chance to start or re-start businesses.

A loan of GEL 1000 will be a great support to this motivated woman and her family, enabling her to purchase an oven and working materials to open a bakery. She hopes that in the future, she will be capable of expanding her business to a wider bakery that will cover almost all of her customers' needs.

Lali and her family are relying on the goodwill of the lenders and will highly appreciate their support.

loans.use: to purchase an oven and working materials to open a bakery.

loans.name: Choquequirao Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Teresa ella es casada y tiene 62 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de artesania, la socia vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de librería.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the "Choquequirao" communal bank, located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

One member of the group is 62-year-old Teresa; she is married and has four children. Teresa has a handicrafts business. She sells knitted and weaved goods and jumpers and blankets. Teresa works from 8am until 7pm. She has had the business for eight years and it is going very well. Teresa's dream is to expand her knitted- and weaved-goods business. She is applying for this loan in order to buy knitted goods, weaved goods and jumpers.

In the photograph, the members in the smaller photos could not attend the meeting when the group photo was taken due to work commitments.

The other members of this group have businesses selling handicrafts, clothes, groceries and stationery.

Teresa is grateful to those who are helping her dreams through this loan. She promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy knitted goods, weaved goods and jumpers.

loans.name: Himno De Victoria Group

texts.es:
Al grupo solidario Himno de Victoria, lo integran tres mujeres emprendedoras y luchadoras por el bienestar de sus familias; lo coordina la señora Ana Adilia, quien tiene la edad de veintitrés años, soltera y madre de dos hijos de 8 y 2 años, por quienes se esfuerza a diario para brindarles mejores condiciones de vida, principalmente que no les falte el alimento de cada día. La socia se dedica a la comercialización de pan en uno de los mercados de la capital y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de pan tostado, picos suaves y tostados, roscas bañadas, bolillos de mantequillas, barras, galletas tostadas, etc., es primer ciclo que solicita el financiamiento a la institución y se ha propuesto como meta pagar puntual las cuotas para el prestamos, de modo que pueda adquirir un buen record en la institución.
El resto de los integrantes son las señoras Lea, quien tiene la edad de 50 años y se dedica a la fabricación de dulces en su domicilio, comercializándolos en los mercados de la capital, y la joven Betty de 22 años de edad comerciante de ropa y productos plásticos.
texts.en:
The "Himno de Victoria" group has three enterprising and feisty members who are fighting for their families' well-being. The group has Ana Adilia as its coordinator. She is 23 years old, single and a mother to two children, ages eight and two. Ana works very hard every day in order to provide her children with better living conditions and so that they do not go hungry. Ana makes a living selling bread at one of the capital city's markets. She is applying for this loan in order to buy toasted bread, doughnuts, butter balls, toasted biscuits and more. This is Ana's first loan cycle with the organisation and her target is to be punctual in her repayments; by doing this she can gain a good credit rating at ADIM.

The other members of the group are: Lea, 50 years old, who makes sweets at her home and sells them at the city's markets; and 22-year-old Betty, a clothes and plastic goods retailer.

loans.use: to buy a variety of breads.

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: Gloria es una señora de 54 años de edad, ella vive con su hermano y sobrinas, ella vive en el campo y se dedica desde que era muy joven a la crianza de animales menores, Gloria va a invertir el crédito en la compra de pollos pequeñitos y para criarlos y luego venderlos para obtener alguna ganancia, lo que Gloria aspira para su futuro es  trabajar y seguir como hasta ahora y mejorar su calidad de vida, y también ver por el bienestar de sus sobrinas.
texts.en:
Gloria is a 54-year-old woman who lives in the country with her brother and nieces. She has been raising small animals since she was a young woman.

Gloria will invest her loan in the purchase of young chickens that she will raise and eventually sell so that she can obtain some income. In the future, she aspires to work and continue as before so that she can improve her quality of life. She also wants to look after the welfare of her nieces.

loans.use: to buy young chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motor.

loans.name: Roxana Yaneth

texts.es: Roxana de 34 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijas, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas caballeros y niños desde hace 5 años, tiene mucha clientela por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios, Roxana está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi poder obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Roxana is 34 years old and lives with her life companion and their two daughters. She has been selling clothes for women, men, and children for five years. Roxana has many customers because of the quality of her products and the good prices.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy more clothes in bulk. This will enable her to continue her sales so that she can generate better earnings.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 48 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Evelyn is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Evelyn has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and to continue sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Yehowa Dzi Group

texts.en:
The Yehowa Dzi Group is made up of four women who are married and are, on average, 35 years old and have three children. They live in extended families in a neighborhood in Teshie, Accra. The women know one another through neighborhood, family and business ties. They sell cooked rice and beans, kids' wear, shoes, kitchen sets, earrings and necklaces.

They want to improve their stock levels. The group works with Kiva's field partner, ID Ghana. This will be their first group loan. Mercy (standing on the far left in the photo) is well known for selling earrings and necklaces. She plans to use her loan to buy more earrings and necklaces from Accra to sell to her customers in Teshie. Mercy expects to earn a good monthly profit, which will be used to pay for healthcare for her children. She hopes to use this partnership with ID Ghana to increase the size of her business.

loans.use: To buy more earrings and necklaces from Accra to sell to her customers in Teshie.

loans.name: Hydie

texts.en:
Hydie is 53 years old and a widow with seven children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Hydie is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. Hydie has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and to repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en: Ismael is a 45-year-old married man. He own a mini market and nut-roasting shop. Ismael works in the shop with his son to be able to support the family. One of the obstacles he has is the number of competitors in the same area. He is trying to provide a better quality of nuts and better service to make customers loyal to the shop. Now Ismael is applying for a loan in order to buy raw coffee beans and roast them to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy raw coffee beans and roast them

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is involved in a farming business. She received the farm as an inheritance from her grandparents. Currently, together with her mother, Marine runs that farm with great love and pleasure. She cultivates wheat and potatoes and gathers a high-quality harvest. Marine's husband left the country and emigrated to Russia with the hope of finding a job and sustaining his family. 

To tackle financial hardships, Marine needs to invest in her farm. The requested loan of $600 will be a huge support for her to purchase forage for her livestock and fuel for land cultivation. Marine hopes for lenders' trust and support for her farming business.

loans.use: to pay for forage for her livestock and fuel for land cultivation

loans.name: Francisca Marina

texts.es: Francisca de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella trabaja como empleada domestica desde hace varios años, con lo que gana de su trabajo y con la ayuda de su esposo y su hijo logran cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda pero no tiene de suficiente capital, por esa razón solicita un crédito para construir un baño y fosa séptica en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, por esa razón solicita dicho crédito y comprar cemento, ladrillos, hierro y pago de mano de obra para que ella su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos.
texts.en:
Francisca is 59 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and their son. She has been working as a domestic helper for many years.  With her earnings from this work and with the help of her husband and her son, they can pay for some household expenses. 

She wants to make improvements to her home, but she does not have enough money. For this reason, she is asking for a loan to build a bathroom and a septic tank in the place shown in the photo. Therefore, she is asking for a loan to buy cement, bricks, metal, and to pay for labor, so that she and her family can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, metal, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunas necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar,  Maria está solicitando un crédito para la compra de sopas, granos básicos, café, golosinas, refrescos, etc. para continuar con sus ventas y asi poder obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
María is 34 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and their son. For various years, she has had a small shop which is located in her home. With the proceeds of her sales, she can provide for some of the necessities of the household. 

María is asking for a loan to buy soups, basic grains, coffee, sweets, and refreshments in order to be able to continue her sales and by this to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy soups, staple grains, coffee, sweets, refreshments, etc.

loans.name: Ursulo

texts.es: Don Ursulo de 62 años de edad vive con su esposa en casa propia, el se dedica a la venta de lentes desde hace 14 años, tiene mucha clientela  por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios, con las ventas que realiza logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, Don Ursulo está  solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas lentes por mayor para poder tener más estilos y atender mejor a sus clientes para generar mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Ursulo is 62 years old and lives with his wife in his own house. He has worked selling glasses for 14 years. He has many customers, because his glasses have a good quality and good prices. With the sales he makes he can cover some of the expenses of his household.

Ursulo is asking for a loan to buy more glasses wholesale, in order to have more styles, to better meet his customers' demands, and to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy glasses wholesale.

loans.name: La Finquita Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario La Finquita esta integrado por cuatro socios emprendedores, es primer ciclo que estos socios solicitan el financiamiento de la institución. Es coordinado por la señora Marcia, quien tiene la edad de 23 años, casada y madre de un hijo de tres años, quien ha sido su mayor fuerza de superación, se dedica a comercializar frutas, verduras y pan, todo esto en Ticuantepe, desde hace cinco años, este negocio se lo heredo un  hermano, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de melón, sandias, cajillas de banano, aguacate, naranja, etc., se ha propuesto como meta mantener el negocio, ya que es el que le permite obtener ingresos a diario. El resto de los integrantes del grupo es la señora Karolina, quien tiene la edad de 36 años, y comercializa frutas y verduras en la capital del país, el señor Pablo de 64 años de edad, comerciante de frutas y verduras en las calles de la capital desde hace cuatro años, y la joven Rosa, quien tiene la edad de 22 años y comercializa frutas y verduras en uno de los mercados de la capital desde hace cuatro años.
texts.en:
The solidarity group "La Finquita" consists of four enterprising members. This is the first cycle in which the members are requesting a loan from the institution. The group is coordinated by Marcia, who is 23 years old, is married and has a 3-year-old son, who is her main source of strength to get ahead.

Marcia works selling fruit, vegetables, and bread, which she has been doing in Ticuantepe for five years. She inherited the business from a brother. She is asking for a loan to buy cantaloupes, watermelons, crates of bananas, avocados, oranges, etc. She has set herself the aim to keep up her business, because it enables her to earn money every day.

The other members of the group are Karolina, who is 36 years old and sells fruit and vegetables in the capital of the country, Pablo, who is 64 years old and has been selling fruits and vegetables in the streets of the capital for four years, and young Rosa, who is 22 years old and has been selling fruits and vegetables in the markets of the capital for four years.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, and bread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy creams, lotions, deodorants, shampoo, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Sixta Guadalupe

texts.es: Sixta de 66 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su nieto, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano desde hace varios años, vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su casa, tiene mucho clientes, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra demás ropa por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sixta is 66 years old and lives with her husband and her grandson in their own house. She has worked selling second hand clothing for many years. She sells in the streets in different communities close to her home. She has many customers.

She is asking for a loan to buy more clothes wholesale, in order to continue with her sales and by this to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Danelia Del Carmen

texts.es: Danelia es una microempresaria exitosa, tiene la edad de 52 años, acompañada y madre de dos hijos a cargo, y es propietaria de un taller de bordado desde hace veinte años, ella realiza maxi, guayaberas, cotonas, vestidos bordados, etc., y su mayor clientela la tiene en el mercado de la municipalidad, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de dacron, hilo, zipper, hilos, cinta de mantequilla, etc., uno de sus mayores logros es que ha aumentado la clientela
texts.en:
Danelia is an enterprising small business owner. She is 52, is in a relationship, and is a mother of two. Danelia is the proprietor of an embroidery workshop in her home. She started this business 20 years ago and makes maxi dresses, guayaberas, smocks, embroidered gowns, etc.  She attends to most of her customers in the municipal market.

The loan she is requesting is to buy dacron, thread, zippers, ribbon, etc.  One of her main achievements is the fact that she has increased her customer base.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Lilian Jeannette

texts.es: Lilian de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos y ropa su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia, con su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor para poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Lilian is 42 years old and lives with her husband and their two children in their own house. She works selling shoes and clothing. Her shop is in her home. With her work, she can cover some of the household expenses.

She is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise, in order to continue with her work and to make good profits.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Luis Marino

texts.es:
Luis es natural de San Juan de Lurigancho, el distrito más poblado a nivel nacional. Él vive con sus padres y 8 hermanos (4 hombres y 4 mujeres), es el tercer hermano y el mayor de los varones. 

Antes de recibir el presente crédito, Luis fue apoyado por su madre, quien era la que le pagaba la matrícula y él se hacía cargo de las cuotas restantes, estudiando y trabajando al mismo tiempo. Debido a su esfuerzo nunca dejó los estudios, pero la situación actual por la que atraviesa no le permite matricularse en su último ciclo de estudios, impidiéndole concluir satisfactoriamente la misma; por lo que vino a buscar un apoyo económico que le permita poder culminarla dentro del plazo establecido. A Luis le interesa mucho su carrera Técnica de Ingeniería en Mecánica de Mantenimiento, porque eso le permitiría conseguir un trabajo formal en corto plazo y poder apoyar a sus padres con la educación de sus hermanos menores, que es uno de sus objetivos personales planteados en su futuro.

Luis agradece la oportunidad que KIVA brinda aquellas personas con bajos recursos económicos que no pueden culminar sus estudios , porque gracias a ellos muchas personas logran cumplir sus sueños de ser profesionales bien capacitados, capaces de sacar adelante a los suyos por su bienestar y el bienestar de sus familias.
texts.en:
Luis is from San Juan de Lurigancho, the most heavily populated district in the nation.  He lives with his parents and eight siblings (four brothers and four sisters).  He is the third child and eldest of the brothers.

Luis is very interested in his Mechanical Maintenance Engineering Technician career because it has allowed him to obtain formal work in the short term so he can support his parents regarding the education of his younger siblings.  This is one of his personal goals for the future.

Luis is doing his technical degree with SENATI, one of Peru's premier technical degree programs. 95% of SENATI students find employment within their technical degree within 3 months of graduation. For this reason, and because of a promising labor market, Luis feels this is a good investment in his future.

Prior to this loan Luis was supported by his mother who paid his tuition while he worked to pay for the other fees, so he works and studies at the same time.  Because of his efforts he never stopped studying but now he is in a situation which does not allow him to enroll in his last course - meaning he will not be able to graduate.  Therefore he is seeking economic support to finish his degree on time.  

Luis is grateful for the opportunity KIVA is giving to people with low incomes who cannot finish their education, because thanks to the lenders many people will be able to realize their dreams of becoming well-trained professionals, capable of providing a good life for themselves and their families.

loans.use: to pay for his final semester in Mechanical Maintenance Engineering so that he can obtain his degree and become a titled professional

loans.name: Scarli Yulissa

texts.es: Scarli es microempresaria emprendedora, que tiene la edad de 21 años, casada y madre de un hijo, tiene su propio taller de costura, impulso este negocio hace cinco años con ayuda de su familia, este oficio lo aprendió de su mamá, quien desde pequeña le enseñó y luego su papá le regalo una maquinaria para que empezara su propio negocio, y su esposo le dio ayudo para la compra de materia prima. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de tela, forro, hilo, cancán, zipper, adornos, cinta de mantequilla, etc., una de sus metas es aumentar la productividad.
texts.en:
Scarli is an entrepreneurial small business owner. She is 21 years old, married, and has a son. She has her own sewing workshop. She started this business five years ago with the help of her family. She learnt this trade from her mother, who taught her since she was small, and then her father gave her a sewing machine to set up her own business. Her husband helped her to buy the materials she needs.

She is asking for a loan to buy fabric, lining, can-can fabric, zippers, ornaments, ribbons, etc. One of her aims is to increase her productivity.

loans.use: to buy fabric, zippers, thread, etc.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Maria de 34 años de edad se dedica desde hace 5 años a la venta de comida, su negocio está en el mercado municipal, con su trabajo logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida quien le ayuda en el negocio y su hijo, ella solicita un crédito para la compra materia prima como: carnes, pollos, verduras, frutas, maíz, etc. y comprar más ollas y sartenes como muestra en la fotografía para poder tener mas comida,  atender mejor a los clientes y tener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria is 34 years old. For 5 years she has been working selling food. Her business is in the market of the municipality. 

With her work, Maria can cover the household expenses. She lives in her own home with her partner, who helps her with the business, and with their son. 

She is asking for a loan to buy supplies like: meat, chicken, vegetables, fruit, corn, etc., and to buy more pots and pans, like those shown in the picture, to be able to cook more food, and to be able to better serve her customers and to make more profits.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, vegetables, fruit, corn, etc. and to buy more pots and pans.

loans.name: Ana Luz

texts.es: Ana de 49 años de edad vive con su grupo familiar, desde hace 8 años posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la variedad de productos, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de sopa, golosinas, granos bacisco, refrescos, café, huevos, etc. para surtir su tienda y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Ana, 49 years old, lives with her family.  For the past 8 years, she has had a small store located in her home. She has many customers for her good prices and the variety of products.  She is asking for a loan to purchase soup, candies, basic grains, soft drinks, coffee, eggs, etc. to stock her store and have better profits.

loans.use: to purchase soup, candies, basic grains, soft drinks, coffee, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: María de 20 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 2 años y 6 meses de edad. Ella se gana la vida prestando sus servicios de seguridad en un Rancho cercano, lo que le permite aportar a la economía familiar, además su compañero de vida da mayor estabilidad al hogar con sus aportes económicos, los cuales obtiene de su trabajo como motorista.  Como se observa en la fotografía la pared de la vivienda de María se encuentra deteriorada por lo que ella teme  que en cualquier momento pueda ceder y es por eso que ella desea repararla, al no contar con la fluidez económica necesaria solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento y arena, además de mano de obra para reparar la pared de su vivienda.
texts.en: María, 20 years old, lives in her own house with her life partner and their two children, ages 2 years and 6 months old.  She earns her living as a security guard in a nearby ranch, which allows her to support her family. In addition, her life partner provides more economic stability to the household with his support, which he gets from working as a driver.  As can be seen in the photo, the wall of María's house is deteriorating; she fears that at any moment it could collapse, so she wants to repair it.  Since she doesn't have the economic liquidity needed, she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement and sand, in addition to labor costs to repair the wall on her house.

loans.use: to invest in cement and sand in addition to labor costs to repair the wall of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies and pay labor costs to care for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Rohbar

texts.ru: Рохбар жизнерадостная женщина. Она живет вместе со своей семьей в сельской местности. Рохбар вырастила 4 детей. Она занималась выращиванием сельхоз культур с раннего утра до позднего вечера, чтобы зарабатывать деньги и прокормить детей. Ее муж тоже занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. Рохбар всегда заботилась об образовании своих детей. Ее младший сын Салимджон данное время является студентом первого курса. Рохбар запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора своего сына. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Rohbar is a cheerful woman.  She and her family live in a rural area, where she raised four children.  In order to earn money to feed them, she worked as a farmer, rising early in the morning and not returning until late in the evening.  Her husband is also a farmer.  Rohbar always made sure that her children were getting an education.  

Currently, her youngest son Salimdjon is a first-year university student.  Rohbar is requesting a loan to pay his tuition.  She is relying on your kindness and charity.

loans.use: to pay her son's tuition

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.ru: Дилрабо 41 лет. Она живет одна. Дилрабо не замужем и не имеет детей. Дилрабо занимается собственным бизнесом уже более 5 лет. Она покупает оптом подарки и продает в розницу. Дилрабо продает игрушки, искусственные цветы и т.п. Дилрабо имеет свой собственный подарочный магазин. Она планирует расширить ассортимент товара. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки игрушек. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Dilrabo is 41 years old and lives alone.  She isn't married and has no children. For over five years, she has run her own business buying toys at wholesale prices and selling them at retail.   Dilrabo owns her store and sells toys, imitation flowers, etc.

She is planning to expand the variety of goods she sells, so she is requesting a loan of 10,000 somoni (TJS) to buy toys.  She is relying on your kindness and charity.

loans.use: to buy toys to increase working capital

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Florencia es una mujer de 62 años de edad, casada, madre de dos hijos de 20 y 18 años, y su negocio es el comercio de queso, papa y chuño.
Ella es luchadora, fuerte, emprendedora, independiente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en el municipio de ‘Batallas’ que se encuentra cercano al lago Titicaca, el clima del lugar es frío y los rayos solares fuertes.
Florencia es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo trenzado, su lengua materna es el aymara y utiliza el español para el comercio, su vestimenta es típica (sombrero, manta y pollera). Su negocio es la producción de queso, papa y chuño (papa deshidratada), ella junto a su esposo trabajan la tierra en la siembra y cosecha de papa, también realizan la elaboración de chuño; que consiste en deshidratar la papa mediante exposición a la helada, luego se procede a pisar el Chuño para despojarlo de las sustancias amargas, finalmente se deja secando exponiéndolo al sol. Y parte de su trabajo es la producción de queso, ordeñando a sus vacas para extraerle la mayor cantidad de leche y producir queso. Ella sueña mejorar su calidad de vida, mejorando los ingresos económicos para su familia, realizando la compra de ganado lechero y aumentando su capital de trabajo.
Es por esos motivos que Florencia solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado lechero y con los beneficios ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Florencia is 62 years old and married. Her children are 20 and 18 years old. She produces and sells cheese, potatoes and chuño, an artisanal freeze-dried potato typical of the area. She is determined, strong, entrepreneurial, independent, responsible and hard-working. She has built her business in an area called Batallas, which is found close to Lake Titicaca. The climate is cold and the sun's rays are strong. 

Florencia has a dark complexion, is of medium height and has long, black, braided hair. Her mother tongue is Aymara and she uses Spanish to conduct her business. She wears traditional dress: a hat, a blanket and a skirt.

She works the land along with her husband. They grow potatoes and produce chuño, which involves drying the potatoes by exposing them to frost, pressing them in order to remove bitter substances and then leaving them to dry in the sun. Another part of their work is producing cheese, for which they milk their own cows as efficiently as possible. 

She dreams of improving her quality of life, improving her income for the benefit of her family, buying dairy cows and increasing her working capital. It is for these motives that she is asking for a loan to buy dairy cows and so help her family.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows and so help her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood, and nails to build a room from metal sheeting.

loans.name: Horonkantigui Group

texts.fr:
Les neuf membres du groupe HORONKANTIGUI sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KAFELA un village tout près de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur dix-huitième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro-finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame NAWA debout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes  HORONKANTIGUI, fait la vente des charbons de bois. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  53 sacs de 100 kg de charbon de bois. Elle s’approvisionne à KAFELA et les villages environnants de KAFELA. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits pour la revendre  en détail au marché à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The nine members of Horonkantigui Group are married women who average 43 years of age and five children each. They all live in traditional families in Kafela, a village close to the city of Sikasso, in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

In order to satisfy their customers, they are seeking their eighteenth solidarity loan (group loan) from Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso.

Ms. Nawa is the woman standing on the left in the photograph. In this group, she sells charcoal. She intends to use her loan to buy 53 sacks of charcoal, weighing 100 kg each.

She gets her supplies in Kafela and in the surrounding villages, and retails at the market, for cash and on credit, to a clientele comprising both men and women. She's very much in demand by her customers, thanks to the quality of her products.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 32'000, to be used in part to pay off the loan and interest, and in part for her savings.

loans.use: to buy 53 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood and nails to repair the roof on his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood and nails to replace the roof on his house.

loans.name: Dimeya Group

texts.fr:
Mme Habibou  est la représentante du groupe DIMEYA. Elle se porte très bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 05 enfants, le plus âgé a 32 ans et le moins âgé a 14 ans.02 vont à l’école. Elle  a 03 personnes en charge.
Madame vend des fruits et légumes depuis 10 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans un village environnant. Ses clients sont les habitants de son quartier.
Elle  veut s’acheter 01 sac de bissap, 05 Kg de poivrons, 01 panier de tomates.
Mme Habibou compte utiliser son bénéfice pour agrandir son hangar et aussi s’occuper des études de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. Habibou is the representative of Dimeya Group. She's very well. She's married and the mother of five children. The oldest is 32 years old, the youngest is 14. Two of them go to school. She has three dependents.

She's been selling fruits and vegetables for ten years. She gets her supplies in a neighboring village. Her customers are people living in her neighborhood.

She wants to buy one sack of hibiscus, 5 kg of peppers, and one basket of tomatoes.  She intends to use her profits to expand her warehouse, and also to take care of her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 1 sack of hibiscus, 5 kg of peppers, and 1 basket of tomatoes

loans.name: Jenni Roxana

texts.es: Jenni gracias a sus últimos 3 apoyos financieros que ha recibido gracias a los diferentes inversionistas ella ha logrado aprovechar al máximo dicho fruto pues pudo terminar de asistir una manzana de arroz con la compra de urea y abono 12-24-12 los cuales ayudaron a que la producción estuviera muy bien cuidada en la temporada pasada. Los varios apoyos económicos que ella ha solicitado han sido de gran ayuda a pesar de saber que son personas que confían en un desconocido apoyándole con un granito de arena para que pueda salir adelante y crecer con el rubro al cual se dedique. Es por ello que ella se encuentra agradecida y contenta porque COMIXMUL la tomo en cuenta y le abrió las puertas para poder ser parte de ese grupo de prestatarios con tasas de interés blandas y facilidades de pago las cuales antes de ello no podía solucionar. Ella relata: 'la única manera de agradecer dicho apoyo es cumpliendo con lo acordado en los pagos ya que es lo menos que uno como prestatario puede hacer y la institución lo menos que espera para reportar a las diferentes personas en otros países que hacen posible con el granito de arena que ellos dan, salir adelante.' Jenni solicita un nuevo apoyo económico para nuevamente invertir en sus cultivos de arroz pues es necesario después de cada temporada invertir en los mismos para seguir teniendo los resultados esperados para cada temporada por lo que espera ser nuevamente apoyada por los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma de KIVA.
texts.en: Jenni, thanks to the last 3 loans that she has gotten thanks to the various investors, has managed to make the most of its fruit since she could finish caring for a manzana (plot of land) of rice with the purchase of urea and 12-24-12 fertilizer, which helped the production be very well cared-for during the last season. The various economic supports that she has asked for have been a great help despite knowing that they are people who trust an unknown person supporting her with a grain of sand so that she can get ahead and grow in the field in which she works.  It is for this that she is grateful and happy because COMIXMUL takes her into account and opens its doors to her to be part of this group of borrowers with low interest rates and payment arrangements which before she couldn't find.  She says, "The only way to thank this support is meeting the requirements of the payments since it is the least one can do as a borrower and the least that the institution expects in order to report to the different people in other countries that they make it possible, with the grain of sand that they give, to get ahead."  Jenni asks for another loan to again invest in her rice crop since it is necessary after each season to invest in the same things to continue getting the hoped-for results for each season, so she hopes to again be supported by the various investors through the Kiva platform.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies and pay labor costs to care for her crops.

loans.name: Dúo El Éxito Group

texts.es:
Dúo el Éxito
Don Celso de 45 años de edad el se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano y su negocio ha hido en aumento ya que sus ganancias la a invertido en compra de mercadería y en espacio para su ropa, agradece a dios y a su esfuerzo, también a sus proveedores, su mayor anhelo es el crecimiento de su negocio y poder vender otra mercadería aparte de su ropa como zapatos y aparatos electrónicos usados.
texts.en:
Dúo el Éxito group
Celso, 45 years old, works selling second-hand clothing and his business has been expanded since he invests his profits in purchasing merchandise and in space for the clothing, thanks to God and to his efforts, and also to his providers.  His greatest desire is the growth of his business and to be able to sell other merchandise apart from his clothing such as shoes and used electronics.

loans.use: to purchase second had clothing to sell.

loans.name: Varduhi

texts.en:
Varduhi lives in Gyumri with her parents. Her father is a construction worker and her mother takes care of their household. Varduhi herself studies at the Gyumri branch of Yerevan State University, and she is specializing in accounting. 

Varduhi has applied for this loan to ask Kiva lenders to support her in her university tuition. The loan will help her to pay for her third year university fees and to continue her studies there.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 42 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school.

Mary Jane works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like soft drinks, bread, noodles and other groceries.

She has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Mary Jane aspires to save enough money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soft drinks, bread, noodles and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some cosmetic products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a 28-year-old woman who is married to William, and they are blessed with two children. 

Rosemary earns additional income to support their family by operating a fruit and vegetable stall. She has been doing this for a period of seven years now, earning an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Rosemary was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer, and she is now servicing her first loan of KES 20,000, which she intends to use to buy cabbages, potatoes, green vegetables, mangoes, oranges and pineapples to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

She plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children, and she hopes to have a bright future.

loans.use: To buy cabbages, potatoes, green vegetables, mangoes, oranges and pineapples.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 41 years old and married, and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 3 children. 

Anna is a cash crop farmer and has been in this business for 10 years. She will be using this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds to plant on her farm. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her family's living standards.

This is Anna's first loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and her future hopes are to expand her farming and become a large scale farmer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling decorations in the Philippines.

Maricel has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more decorations and party supplies to sell. She has been in this business for four years now, and also earns additional income from farming rice.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more decorations and party supplies to sell.

loans.name: Mbuki

texts.en:
Mbuki is 48 years old and married, and she and her spouse have been blessed with 2 children. 

Mbuki has a grocery store and has been in this business for 5 years.  She will be using this loan to buy more stock of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and vegetables. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her family's living standards and to educate her children.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more stock of potatoes,vegetables and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Qristine

texts.en:
Qristine is a farmer from the Vedi town in the Ararat region. She lives there with her husband. They are currently engaged in livestock farming, which is the main source of their family income. Qristine also cultivates some vegetables, which are sold in the local market. The young family’s needs are growing day by day and she needs to work harder to earn a living. To be able to do so, she requests $2,000, which will assist her greatly to pay for renovation of the barn and to purchase forage for feeding the livestock.
 
Qristine received a prior loan from a local financial institution but, unfortunately, wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to her hard work in recent times, Qristine was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the barn and to purchase forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Jainema

texts.en:
Jainema is 49 years old and married with six children. Two children are in school, and Jainema works very hard to provide for them.

Jainema runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 18 years, selling a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. She requests a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future, Jainema would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en: Iman is a 50-year-old divorced woman. She started a small retail business to be able to support herself. Iman goes to the wholesale market and buys mostly decoration pieces to sell to individual friends and neighbors. Now Iman is applying for a loan to expand her business and bring more products to distribute to shops in the area.

loans.use: To add more variety in the products she sells

loans.name: Shaker

texts.en:
Shaker is 18 years old, and he is one of a five-member family living in Mafraq. 

Shaker is a university student majoring in Chemistry. He is now in his first year and is facing some difficulty in paying for the university. For this reason he is applying for a loan in order to pay the university fees so he can register for the next semester.

loans.use: to pay for the semester fees

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en:
Jenefer is 48 years old and married, and she and her spouse have been blessed with 3 children. 

Jenefer has a grocery store and has been in this business for 5 years. She will be using this loan to buy tomatoes, onions, oranges and potatoes. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and improve the living standards of her family.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, potatoes and fruits.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
Haydee is 47 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are in school.

A hardworking entrepreneur, Haydee has had a tailoring business in the Philippines for 15 years. Haydee requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

In the future, Haydee would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as clothing, perfume, swimming suits, and more

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase three pigs (two sows, one boar) and cement for pig house construction to start commercial pig production.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane lives in Vedi town in the Ararat region. Her family consists of her mother-in-law who is an elderly pensioner (83 years old), her husband, her twin sons and her daughter. 

Gayane is currently busy with her livestock of hens and 6 colonies of bees. She is also engaged in the cultivation of sunflowers. 

Gayane now wants to expand her livestock, and for this reason she needs a loan of USD 3,000 to buy 3 oxen, wheat seeds and special forage for feeding hens. The loan will be a great support to this woman, who is full of initiative. 

She really hopes for the lenders' good wishes and help so she can obtain the necessary amount of financial resources.

loans.use: to pay for 3 oxen, wheat seeds and special forage for feeding hens

loans.name: Islam

texts.en: Islam, 21, is in her second year of working toward a diploma in business administration. She is one of a six-member family that can’t always afford to pay college fees. Therefore, she is applying for an educational loan to pay her semester registration fees and buy some books.

loans.use: to pay her semester registration fees and buy some books.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino, 40, is from the village of Chale in Tsalenjikha district. She is divorced and takes care of her school-aged daughter alone. In order to make a good living condition for her daughter, Nino is engaged in cattle and pig breeding, in cultivating a family-owned vineyard and in harvesting nuts seasonally. She sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family’s income. 

She really works hard to satisfy all her daughters' needs and give her a carefree life. However, her income is seasonal and now Nino requires financial support to make a stable source of income. She requested a loan of 2000 GEL for purchase an initial stock of products, have money for working capital and open a general store. 

She has free space near her house where she plans to open the store and serve clients herself. 

Her regular clients will be neighbors and passersby as well. 

Nino and her daughter rely on Kiva lenders' goodwill and they will be thankful for the help.

loans.use: to open a general store and make a stable source of income

loans.name: Solidario Genesis Patzicia Group

texts.es: Solidario Genesis Patzicia,este solidario esta conformado por la señora Olga Marina de 47 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de maiz,y frijol, se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace varios años, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia en maiz y frijol para la venta,el sueño de ella es tener un local propio donde vender,espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
The Solidario Genesis Patricia Group was formed by Olga Marina who is 47 years old. 

She sells corn and beans. She has been doing this work for some years. At this time she is requesting a loan to buy more inventory of corn and beans to sell. 

Her dream is to have her own stand to sell from. 

She hopes that you can help her with the requested loan.

loans.use: to buy corn and beans to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Caught between unemployment and land fragmentation, many of Kenya’s young people struggle to make their way in the world. But for Jane, 40, who is based in the Kisii area of Kenya and is a mother of 2 lovely children, she has been practicing mixed farming for the past 8 years. She has managed to earn a decent income.

Her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops and some personal business that she engages in to make ends meet. She passionately loves dairy farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about her business, she stated “feeding my cows.” Her hobby is milking Nyamotika (the name of her dairy cow). She sells milk to her neighbors and to the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming, and she cannot meet the demand.

For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy an extra dairy cow, which will assist in increasing milk productivity. The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10-20 liters of milk a day. This will immediately translate to more profit and increased income levels. Profits from selling milk will be used to repay the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise.

Jane is very visionary, and she intends that in the near future, she will start adding value to her milk business through packaging the milk before selling and selling dairy products such as yoghurt. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Discipline Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of three women who share very strong ties of togetherness. It is now on its second loan cycle. 

The members sell noddles, cutlery sets, glasses, tea and foodstuff. They wish to further develop their businesses and improve their living conditions by facilitating access to consumer goods. 

Eunice is the group's featured borrower. She is single and the mother of two children. She sells tea and noddles. 

She will use this loan to buy Milo, milk, sugar and bread to prepare tea to sell to her customers in her neighborhood. She will also buy noddles to sell to her customers. 

Eunice does well with this business, which she has done for a number of years. Her earnings will enable her to increase her savings and take care of her children and herself.

loans.use: To buy Milo, milk, sugar and bread to prepare tea to sell to her customers in her neighborhood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase three pigs (one boar and two sows) and cement to start commercial pig production supported by Kiva through SSLLP.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase three pigs (two sows, one boar) and cement for pig house construction to start commercial pig production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase three pigs (two sows and one boar) and bags of cement to start commercial pig production with support from Kiva through SSLLP.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase three pigs (two sows, one boar) and cement for commercial pig production with support from Kiva through SSLLP.

loans.name: Grupo Mujeres De Argueta Group

texts.es:
De 27 años de edad ya con grandes aspiraciones en dar a conocer a su comunidad y a todos los que la visitan la actividad que ella realiza con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación, es casada y vive con su esposo con el deseo de superar en la vida e alcanzar grandes sueños que ella quiere realizar en la vida, ella tiene tres hijos los cuales son estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad. (Loida es la que se encuentra de 2da de derecha a izquierda en la fotografía)

El trabajo que ella realiza con tanto esmero es la compra y venta de cortes típicas dicha actividad lo realiza en su casa y en lugares cercanos de su comunidad donde ella vive, la segunda actividad que ella realiza es la venta de refacciones negocio que realiza con una hermana por más de tres años porque les genera una ganancia para el bienestar de su familia y mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia y comunidad.

Ella ha sido un ejemplo en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se han unido a Loida para poder emprender sus negocios para que cada uno de ellas pueda supera y tener ingresos importantes.

El uso que ella le dará al préstamo que ella está realizando es para la compra de mercadería o corte típica para luego su respectiva venta por los alrededores. Uno de las aspiraciones de ella es tener un local en el mercado de su comunidad.
texts.en: She is 27 years old and has already a lot of desire to show her community and their visitors the job that she does with so much effort and devotion. She is married and lives with her husband. Wishing to excel in life and to reach great dreams, she has three children who study in the school of their community (On the photograph, Loida is the second one from the left). She works so devotedly buying and selling native style clothing. She works from her house and in surrounding areas of her community. Her second job is fixing clothes. She has worked in this with her sister for more than three years, because it gives her income for her family's well-being and to improve the financial situation of her family and community. She has been a role model in her community, and this is why a group of women have joined Loida to start their businesses, so that each of them can move forward and earn a good income. Loida will use the loan to buy native style merchandise that she can later sell in the neighboring towns. One of her dreams is to have a place at her community market.

loans.use: to buy native type clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase three pigs (two sows, one boar) and cement for pig house construction to start commercial pig production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Jackline Bosco

texts.en:
Jackline, 42, is married with six children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. She operates a textile business, which she has been working at for seven years. She also sells fish and practices farming for side incomes. 

Jackline began this business to improve her standard of living. She dreams of growing her business into a wholesale business, although she faces the problem of having seasonal customers. 

Jackline will use this loan to buy dresses, shirts and children's wear to sell.

loans.use: to buy dresses, shirts and children's wear to sell.

loans.name: Indangamirwa Group

texts.en:
Marie Jeanne is a group leader; age 28. She is married, with two children, 5 and 3 years old. The group is called 'INDANGAMIRWA', which means “Integrity” in English. They sell different products, and they wish to expand their businesses to have a better future. 

She has a shop and has been running a business for six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to expand her business and renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar, biscuits. and juice

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean, age 35 years, is married with three children between the ages of 2 and 11. Two of them of go to school. He has been farming for 13 years. 

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizer for maize production. The profits from the business will be used to buy land for farming.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for maize production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 22-year-old married mother of one from the Gokwe South District of Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide who volunteers in the local secondary school teaching children beneficial life skills. Additionally, Esther operates a successful business selling broiler chickens to her community. 

She is requesting a loan from Kiva so that she will be able to grow her operation by purchasing more chicks, feed, and the supplies she needs to raise the chicks. Higher profits will help her provide for her family and increase their standard of living.

loans.use: To grow her operation by purchasing more chicks, feed, and the supplies.

loans.name: Corina

texts.es:
La señora Corina de 60  años de edad, vive con su esposo  en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 10  años su negocio  es la venta de rosquillas, quesadillas y hojaldras, vive en la ciudad de San Lorenzo,  al sur de Honduras,  su negocio es manera ambulante y sus clientes son vecinos y amigos de su comunidad. 
Doña Corina es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como maíz, leña, manteca, cuajada, etc. para seguir elaborando su producto, con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente   con deseos de seguir trabajando para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Su sueño es aumentar su clientela  y así mismo tiempo mejora sus ingresos y su calidad de vida. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre de 2014.
texts.en:
Corina is 60 years old. She lives with her husband in their own home. 

She has been selling ‘rosquillas’ [traditional cookies], quesadillas, and ‘hojaldras’ [traditional fried dough] for 10 years. 

She lives in the city of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. She is in business as a street vendor and her customers are neighbors and friends of her community. Corina is an enterprising woman who wants to get ahead and she struggles day after day to improve her quality of life. 

She is requesting a loan to buy products such as corn, firewood, butter, cheese curd, etc., in order to continue making her product. This loan will help her improve her income and also her quality of life. 

She is a client who wants to continue working to improve her quality of life. Her dream is to increase her clientele thereby improving her income and her quality of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - September 2014
