loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, butter, cheese curd, etc., for her business

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio de 56 años de edad habita en vivienda propia desde hace 5 años. Él es un hombre que gracias a su esfuerzo y tenacidad ha logrado salir adelante prestando sus servicios de seguridad en un rancho cercano, además presta sus servicios domésticos en un restaurante lo que le permite obtener una buena cantidad de ingresos. Julio es un hombre amable y solidario que ha sabido ganarse la amistad de sus vecinos. Él desea construir una galera aun lado de su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para construir una galera en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Julio, 56, has been living in his own house for 5 years.  Thanks to his hard work and determination, he has been able to move forward. 

He provides security services on a nearby ranch, and he also provides cleaning and maintenance services to a restaurant.  This has allowed him to earn a good amount of income.

Julio is a kind and caring man who has known how to earn his neighbors' friendship. 

He wants to build a porch on one side of his house, so he is requesting a loan from FUSAI.  He will invest it in galvanized sheeting, wood, and nails, in order to build a porch for his house.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheeting, wood, and nails, in order to build a porch for his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock of maize flour, rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Hoima, Uganda is the place where a 33-year-old Yusuf lives. He is married, with five children attending school. He deals in produce, mainly buying and selling of maize, rice and beans. His future dream is to expand his business and educate his children. 

He will use the loan money to buy more beans to sell, however, his challenge is the price fluctuations of maize and beans.

loans.use: to buy more beans

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is forty-three years old, married with five children all going to school, living in Kasese, Uganda. John owns a stationery shop and has been in that business for three years. He also extends computer training services to people at a cost. 

John wants money to pay school fees for his children as he has a dream of expanding the business into a big training school. John is faced with a challenge of students not paying on time and limited capital which hinders his dream.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en:
Abdu is an older man, married with ten school-going children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a hard-working man dealing in cocoa buying and selling. He has a cocoa garden in which he gets high yields. He has been in this business for ten years and the business is steadily improving. 

Abdu used his old loan to buy some cocoa for selling and managed to get much more profit from the cocoa he bought using that loan. He has paid off the old loan.

He now wants this loan to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.use: To buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Lusik

texts.en:
Lusik lives in Musaler village of Ejmiatsin region. She is a hardworking agronomist and lives with her husband and son.

The family earns a living through the cultivation of tomatoes, eggplant and fruits (peach, apple, pear). This is the only source of the family's income. Lusik's husband helps her a lot in selling the agricultural products at the local market.

To be able to continue the business, Lusik needs to make an investment. A loan of $3,000 will help her to purchase fertilizer and pesticides and to hire workers to help with cultivation of the crops. She and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and are very thankful to them for their support.

Lusik has had a previous loan from a local financial institution but, unfortunately, wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to her hard work in recent times, she was able to run her business in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments of a new loan. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and pesticides and to cover cultivation costs (hire workers)

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Genalyn works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and pig fattening. Genalyn is borrowing 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Genalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Annlyn

texts.en:
Annlyn is 40 years old and married with seven children, five of whom are in school.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Annlyn is borrowing 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Annlyn has been pig fattening for two years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 54 years old and a widow with eight children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, rice, sardines, etc., to sell.

Josephine has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Josephine aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, rice, sardines, etc., to sell

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina lives in Arshaluys village with her two children and mother-in-law. Her husband and father-in-law are migrant workers in the Russian Federation and are supporting their family financially.

Irina has been involved in farming activities. She owns two greenhouses where haricot, potato, cucumber, tomato, eggplant, and greens are cultivated. The gathered harvest is sold locally, and it is a very important source of income for Irina and her family.

She now asks this loan of USD 2800 to be able to purchase an oven and wiring to heat her greenhouse.

loans.use: to pay for an oven and wiring to heat her greenhouse.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 57 years old and a widow with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Marieta has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for four years and also earns an income from a general store.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Galbubu

texts.ru: Галбубу 46 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей. Галбубу в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи на протяжении 25 лет занимается разведением скота и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний день Галбубу имеет в хозяйстве 2 коровы, 7 овец. На земельном участке выращивает рис. Вся деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS). Сделав вывод, что данный бизнес рентабелен, Галбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 дойных коров, часть средств она направит на сбор урожая риса. Доходы от кредита Галбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Galbubu is 46 and married with five children. She has been working in animal husbandry and agriculture for 25 years as the primary source of income for her family. Thanks to her hard work she now has two cows and seven sheep and land where she grows rice, all of which brings in a monthly profit of about 10,000 KGS.

Galbubu has decided she can make additional profit and so has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase two dairy cows and to harvest her rice crop. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows and to harvest rice

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette graduated valedictorian from a vocational school at the age of 16. As one of the most outstanding students, she was awarded a sewing machine by her school. Later on, her dad gave her another sewing machine as a gift. She started sewing at home and hiring someone to deliver the dresses to retailers. 

In 2000, she rented a house in the southern part of Port-au-Prince and launched the business "Bruna Shop." Over the years, Bruna Shop developed a strong reputation thanks to her good quality services. For years, Bruna Shop specialized in manufacturing stylish clothing and rental wedding dresses which represent the values and the beauty of the Haitian tradition. In addition, the business created a training program for young people in the field. 

The business has made a conscious effort to reflect the real fashion identity of Haitian youth. The quality of the products produced by the business has retained clients for years. Years ago, thanks to a previous Zafen loan, the business was able to purchase a sewing machine and furniture, and created two full-time jobs. 

Today, the business is devoted to doubling its production and services. It has decided to request a second Zafen loan, which will help to buy more sewing machines and other furniture.

loans.use: To purchase eight regular sewing machines, one cutting sewing machine and sewing materials.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
This charming woman from the city of Goris in the Syuniq region is engaged in retail business. Karine wants to enlarge her business with the help of a Kiva loan. At her rented storefront, she sells a good assortment of baby clothes, bedding and covers, towels, shirts, and shoes. For all this, she has a great number of loyal customers, whom she is always happy and ready to help. 

Karine is married, and she has a son who is a farmer. Her husband helps Karine in her business, especially in the process of bringing new products to her store from Yerevan town. 

Karine asks for a loan of USD 3000 in order to buy autumn season jackets and, also, bed coverings.

loans.use: to pay for autumn season jackets and bed coverings.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru: Александр, 55 лет, разведен, есть взрослый сын, который проживает вместе с Александром. Образование - среднее, на протяжении 5 лет занимается животноводством. В хозяйстве есть 60 овец. Также Александр занимается ремонтом холодильников. Его совокупная ежемесячная прибыль составляет 25,000 сом (KGS). Зимой скот Александр содержит в сараях, приобретая для него корм. Александр обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку корма на зиму для скота, а именно приобретение клевера и ячменя. Хороший откорм скота в зимний период позволит получить здоровый приплод, а в дальнейшем развивать и приумножать количество домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Alexander is 55 and divorced with an adult son who still lives with him. He has a high school education and has been working in animal husbandry for five years. He currently has 60 sheep. Alexander also earns money repairing refrigerators, and has a total monthly profit of 25,000 KGS. In the winter he keeps his animals in sheds and feeds them purchased feed.

Alexander has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase winter feed for his livestock, specifically to buy clover and barley. Feeding his sheep well this winter will contribute toward healthy lambs in season, which in the future will help him develop and increase his quantity of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase clover and barley as livestock feed

loans.name: Permala

texts.en:
Permala is a 42-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and her only son at Boragari in the district of Jalpaiguri, West Bengal. She attended elementary school up to grade 6, and after that had to give up education as her parents could not afford it. She is married to Mantu, a farmer by profession. Their economic condition did not allow them to provide their only son with higher studies, so he is working as a mechanic of electrical goods.

Permala's husband has been involved in agriculture for many years. With his parents' help, he planted beans and potatoes and had a very successful harvest. Since then, he has devoted part of his life to this activity, which he really enjoys. Now his current income is quite insufficient for the growing expenses of his family, and so they have decided to start paddy cultivation. Rice being the staple food of the local people, the crop has great demand.

Permala is asking for a loan from BJS to help her husband to purchase necessary agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, etc. Her future plans are to continue growing and working hard to provide a better life for her family. 

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies for cultivation of paddy rice.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 31-year-old mother of two who settled for a living in Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur, with her family. Her husband is a farmer, and she helps him in operating it in order to make a living. Her husband grows assorted kinds of plants, and the main crops are coconut, banana and corn. She has a vegetable garden that she earns from weekly for their daily needs. 

Improving their farm has become easier with her access to GDMPC Micro Finance. 

Recently, she borrowed a new loan to purchase construction materials to renovate her house to provide her family a safe and comfortable place for living. 

She has to work well in their farm to gather more products from her farm. In the future, she plans to use organic fertilizer for her farm to restore farm nutrients and to ensure a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to renovate her house to provide her family a safe and comfortable place for living

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 46 years old and single.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 22,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soap, shampoo, noodles, etc., to sell.

Marlyn has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from food vending.

Marlyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soap, shampoo, noodles, etc., to sell

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn is 31 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Juvelyn has a beauty salon business in the Philippines. Juvelyn requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF in order to buy beauty supplies for her parlor.

Juvelyn has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Juvelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 45 years old and has one child.

She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Elena requested a 26,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds for her pigs.

Elena has been raising pigs for nine years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Lalaine

texts.en:
Lalaine is 31 years old and a married woman with five children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Lalaine has a frozen foods business in the Philippines. Lalaine requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of frozen foods to sell.

Lalaine has been in this business for four years. In the future, Lalaine would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Hendrita

texts.en:
Hendrita is 36 years old and has six children. Hendrita is married, and five of her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Hendrita requested a 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins.

Hendrita has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Hendrita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Jeni

texts.en:
Jeni is a 46-year-old married woman with seven children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. 

She buys and sells cocoa and this is her main business. She has a cocoa garden which helps her to increase on her income. She hopes to have a bigger business. Jeni complains of stiff competition since most people in her area are involved in cocoa trade.

She has finished paying off the old loan. She wants a loan to buy more cocoa for selling this peak season.

loans.use: To buy more cocoa for selling this peak season.

loans.name: Sandra Guadalupe

texts.es:
Sandra tiene 28 años de edad, estudió hasta octavo grado, dejó la escuela porque se acompañó y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura.

Actualmente Sandra se dedica a la venta de tamales de elotes desde hace 8 meses,  la necesidad de ayudar a su pareja la llevó a aprender este trabajo, antes se dedicaba a cuidar a sus hijos y en ocasiones le ayudaba a su pareja en el cultivo de maíz, su trabajo está a 25 metros de su casa y se va a pie, trabaja desde las 7:00 AM a 4:00 PM. 

El crédito lo necesita para sembrar una hectárea de ajonjolí, comprar abono, veneno y foliar y para preparar la tierra. 

Sus sueños son que sus hijos se preparen en una profesión, tener un negocio propio y pagar el crédito para tener las puertas abiertas.
texts.en:
Sandra is 28 years old. She studied up until the 8th grade, and she left school because she got married, and her partner works in agriculture.

Sandra currently works selling sweet corn tamales, which she has been doing for 8 months. She learned this work because she needed to help her partner. Before, she used to take care of her children, and sometimes help her partner with the corn crop. She works 25 meters from her house, and goes there on foot. She works from 7:00 AM to 4:00 PM. 

She needs the loan to to plant a hectare of sesame, buy fertilizer, pesticides, and foliar fertilizers, and to prepare the land. 

Her dreams are for her children to prepare themselves for a profession, to have her own business, and to pay off the loan to have doors open to her.

loans.use: to plant a hectare of sesame, buy fertilizer, pesticides, and foliar fertilizers, and to prepare the land

loans.name: Om Sairam Group

texts.en:
Jasoda, a married woman of 37 years, is a resident of Ranipur village of Nuapada district in Odisha, India. She is a very active and confident lady. Jasoda, standing fourth from right in the photo with light blue saree, hails from a schedule caste poor family. Schedule caste people are considered to be the deprived section of the society. She lives with her husband, two sons of 18 and 15 years and one daughter, aged 13 years. Her children are continuing study in local college and school. The lady standing with raised hand close to Jasoda is the leader of the group.

Jasoda has been running a spice selling business with items like chili, cumin seeds, coriander, etc. for the last 10 years. Her husband goes to five weekly markets in her locality in a week with bulk of items in a bicycle and sells in the markets. Apart from this, she is also running a small general store in her house. Her monthly income from the existing business is INR 6,000. Out of this income she hardly manages her household expenses and the educational expenses of her children. 

To increase the income for smooth management of her family, in August 2014 Jasoda along with 12 other women entrepreneurs of her village, formed a self-help group named Om Sairam and availed a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. From her loan of 16,000 INR she wants to purchase items like chili, coriander, cumin seed, etc. in bulk to keep the stock for a month. This will help her to reduce her purchasing and transportation costs as she will replenish her stock frequently and she can add a substantial income to her present income. 

Jasoda hopes to purchase a bike to run her business smoothly with sufficient items and provide better education to her children. 

The other 12 members of the group are also doing business like tailoring center, animal trading, vegetable cultivation and cloth business.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing of items like chili, coriander, cumin seed, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick, iron, wood, and sheeting to build a bedroom in his house.

loans.name: Odsuren

texts.en: Mrs. Odsuren, 25 years old, lives with her husband and child in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been running a magazine business since 2012. Her husband repairs automobile tires. Their child is in kindergarten. Currently, she completed her long awaited children's comic book. She is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to publish her comic books. As a result, her income will increase. Also, more importantly, the comic book will teach values, morals and ethics to children.

loans.use: to publish a children's comic book

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Batbayar, 47 years old, lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been transporting and selling coal to local people since 2012. His wife is a train attendant and works at railway station. Their children all got married and live on their own. 

He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to buy coal in a large amount. As winter is coming to Mongolia, lots of households will need coal. Even though coal is the main contributor to air pollution in Ulaanbaatar, without coal burning, the people living in the rural areas will be frozen to death. Lots of people are unable to buy coal from a coal mine, and they rely on him. 

The borrower is a very reliable individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of coal

loans.name: Parachichi Group

texts.en:
Rosemarry is a married woman who was born in 1966. She is blessed with four children but only one is alive; the rest died. She runs a business selling fish which she fries herself, a business she has been with for four years now. At 8:00 am, Rosemarry starts selling the stock left from yesterday before going to the fish market to buy new stock every day. She closes her business at 1:00 pm (after selling all the remaining fish) and travels to market to buy new ones. After three hours she gets back home and fries them ready for selling which goes up to 11:00 pm. 

Rosemarry is busy and doing great. She  is able to make a good monthly profit.

This is her more than third credit from Tujijenge Tanzania. She has paid back all of her previous credits successfully. Rosemarry used the previous credits to buy stock of fish and buckets of frying oil. She is so happy and believes that one day her business will grow more and she will see the benefits. She managed to receive an extra income (profit) which she used to build and covered part of her home food expenses. Rosemarry desires to expand her business portfolio. 

She will invest her credit request to buy fish for her business. She will share this loan with her group 'PARACHICHI' which totals two members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fish for her business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a 56-year-old married woman and a mother of six grown-up children from Iloilo, Philippines. For more than 30 years, Edna has supported her husband in their fishing venture. This is the source of their income. 

Edna wishes to expand their fishing business, but she lacks the financial resources to do so. With that purpose, she decided to borrow a loan from CEVI to pay for the repair of the fishing boat. Through this loan, she and her husband will be able to improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. 

Edna aspires for sustainability of their livelihood.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of the fishing boat

loans.name: Tujikomboe Kitopeni Group

texts.en:
Thobias is married and a father of one daughter who is at school. He is 39 years old. For five years now, he has had a shop selling dry foods like rice, beans, baking flour, and sugar. He sells from 7 am to 9:30 pm per working day and is able to realize a good monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is his more than one credit request to be apportioned among two members from Tujijkomboe Kitopeni group. He used the previous credits, all repaid in full, to improve his shop with requested food. With a good covering, he managed to get extra income which he used to cover home welfare costs and school fees. In the coming years, Thobias would like to sell more food in his shop. 

He will invest his new credit request to buy food stock: rice, beans, baking flour and maize flour, and cooking oil. The members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy food stock: rice, beans, baking flour and maize flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Lenit Maria

texts.en:
Lenit Maria, 48, is a married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Lenit Maria has a personal products business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Lenit Maria requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of items like body lotion, perfume and other personal items.

In the future, Lenit Maria would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of items like body lotion, perfume and other personal items.

loans.name: Rodylyn

texts.en:
Rodylyn is 28 years old and has four children. Rodylyn is married, and three of the children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Rodylyn requested an 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rodylyn has been pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rodylyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth works hard to support her family. Ruth is married and has a buy and sell distilled water business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy additional distilled water to sell.

Ruth has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Ruth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional distilled water to sell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 49 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Imelda has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Imelda aspires to save money to expand her business and save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Nieves is 53 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Nieves has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Nieves aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is a 25-year-old married man with three children, and he stays in Bundibugyo, Uganda. 

He took a loan that he repaid. He used the previous loan very well to buy cocoa to sell and this is manifested in the progress of his business. He is a hardworking man who hopes to expand his business more.

He wants a loan to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Bernadeth works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a buy and sell dried fish business. Bernadeth is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional bundles of fishing net for her fishing business.

Bernadeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of fishing net

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
María de 35 años de edad, es ama de casa. Dedicada y esmerada en sus quehaceres cotidianos, Casada y madre de 4 hijos.  María apenas alcanzo su estudio hasta el tercer grado de educación básica, debido a los problemas económicos que en ese entonces alcanzaban a su familia.

Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, ella aparte de su trabajo en el hogar muy gustosamente le apoya también en esa área, ambos aprendieron de sus respectivas familias desde que eran muy pequeños. Su esposo también realiza es albañil.

En cambio María como es una mujer  Luchadora cuando ya pasa la parte de las siembras de maíz, ella se dedica a ayudarles a los quehaceres del hogar a otras personas de las cuales recibe un salario. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar fertilizantes, formula, sulfato, foliares; Ademas invertirá en el pago de las personas que les ayudaran a trabajar.

Su principal objetivo en este momento es sacar su cosecha, tener una muy buena siembra y poder así vender su maíz para obtener ganancias de sus esfuerzos.
texts.en:
María is 35 years old. She is a housewife. She is dedicated and conscientious about her daily chores. She is married with 4 children. María barely managed to reach third grade of basic education due to family financial problems.

Her husband works in agriculture. Besides her household chores she very happily helps him in that area, both of them having learned from their families since they were very young. Her husband also works as a mason. On the other hand, as a struggling woman, María spends time in the corn fields and she supports the home doing the household chores while others receive a salary.

She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, formula, sulfate, nutrients. She will also invest by paying people to help them work. Her main objective at this moment is to harvest the crop, to have a good product in order to be able to sell her corn to obtain profit from their endeavors.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, formula, sulfate, nutrients and to pay the people who help them do the work

loans.name: Chanthoeurn

texts.en:
Chanthoeurn is 27 years old and married, a grocer with two children living in Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. She has been in the business for nearly four years. Her husband is 32, a driver transporting garment-factory workers for monthly fees. Both of them can earn approximately $21 a day. 

Now Chanthoeurn would like to request a loan to buy more groceries to sell. This loan will help her improve her family’s finances. In the future, she is going to build a bigger house and support her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Chantrea

texts.en:
Chantrea is a 20-year-old university student. She lives with her parents in Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. 

Due to a shortage of financial support, Chantrea would like to request a loan to pay for her tuition fees. Her loan will help her to pursue bachelor’s degree. In the future, Chantrea is going to find a good job with reasonable salary to help her family.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees

loans.name: Baasandagva

texts.en:
Mr. Baasandagva, 36 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He and his wife have been making and selling boots to local people for eighteen years. Their son studies at university. 

Baasandagva is requesting a loan of 1,800,000 MNT to buy leather in large amounts so that he can continue to make and sell his boots and improve his family's living standard. This business is the only income source for his family.

loans.use: to buy leather in large amounts

loans.name: Dory

texts.en:
Dory is a married woman and a mother of two children from Concepcion, Iloilo. Dory is a hard-working woman. She has helped her husband in their fishing business for more than two years now. Fishing is a lucrative investment and it has provided them the income that they need.

Dory is asking for a loan to buy more plywood, paint, nails, and epoxy. Through this loan, Dory and her husband will be able to improve their catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Dory dreams of a more sustainable fishing business. She also adds that she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more plywood, paint, nails, and epoxy

loans.name: Merlinia

texts.en:
Merlinia is a married woman and a mother of 11 children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 23 years now. This is their main source of income.

Merlinia is asking for a loan to buy a new boat engine and to pay for the repair of the fishing boat. Merlinia believes that this loan will help them improve their fishing business. In the future, Merlinda aspires for a more improved income.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine and to pay for the repair of the fishing boat.

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en: Mr. Bayarsaikhan, 47 years old, lives with his daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been transporting goods using his heavy duty truck since 2009. His wife works as a janitor in Turkey. Their eldest son got married and lives on his own. Their daughter goes to high school. He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy spare parts, such as tires, an oil pipe, a heater and brakes in order to repair his heavy duty truck. As a result, he can continue to transport goods for a living.

loans.use: to buy spare parts in order to repair his heavy duty truck

loans.name: Firylyn

texts.en:
Firylyn is a 26-year-old member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative from Siquijor, Philippines, industriously caring for her fishing activities. Her husband is a fisherman and they have three school-age children. 

She personally takes charge of their business. The business is doing well. Firylyn has humbly embraced the ups and downs of the business and that is  nothing but a normal situation for her. Sometimes they have business losses, sometimes a good return. She is a savvy business woman. 

Now, Firylyn sees a good opportunity to expand their business. She is requesting PHP 4,000 from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for capital to purchase fishing materials and accessories. She deeply wishes for a good education for her children and for them to have businesses of their own.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials and accessories.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena has been helping her husband in their transportation service business for over five years. She earns well from this and successfully repaid a previous loan that she used to buy tires. With her profit, Rowena had started a general store in addition to her transportation business. Her new store is doing well.

Rowena is requesting a loan to purchase grains and feed supplies in addition to the grocery goods her store offers to customers. In the future, she wants to improve her business as well as the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase grains, feed supplies, and grocery items

loans.name: Adolfa

texts.en: Adolfa has been running a general store for many years in order to make a living. She uses her revenues to provide for the needs of her family and also for the education costs for her children. She has repaid successfully her previous loan used for buying groceries to sell. Recently, she is took a new loan to build a sales outlet to have a better place to stock her products for sale. Her business is now improving, and she is thankful to GDMPC for their financial support. In the future, she wants to save more for the family.

loans.use: to build a sales outlet to have a better place to stock her products for sale

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Erma works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from frozen foods. 

Erma is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Erma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 54 years old, married, and has four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years. 

Teresita requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, cigarettes, beverages, etc.
 
In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, cigarettes, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is 67 years old and married with six children. Felicitas works very hard to provide for them.

Felicitas runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Felicitas has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items, such as soap, snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Felicitas would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Librada

texts.en:
Librada is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Librada successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Librada's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Roseny

texts.en:
Roseny is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fish nets, gasoline, etc., for her fishing business.

Roseny has been in this business for 15 years. Roseny earns more income from a buy and sell dried fish business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, gasoline, etc., for her fishing business

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen,35, is a married woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Aileen has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.  

Aileen requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

In the future, Aileen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita is 54 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Benita has been raising pigs for six years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

Benita is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Jesebel

texts.en:
Jesebel is 33 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jesebel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items, such as sugar, soap, diapers and other groceries. 

In the future, Jesebel would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Enkhbayar

texts.en:
Enkhbayar is 28 years old. He lives with his wife and three children in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. Since 2011, Enkhbayar been loading goods at a private firm. His wife is an accountant who works at private firm and their children are all in kindergarten. 

Enkhbayar is requesting a 4,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cements, fiberglass, and foam to renovate his house. As winter is coming to Mongolia, it became necessary to renovate. Enkhbayar’s loan will help his family to live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and fewer pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house to burn less coal for heating

loans.name: Segundina

texts.en:
Segundina  makes her living in Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur with her family. She has three children that are still studying and she has to earn more for that. She has a corn production farm as their main source of income and she used her previous loan for her farm and repaid it successfully. 

Segundina is now preparing for the next crop season and she is taking a new loan to buy a new variety of seedlings and manure fertilizer to have a more productive farm. With this loan, she is hopeful to earn well and be able to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a new variety of seedlings and manure as fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the repair of their fishing boat

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan which she used to buy supplies (seed and fertilizer) needed in her business. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would like to apply now for a PHP 10,000 loan, which she will use to buy fertilizer and farm inputs needed in her business. It will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. Leonila is thanking God and you in advance for the financial assistance that will be given to her. 

Leonila dreams of being able to give her children the best education possible so they can have a bright future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and plants for her business

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a married parent with five children. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She works hard to support her family.

Analyn is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing materials such as a fishing cage. She has successfully repaid her previous loans. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as a fishing cage

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
Socorro is 41 years old and married with five children. Three of her children are in school, and she is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Socorro has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Socorro requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fish to sell in he food stall.

Socorro has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 31 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Ruby works very hard to provide for them.

Ruby runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ruby has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items, such as sugar, shampoo, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Ruby would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Melanie works hard to support her family.

She has a recycled materials business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and pig fattening. Melanie is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of recycled materials to resell.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of recycled materials to resell.

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Koh Sotin District of Kampong Cham Province, Phalla is aged 52 years and married. She has five children. To support the family, she and her husband have been farming rice and raising cows. They have been in this business for 32 years. The current business earns her family about 48,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. 

Phalla has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle already, and she successfully used the past loan to better support her family to have sufficient food. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy ingredients and some materials for running a new business as a rice seller in her village. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and some materials for running a new business

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Sem's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Banteay Meas district of Kampot province, Sem is a 47-year-old married mother of four children. Rice farming and raising chickens have been the main sources of her family’s income for 15 years. Together, she and her husband can earn about 13,000 KHR per day to meet their family’s needs and manage to save about 8,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Sem is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion to build a decent latrine for her family to use. She hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for her family to use

loans.name: Yen's Group

texts.en:
A married mother living in a rural village located in the Sithor Kandal district of Prey Veng Province, Yen is 36 years old and has three children. Yen is a farmer who has been growing rice for almost 20 years, earning about 50,000 KHR but is able to save about 25,000 KHR each day.

Yen’s group consists of three members who are all female. She is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now, she is leading group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy rice and ingredients for making desserts for selling. She hopes this new business will enable her to earn more income for supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy rice and ingredients for making desserts for selling

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Yuthpanha

texts.en:
Yuthpanha is 21 years old, a student at a university and also on the staff of a company. He is living in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. He has worked since 2013 earning $4.36 daily. 

Due to the fact that he is short of finances for his studies, Yuthpanha would like to request a loan to pay his tuition fee. This loan will help him graduate. In the future, he is going to find another job with better salary.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 51 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. For the past 11 years, she has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from rice farming. Delia has borrowed and repaid 20 previous loans from NWTF. She works hard to provide for her family.

Delia is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell such as soap, shampoo, eggs, noodles, and other items. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase soap, shampoo, eggs, noodles, and other items

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
José de 54 años de edad, estudió hasta 2ª grado, debido a la pobreza ya no pudo seguir en la escuela, está casado y su esposa vende ropa, tiene 6 hijos que ya son mayores y han formado sus propios hogares. 

José se dedica a la agricultura y albañilería, además desde hace más de 10 años forma parte de cooperativa donde producen camarones, para llegar donde trabaja se va  en un pick up ya que está a 8 km de distancia. 


El crédito lo necesita para comprar 100 larvas de camarón y 6 quintales de concentrado. 

Su sueño es construir su propia casa, comprar un carro para llevar a vender su producto y con las ganancias pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
José, 54, studied until 2nd grade; due to poverty, he was not able to continue attending school. He is married, and his wife sells clothing. He has 6 children who are now grown and have formed their own households. 

José devotes himself to farming and bricklaying.  In addition, he has been part of a shrimping cooperative for more than 10 years. He rides on a pick-up truck in order to get to his work site, as it is 8 kilometers away.

He needs the loan in order to purchase 100 shrimp larvae and 6 quintals (about 608 lbs.) of feed.

His dreams are to build his own house, to purchase a car for transporting and selling his product, and to pay off the loan with the earnings.

loans.use: to purchase 100 shrimp larvae and 6 quintals (about 608 lbs.) of feed.

loans.name: Sarahon

texts.ru: Сарахон 42 года, замужем, имеет 5 детей. Образование Сарахон среднее, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством, стартовав в 2009 году. Благодаря упорному труду Сарахон, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 2 коровы, 1 теленок. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сарахон обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одного теленка. Доходы от кредита Сарахон планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, так как она хочет дать своим детям достойное образование.
texts.en:
Sarahon is 42 and married with five children. She has a high school education and works in animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family, a business she began in 2009. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has two cows and one calf.

With the goal of further developing her business, Sarahon has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 20,000 KGS to purchase one calf. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business, since she wants to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to purchase one calf for fattening and subsequent resale

loans.name: Toafa

texts.en:
Toafa is a 60-year-old single woman with 10 children. She has a small plantation to grow taro and bananas to sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 4 years. 

Toafa needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, new boots, gloves, sprayers, a crowbar, and a machete. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. 

Toafa will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, new boots, gloves, sprayers, a crowbar and a machete.

loans.name: Bopha

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Kandal province’s Kean Svay district, Bopha, 57, has two children. Bopha and her husband are farmers who have been growing vegetables for 39 years. She can earn about $16 per day.

Bopha has been with VisionFund for five cycles and completely paid back the loans, which have helped her improve her livelihood from cycle to cycle. Now she is requesting a new loan to pay her son’s tuition fee to study at university. She hopes this loan will enable her to keep her son in school until his graduation.

loans.use: to pay her son’s tuition fee to study at university

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicken, fruits, oil, rice, sugar, soap, clothing, toilet paper, and gas.

loans.name: Inosia

texts.en:
Inosia is a 55-year-old married woman with 4 children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has 6 years of experience with this business. 

Inosia needs a loan to buy a sandwich maker, a toaster, dozens of eggs, loaves of bread, butter, and a boiler. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Inosia has been a member of SPBD since 2008.

loans.use: to buy a sandwich maker, a toaster, dozens of eggs, loaves of bread, butter, and a boiler.

loans.name: Jefferson

texts.en:
Jefferson is 21 years old and married. He is raising his family in a rural community and he manages a small vulcanizing shop. 

He wants to become successful and financially stable and provide his a family with a better life. He wants to improve his vulcanizing shop and provide a better service to his customers but he has inadequate capital. 

He would like 30,000.00 PHP financial assistance from KIVA lenders  to buy spare parts and accessories. He is hoping that this loan will enable him to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories needed in the vulcanizing shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy  phone accessories.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is a single woman with 1 child. She describes herself as focused. She operates a beauty salon to offer beauty services. She has regular customers.   

She describes her biggest business challenge to be seasonal changes. She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy beauty products for use in the salon. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. 

This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a  fruit and vegetable business for 10 years.  She earns addditional income from food vending.

She is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase vegetables and fruit to sell.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fruit to sell.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo is a 31-year-old married garment-factory worker with 2 children, 1 child attends school.  They live in Kampong Speu province, Cambodia

She has been a worker since 2010 and earns approximately $5 per day. Her husband is a 33-year-old construction worker who  earns $5 per day. 

Keo would like to request a loan to buy a motorcycle to commute to work. The motorcycle will enable her to reduce her traveling expenses and improve their standard of living.  

In the future, she wants to build a bigger house with fences around it and pay for her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Iokapeta

texts.en:
Iokapeta is a 38-year-old woman who is unmarried with four children. She has a small taxi business to earn an income. She has five years with this business.

Iokapeta needs a loan to buy new seat covers, a new taxi sign indicator,  floor mats and new wheel-caps, and pay for a new paint job. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Iokapeta joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new seat covers, a new taxi sign indicator, floor mats and new wheel-caps, and pay for a new paint job

loans.name: Keziah

texts.en:
Keziah is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself as patient and hardworking. She operates a tailoring shop to make clothes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are women. 

She will use 40,000 KES to buy tailoring materials. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank, she successfully repaid the previous loans.  She will use the anticipated profits to open aonther business.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself as focused. 

She operates a beauty salon to offer beauty services. Her business is located in a growing area and she has regular customers. Her biggest business challenge is a lack of funds. 

She will use 80,000 KES to buy beauty products for use in the salon. Her business goal is to open another salon within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be stable financially. 

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank, previous loans were successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael, a married mother of six, describes herself to be good. For 15 years she has been operating a retail business where she sells charcoal. Located in a good area, her enterprise serves the general public. 

Since her biggest business challenge is a lack of funds, Rael has requested this Kes 40,000 loan to buy more charcoal. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, her previous one fully repaid.

Rael's business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable.

loans.use: buy more stocks of charcoal

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William, a married father of three children ranging in age from six to 15 years, describes himself to be focused, disciplined and determined. For 10 years William has been operating a tailoring business where he makes bags and clothes. Located in a busy market, his primary customers are schools and wholesalers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

William will use this Kes 90,000 loan to buy more tailoring materials. His business goal is to have a fully stocked business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have good housing and expand his business. William will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

loans.use: buy more tailoring materials

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is 51 years old and widowed with three children; one of her children is in school. Leonarda works very hard to provide for them.

Leonarda's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Leonarda is taking out a bridge loan to restart her food vending business.

Leonarda has requested a PHP 4000 loan through NWTF. She is using the new loan to purchase additional ingredients for her business. 

Leonarda is committed to rebuilding her business, and in the future she would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace  is 35 years old and married with four children; all four of her children are in school. Grace  works very hard to provide for them.

Grace  runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, cigarettes, beverages, etc.

Grace  has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Grace  would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, cigarettes, beverages, etc

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single woman with 2 children. She describes herself as self motivated. 

She has operated a poultry farm to sell chickens and eggs for 5 years. Her primary customers are hotels, schools and shops. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as diseases that affect her chickens. She will use 40,000 KES to buy farm supplies. 

She hopes that in the future, she will have a better life. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank, a previous loan was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Levei

texts.en:
Levei is a 60-year-old widow with no children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has 1 year of experience with this business. 

Levei needs a loan to buy a large deep fryer, a new gas burner, a strainer, plastic bags, and bags of flour and sugar. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Levei has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy a large deep fryer, a new gas burner, a strainer, plastic bags, and bags of flour and sugar.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman with four children who works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business and earns additional income growing rice. Teresita is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy a fishing net for her fishing business.

Teresita has sustained her business activities through 20 previous NWTF loans. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inputs and pay for labor for her potato crops.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 32 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store for 3 years and requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy  canned goods, eggs, milk, chips, and soft drinks.

Juliet has borrowed and successfully repaid 4 loans from NWTF. She earns additional income from operating a ready-to-wear and dry goods business.

Juliet aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, milk, chips, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
This borrower's name is Rodita, 42, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Fernandico and has one child who is still at the elementary level.  She works to augment their income to meet their personal and household needs.

Rodita has a stall that sells fresh chicken and sells pre-paid loads for a certain network communication. Her chicken stall is situated in her neighborhood just beside her house. She is known in their community for selling fresh chicken and pre-paid loads. People in her local community prefer to buy chicken at her stall than go to the market for convenience. She earns a minimum of Php 600 a day from her businesses.

To help her maintain and expand her stall, Elvira is requesting a Php 50,000 loan to buy dozens of fresh chickens and buy wholesale load to sell retail. She believes that her sales and income  will significantly increase as she adds more inventory of chickens at her stall.  Her earnings from her business are a great help in meeting their family's needs.  She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.
 
 
Rodita dreams of having another stall/outlet for her chicken sales. She dreams of giving her child the best education until college. She wants to have a happy and quiet life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for dozens of fresh chickens to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a male Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be industrious. He operates a retail shop where he sells household items. He describes his biggest family challenge to be water shortage. He will use the Kes 19,870 loan to buy a 3,000 litre water tank to store clean water for domestic use. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business. This is his sixth  loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a 3000 litre water tank

loans.name: Valelia

texts.en:
Valelia is a 33-year-old unmarried woman with two children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Valelia needs a loan to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, coffee, a large boiler, plastic bags and soft drinks. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Valelia has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, coffee, a large boiler, plastic bags and soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy school supplies for resale.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lilia is 29 years old and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Lilia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food production business.

Lilia has been in this business for three years.  In the future, Lilia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of animal feed.

loans.name: Dina Emerita

texts.es: Dina de 46 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 24 y 17 años de edad, además vive con ellos otro hijo y un nieto. Ella una mujer trabajadora que todos los días se levanta desde muy temprano para atender su tienda de productos de primera necesidad y es gracias a ella que logra tener ingresos económicos para aportar a la economía familiar. Dina desea cambiar el techo de tu vivienda, ya que actualmente se encuentra deteriorado por lo que desea cambiar las láminas de su vivienda, para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Dina is 46 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and two children, ages 24 and 17, and another son and a grandson. She is a hard working woman who gets up very early every day to run her convenience store, which allows her to bring home income to contribute to the family’s finances. 

Dina wants to change the roof of her house, as it is currently damaged. She wants to change the metal sheeting, which is why she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to purchase galvanized sheets, roofing supports, and wood to change her roof.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized sheets, roofing supports, and wood to change her home's roof.

loans.name: Petrona Del Carmen

texts.es: Petrona de 34 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a su madre y su hijo de 4 años de edad. Ella es una mujer luchadora que busca diferentes formas de ganarse la vida actualmente se dedica a la venta de tortillas, la cual realiza en su domicilio desde hace 5 años, lo que le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar. En la vivienda de Petrona se encuentra una pila que es el único deposito que tiene para recoger agua pero se encuentra dañada y el agua se filtra, por lo que ella desea construir una nueva lo antes posible ya que para ella el agua es una prioridad en su hogar. Es por ello que Petrona solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir una pila en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Petrona is 34 years old and a single mother. She lives in her own house along with her mother and four year old son. She is a fighter who looks for different ways to make a living. Presently she works selling tortillas. She has been doing this from her house for 5 years and it allows her to provide the sustenance for her household.

In Petrona's house there is a washstand that is the only water storage that she has. But it is damaged and leaks water. So she wants to build a new one as soon as possible as having water is a priority in her house. So Petrona is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks and re-bar to build a washstand at her house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and re-bar.

loans.name: Playa Bonita Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Playa Bonita lo integran tres mujeres microempresarias, coordinado por la señora Urania, quien tiene la edad de 31 años, acompañada y madre de un hijo de 10 años de edad, por quien ha logrado mayor superación, es propietaria de un taller de sastrería desde hace cinco años, este negocio lo impulso con ayuda financiera de su esposo, cuenta con la ayuda de dos trabajadores que son remunerados y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de tela sincatex, gruesa de botones, gruesa de zipper, entre tela, chiffon, hilos, etc., un problema que enfrenta es que existen temporadas de menor demanda por parte de la población, por lo que tiene que aprovechar las temporadas que mayor demanda tienen como es inicio de año escolar, septiembre y final de año, ya que realiza togas, blazer, etc. El resto de los integrantes son la señora Eugenia, quien tiene la edad de 48 años y se dedica a la crianza de cerdos desde hace dos años, y la señora Meyling de 30 años de edad, propietaria de un taller de costura desde hace dos años en su domicilio.
texts.en:
The solidarity group “Playa Bonita” (Beautiful Beach) consists of three female micro-entrepreneurs. The group coordinator is Sra. Urania. She is 31 years old, in a relationship, and the mother of a 10-year-old son who has been her greatest achievement. Urania has owned a tailoring shop for five years. She started this business with financial help from her husband. In addition, she has the assistance of two paid workers. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy synthetic fabric, buttons by the dozen, chiffon, thread, other types of fabric, and a few additional items. One problem that she faces is the times when there is less demand in her community, so she has to take advantage of opportunities when there is greater demand, such as the start of the school year in September and at the end of the year. During that time, she makes togas, blazers, and other items.

The other members are as follows:
• Sra. Eugenia, age 48, has been raising pigs for the past two years.
• Sra. Meyling, age 30, is the owner of a sewing workshop that she has been operating the past two years out of her home.

loans.use: to buy synthetic fabric, buttons by the dozen, chiffon, thread, other types of fabric, and a few additional items.

loans.name: Scarlet Raquel

texts.es:
Scarlet estudia el cuarto año de medicina en la UCAN-León. Tiene 20 años y está soltera. Le apasiona la medicina ya que de esa manera puede ayudar a otras personas con sus necesidades y curar sus diversas enfermedades. Sus padres la apoyan en su carrera así como una tía que le ayuda económicamente a suplir sus gastos.  
Ella requiere el préstamo para pagar la inscripción de clases y las mensualidades. El préstamo le garantizara seguir con sus estudios y terminar su carrera. Dentro de sus planes futuros están terminar la carrera y luego estudiar una especialidad. Su meta próxima es adquirir un trabajo en donde pueda aplicar sus conocimientos.
texts.en:
Scarlet is in her fourth year of studying medicine at UCAN-León. She is 20 years old and single. Scarlet is passionate about medicine and hopes to help other people with their needs by curing them of different illnesses. Her parents are supporting her with her degree, as well as an aunt who helps her financially by contributing toward her expenses.

Scarlet is requesting a loan so that she can pay for her class registration and the monthly fees. The loan will guarantee that she can continue her studies and finish her degree. In addition to obtaining her degree, her future plans include studying a specialty. Her next goal is to acquire a job where she can apply her knowledge.

loans.use: to pay for her class registration and monthly fees.

loans.name: Kelvin

texts.en:
Kelvin, a married father of one, describes himself to be a risk taker. He has been operating a business transporting customers on his motorcycle for six years now. Located in an area with potential for growth, he serves regular pedestrians as his primary customers. 

Because his biggest business challenge is insufficient capital, Kelvin has requested this Kes 100,000 loan to service his motorcycle and expand his enterprise. This is his third  loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, his previous ones fully repaid.

Kelvin's business goal is to have a regular flow of income within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will create employment.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle and expand his transport business

loans.name: Aquiles Jeovany

texts.es: Aquiles de 42 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos de 11 y 15 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se esfuerza por dar lo mejor a su familia y es por ello que pone todo su empeño y creatividad para que su negocio de elaboración y venta de pan prospere y así tener más posibilidades de mejorar la economía de su hogar. Aquiles desea construir un servicio sanitario lavable en su vivienda, pero no cuenta con la fluidez económica necesaria por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, hierro y una taza lavable para construir un servicio sanitario lavable.
texts.en:
Aquiles is 42 years old and lives in his own house together with his wife and two children aged 11 and 15 years old. He is a hard-working man who strives to provide the best for his family. So he applies all his determination and creativity to make his business producing and selling bread profitable. Then he has more possibilities to improve the household economy.

Aquiles wants to construct a washroom in his house but does not have the needed economic resources. So he is requesting a loan from Fusai to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, re-bar and a toilet to construct a washroom.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, re-bar and a toilet to construct a washroom.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María de 38 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos de los cuales uno se encuentra estudiando. Ella es una madre abnegada y una vecina solidaria que siempre busca sacar adelante a sus hijos de diferentes maneras y es por ello que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales, además vende ropa interior de forma ambulante para llevar el sustento a su hogar. En la vivienda de María se carece de una instalación de energía eléctrica propia por lo que ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para pagar mano de obra y comprar los materiales necesarios para la instalación de energía eléctrica en su vivienda los cuales son: alambre, interruptores, caja térmica, etc. para realizar la instalación de energía eléctrica en su vivienda.
texts.en:
María is 38 years old and lives in a house she owns together with her life partner and their three children.  One of her children attends school.  She is a selfless mother and supportive neighbor who is always looking to help her children succeed in any way she can.  

She works making and selling tamales and also sells underwear as a street vendor to support her family.  Maria's home lacks electricity, so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to pay for labor and purchase the necessary materials to install electricity in her home.  She needs to purchase wire, switches, and a thermal box to complete the installation of electricity in her home.

loans.use: to invest in wire, switches, and a thermal box to install electricity in her home.

loans.name: Mujeres Al Poder Group

texts.es: Esta es la Alcancía “Mujeres Al Poder” y está conformada por 06 mujeres optimistas y emprendedoras. Joana de 35 años de edad es separada con 01 hijo dependiente. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de bocaditos para festividades como empanadas, y pasteles. Gracias a su constante dedicación su negocio le va bien cada día. Así mismo presta servicio de limpieza a hogares. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de harina, azúcar, huevo y leche. El deseo de Joana es seguir creciendo en su negocio. El grupo “Mujeres Al Poder” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Joana es la tercera del lado derecho.
texts.en:
This is the "Mujeres Al Poder" ["Women to Power"] communal bank. It is composed of six optimistic and enterprising women.
