Joana, aged 35, is separated and has one dependent son. She makes a living making and selling snacks for parties such as empanadas and cakes. It is through her constant dedication that her business is doing well every day. She also provides house cleaning services. 

She will use her latest loan to purchase flour, sugar, eggs, and milk. Joana hopes to continue expanding her business.

In the photo, Joana is the third from the right.

The "Mujeres Al Poder" group is grateful to the people who made this loan possible.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, eggs, and milk.

loans.name: Guillermo Antonio

texts.es: Guillermo de 50 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 3 hijos de 26, 22 y 19 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que toda su vida se ha esforzado para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos que ya son mayores de edad por lo que se siente muy orgulloso, ya que lo ha logrado a base de esfuerzo y trabajo. Guillermo desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de cuadros decorativos los cuales distribuye de forma ambulante en los cantones cercanos a su vivienda. Guillermo siempre buscando darle lo mejor a su familia desea construir un servicio sanitario en su vivienda y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, hierro y mano de obra para construir un servicio sanitario en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 50 years old and lives in a house he owns together with his life partner and their three children who are 26, 22, and 19 years old.  He is a hardworking man who has made an effort to move his children forward all his life.  He feels very proud now that they are adults with what he has achieved through effort and work.

Guillermo started selling decorative paintings three years ago as a street vendor in the cantons close to his home.  He is always looking to give his family the best, so he wants to build a bathroom in their home.  In order to do that, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase cement, sand, gravel, bricks, iron, and to pay laborers to build the bathroom.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, bricks, iron, and pay laborers to build a bathroom in his house.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel Antonio mayor de edad casado con tres hijos menores de edad origen chinandegano, ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy trabajador, responsables por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una culminar sus estudios terminando la primaria por lo que se vio obligado a trabajar desde pequeño  para aporta a los gastos del hogar, por lo que hoy en día Manuel lucha día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor a sus hijos y no pasen lo que el tuvo que pasar, es un microempresario propietario y administrador de su propios negocios los cuales consisten en la venta de frutas y verduras, elaboración de bollos de coco, de manera ambulante sus compras las realiza al contado en mercados y distribuidoras de esta misma localidad, sus ventas son al contado tiene clientes fijos y eventuales al igual que vende frutas y verduras como: plátanos, tomates, cebollas, pipían, calalas, pitaya entre otros mas, uno de sus sueños es poder terminar de construir su vivienda para brindarles un techo digno donde vivir a sus pequeños hijos y verlos coronar una carrera, ha tenido varios créditos con león 2000, el cual le ha permitido ir mejorando poco a poco su vivienda el cual anteriormente era forrada toda de zin, hoy tiene una parte construida de pared y la otra aun de zin, el objetivo de este nuevo financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de los bollos de coco, como: azúcar, coco, roda, leña, y frutas como: calalas, pitayas, tomates entre otros Manuel, agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Manuel Antonio, a married man with three minor children, is from Chinandegano which is located in the western part of the country. He is known for being a hard working responsible man. 

Due to the lack of financial resources he could not finish his primary school studies as he was obligated to work since he was young to help with the household expenses, which is why Manuel fights every day to give his children a better future so that they do not have to go through what he went through.

He is a micro entrepreneur, owner and manager of his own businesses, which consist of selling fruits and vegetables and making coconut buns which he sells for cash as a street vendor in the markets and to distributors in the same area. His sales are in cash to regular customers and those who pass by, and he sells fruits and vegetables such as bananas, tomatoes, onions, passion fruit, ‘pitaya’ [purple fruit from a cactus] among other items. 

One of his dreams is to be able to finish building his house in order to offer his small children a decent roof to live under and to see them succeed in life.

He has had other loans with the Leon 2000 Foundation which has allowed him little by little to improve his home which was formerly lined with metal sheeting. The objective of this new loan is to have working capital in order to buy the raw material for making coconut buns such as sugar, coconuts, rhodamine, firewood, and fruit such as: passion fruit, pitayas, tomatoes, and more. 

Manuel appreciates very much the support of Kiva loaners to people with low incomes.

loans.use: to invest in the pruchase of raw materials to make coconut buns such as sugar, rhodamine, cinnamon, firewood and fruit such as bananas, tomatoes, passion fruit, among others

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es: Luis es un señor de 62 años de edad, casado y padre de un hijo. Luis se seinte muy agradecido con Dios ya que lo ha bendicido mucho con las tierras que posee porque por medio de ellas ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia cuando las cultivas. Actualmente Luis solicita de un préstamo para comprar insumos para cultivar un hectárea de cebolla, abonos como urea, completo, insecticidas, y pagar la mano de obra que le ayudara al mantenimiento de sus cultivo. Estimando que este préstamo le será de mucha ayuda ya que con la ganancia podrá adquirir dos vacas con terneros que le serviran para seguir trabajando sus tierras. Sus principales metas son seguir trabajando y solicitar nuevamente el apoyo de Kiva-MiCredito para lograr salir adelante.
texts.en:
Luis is a 62 year old, married man who is the father of one child. Luis feels very grateful to God as he has been blessed with the land he owns. With it he has been able to get his family ahead through farming.

Today Luis is requesting a loan to buy inputs to cultivate one hectare of onions, fertilizers like urea and Complete formula, insecticides and to pay for labor to help him maintain his crops. He estimates that this loan will be of great help to him because with the profit from the use of this loan, he will buy two cows with calves that will help him to continue to work his land. His main goals are to continue to work and to request new loans from Kiva and MiCredito to continue to progress.

loans.use: to buy inputs for one hectare of onions, fertilizers such as urea, insecticides and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Dúo Eufrates Group

texts.es:
Dúo Eufrates
Este grupo esta conformado por el señor Lester de 25 años de edad,y de Sindy Arely, el señor Lester se dedica a la venta de medicina, tiene una farmacia que gracias a Dios le dio la oportunidad de tener este negocio para sustentar sus gastos familiares,tiene un año de tener su farmacia,en esta oportunidad esta solicitando este credito para la compra de medicina ya que le falta un poco mas de variedades de medicina ya que en el area donde esta hay mucha demanda de sierta medicina y no tiene el capital para obtener dicho producto espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
Dúo Eufrates

This group is made up of Lester, who is 25 years old, and Sindy Arely. Mr.Lester sells medicine for living; he has a pharmacy that, thanks to God, he was able to get the opportunity to have such a business to cover his family expenses.  He has had his pharmacy for a year; he is currently requesting this loan to buy medicine, as he needs a few more types of medicines because in the area where he is there is high demand for certain medicines and he does not have the capital to get those products.  He hopes you will be able to help him with the loan he is requesting.

loans.use: to buy medicine to resell

loans.name: Lourdes Liliana

texts.es: Lourdes es una señora casada de 26 años de edad, ella tiene 2 hijas de 3 y 6 años, la niña mayor asiste a la escuela, el esposo de Lourdes trabaja de al jornal de trabajo de campo, ella se dedica desde hace 5 años a la crianza de animales menores y al jornal, Lourdes va a invertir en la compra de pollos  para ponerlos un cuartito de madera que ella misma elaboró, la aspiración de Lourdes es mejorar su negocio y readecuar sus pequeños galpones  para incrementar pollos  y seguir luchando por sus hijas y comprarse una casa.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a married woman who is 26 years of age. She has two daughters, ages 3 and 6. The older daughter attends school. Her husband is a day laborer out in the fields.

For the past five years, Lourdes has been raising chickens and doing farm labor. She will invest in the purchase of chickens and place them in a small wooden shack that she will make for them. Lourdes aspires to improve her business and remodel her small coops so that she can increase the number of chickens. She wants to continue striving on behalf of her daughters and also buy a house.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Marady

texts.en:
Marady, a 27-year-old university student majoring in English literature, lives with his parents in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. He has also been working as a front desk agent at a guesthouse since 2012, earning about $5 a day.

Due to a shortage of finances, Marady is requesting a loan to help pay his third-year tuition fees. In the future, he hopes to have his own house.

loans.use: to pay his third-year tuition fees

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en:
Eseta is 64 years old and married with 8 children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 1 year. 

Eseta needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a spade, a crowbar and a new watering hose. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. Eseta will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a spade, a crowbar and a new watering hose.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a female Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail shop where she sells stationery. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future she can open a supermarket. This is her third  loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water tank.

loans.name: Marion

texts.en:
Marion is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be self motivated. She operates a farm where she grows tea and also keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. 

Her business is located in an area with a favourable climate and her primary customers are tea factories. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to hire tea farm laborers. Her business goal is to have a bigger dairy farm within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to hire tea farm laborers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replace the roof and repair the walls of a bedroom.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is a responsible mother who requests a loan from Paglaum MPC to increase her inventory. 
She wants to buy flour, oil and other ingredients for snack vending. This way, she will be able to sell more products, which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy flour, oil, and other ingredients for snack vending.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: jorge de 46 años de edad se dedica a la crianza se ganado bovino desde hace varios años, con los que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, sus hijos ya son independientes, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de 2 novillos para repasto y asi poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Jorge is 46 years old.  He has worked raising cows for many years.  What he earns from his sales is able to meet his household expenses.  He lives in a house he owns with his life partner.  His children are already independent.  

He is requesting a loan to purchase two young cows so that he can continue his work, which generates good income.

loans.use: to purchase two young cows.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 59 years old and married with 11 children, 4 of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business. 

Marcelina is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for her farm machinery for her farm preparation.

Marcelina has been farming rice for six years, and also earns additional income from a buy and sell charcoal business and raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college .

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her farm machinery

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Vilma has been in this business for 13 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Vilma requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

In the future, Vilma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Lorenz

texts.en:
Lorenz is 17 years old and is studying for a Bachelor of Marine Transportation. He is currently in his first year of a three year course.

Lorenz needs PHP 16,800 to pay for tuition fees for the first semester of the 2014-15 school year.

When he graduates, Lorenz plans to be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Because Sahar is a conservative lady, she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. Sahar is a 41-year-old married lady living with her family, which consists of three members. 

Her husband has been working in calligraphy for one year, and his business has become their only source of income. Her husband started his business doing calligraphy at home. Then, he opened his own workshop after receiving a good number of requests from his customers. Now he is seeking to expand his workshop to raise his profit by buying more calligraphy tools.

Because he doesn’t have enough money to do so, Sahar wants to help him by applying for this loan.

loans.use: to buy calligraphy tools

loans.name: Mairamgul

texts.ru: Майрамгул, 31 год, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее среднее образование. Майрамгул в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи с 2004 года занимается животноводством, стартовав с суммы 5,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду, Майрамгул на сегодняшний день имеет 5 коров, 30 овец. Также на земельном участке мерою 1,00 Га Майрамгул выращивает кукурузу и клевер. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят. Майрамгул является лидером группы "Майрам", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека. Всего их трое. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность в дальнейшем улучшить условия проживания ее семьи.
texts.en:
Mairamgul is 31 years old, married, and the mother of three children.  She has a secondary education.  For an additional source of income for her family, Mairamgul runs an animal husbandry business, which she started in 2004 with 5,000 som (KGS).  As a result of her hard work, today Mairamgul has five milk cows and 30 sheep.  She also has 1 ha of land where she grows corn and clover. 

Mairamgul is the leader of the "Mairam" group, which has two other members, for a total of three people.  With an aim to further developing her business, Mairamgul applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy calves.  Mairamgul plans to invest the profits from her loan in further development of her business in order to one day have the opportunity to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and top quality potato seed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar home system that will help his family save money

loans.name: Nain Group

texts.en:
Souban's village takes water from wells and from the local streams. Some people in the village, including Souban, are able to buy bottled water. The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.

Souban is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water-borne diseases.

The water filter also increases the disposable income of users like Souban because of the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal, the decreased time spent foraging for wood, and by decreasing  the amount of money used to purchase bottled water.

The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works from 3 to 5 years.
Those pictured in the back row purchased water filters but are not eligible for Kiva financing.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Esperanca

texts.en: Esperanca is taking a loan of $800 to improve her business. She is running a mini-shop that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as shirts, shorts, long pants, long sleeves, and short sleeves, as well as church clothes. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600. She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy shirts, shorts, long pants, long sleeves, short sleeves, and church clothes

loans.name: Xayala

texts.en:
Xayala is a 36-year-old married woman. She has a son and two daughters and her husband is a farmer. She is a farmer too and helps her husband. They have a farm and raise crops and corn there. Xayala has been working in this area for eight years and has good experience but her monthly income is 300 AZN. This is a very low income and doesn’t cover the family’s demands.

Farming is much expanded in Azerbaijan and raising crop and corn is in high demand. People rise corn and sell harvest to bakeries, restaurants, or local bazaars.

The farm’s productivity has fallen and Xayala can’t get usual the income from sales. The family has a hard time and they need money to cover demands. She applied for a 1000 AZN loan in order to supply good fertilizers.

loans.use: to supply good fertilizers.

loans.name: Carlos Adalberto

texts.es: Carlos  tiene 27 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su pequeña hija de 2 años y medio  de edad. Carlos se gana la vida por medio de la compra y venta de teléfonos y accesorios. De esta forma lleva el sustento a su hogar y mantiene el equilibrio económico. Carlos desea invertir nuevamente en su negocio dado que no cuenta con vitrinas para dar mejor vistosidad  a sus productos. Además, desea comprar accesorios como: cargadores, carcasas, memorias USB, baterías, etc. Agradece el apoyo que recibió en el pasado para invertir en el negocio, gracias a esa inversión ahora cuenta con más clientes que cada día la prefieren más.
texts.en:
Carlos is 27 and lives at his own home with his 2 1/2-year-old daughter. For living, Carlos buys and sells phones and accessories, and is able to support his household and keep his finances stable. 

Carlos would like to make additional investments in his business, such as new display cases for his products. He also would like to purchase accessories such as chargers, cases, USB memory sticks, batteries, and other items. Carlos is grateful for the support that he's received in the past, which has allowed him to invest in his business. These investments have resulted in more customers, whose loyalty is growing by the day.

loans.use: to purchase a window, chargers, cases, USB memory sticks, batteries, and other items.

loans.name: Bara

texts.en:
Bara is a 22 year old, single young man from Attell, a village near Tulkarem City. He lives with his family in a very simple house. 

Bara works with his family on their agricultural land where they plants seasonal crops using greenhouses. All the family cooperate together in planting and harvesting the crops. 

Bara requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him prepare the land for the new season. By taking this loan, Bara will be able to improve the land and increase its productivity. 

Bara appears in the photo on the family land

loans.use: t o prepare land for the new season

loans.name: Donia

texts.en:
Donia is driven by a passion for making food snacks. At the age of 45, a mother living in Bitaug, Enrique Villanueva, she engages in snack vending that primarily supports her family. Everyday, she never gets tired of selling her snacks to her customers. She even sells to neighboring barangays as well, in order to sell all out. 

Donia is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without any records of default. Now, she has taken another loan to buy inventories of to buy inventories of sugar, milk, flavoring and other raw ingredients for making ice candy to sell. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities.

In the future, she dreams of opening a snack house to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy inventories of sugar, milk, flavoring and other raw ingredients for making ice candy.

loans.name: Isai

texts.es: Isai de 33 años de edad  vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos, el posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, elabora puertas, balcones, rejas entre otros, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este negocio y tiene mucha experiencia que le ayuda a mejorar cada día su labor, hasta ahora el negocio le ha dado muy buenos resultados ya se hizo de mucha clientela pues lo buscan por la calidad de su trabajo, por los precios accesibles pero sobre todo porque siempre realiza el trabajo al gusto del cliente, Isai quiere hacer crecer el negocio pero necesita de capital para compra de material por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar, hierro, metal, herramienta etc. para continuar con su trabajo y recibir mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Isai, who is 33 years old, lives with his wife and their two children. He has a workshop for metal structures. He makes doors, balconies, and grills, among other items. He has been in this business for a number of years, and he has a lot of experience that helps him to improve his work each day. Up to now his business has given him very good results, and he has already acquired a lot of customers, since they seek him out because of the quality of his work and for his affordable prices, but above all because he always does the work according to the customer's wishes. 

Isai wants to expand his business, but he needs capital to purchase materials. For this reason he is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow him to buy iron, metal, tools, etc. in order to continue with his work and receive better earnings.

loans.use: to buy iron, metal, tools, etc.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As the married mother of three children, Gloria works hard to support her family.

She has a business salt retail in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling spices, pottery and a general store business. Gloria is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of salt to offer for sale business.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of salt to offer for sale.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 48 years old and married with ten children.  With six children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a firewood retail in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of firewood to sell. She has been in this business for ten years.

In the future Thelma would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Rafael Amilcar

texts.es:
Rafael, por la facilidad de pago  que le brinda la institución y los buenos resultados que tiene al hacer uso de créditos  nuevamente solicita capital para comprar un frisser  nuevo, para almacenar mayor cantidad de hielo y cubrir las nuevas demandas de sus clientes.
Con ayuda del préstamo anterior ha mejorado la rentabilidad de su negocio, teniendo así recursos económicos para comprarse una motocicleta en la que sale a repartir el hielo a diferentes lugares.
texts.en: Rafael, thanks to the good terms the institution offers and his good results in making use of loans, is again asking for capital to buy a new  freezer to store a larger amount of ice and fill his customers' new orders.  With help of the previous loan, he has improved the profitability of his business,  thus having financial resources to buy a motorcycle on which he goes out to deliver the ice ot various places.

loans.use: to buy a new  freezer to keep a larger amount of ice and fill his customers' orders

loans.name: Narfe

texts.en:
Narfe is 38 years old and married with five children. With two children currently in school, Narfe works very hard to provide for them.

Narfe runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more items like coffee, cooking oil, noodles, detergent soap, shampoo, fabric conditioner, etc., to sell.

Narfe has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, cooking oil, noodles, detergent soap, shampoo, fabric conditioner, etc. 

In the future, Narfe would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like coffee, cooking oil, noodles, detergent soap, shampoo, fabric conditioner, etc., to sell

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María, con el crédito anterior  se limitó a comprar mariscos para abastecer su negocio, atraer nuevos clientes y mejorar su situación económica. Comprarte con su familia un estilo de vida mucho más confortable.
Con el objetivo de seguir manteniendo su negocio funcionando se ha decidido a solicitar un nuevo préstamo con el que comprara variedad de mariscos para mantener a sus clientes satisfechos.
texts.en: With her previous loan, Maria chose to buy shellfish to stock her business, attract new customers and improve her financial situation.  She now shares a much more comfortable life style with her family.    In order to keep her business going well Maria has decided to ask for a new loan with which to buy a variety of shellfish to please her customers.

loans.use: to buy various kinds of shellfish to keep her customers well pleased

loans.name: Larisa

texts.ru: Ларисе 61 год, замужем, мать 5 детей. У Ларисы среднее образование, с 2007 года занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве есть 1 бычок и 2 овцы. Супруг и дети с радостью помогают Ларисе в ведении ее бизнеса. Есть все условия для содержания скота, на зиму заготовлен корм. Лариса обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 бычков для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Лариса планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Larisa is 61 years old, married, and the mother of five children.  She has a secondary education and she has been involved in agriculture since 2007.  She currently owns one steer and two head of sheep.  Her husband and children are happy to help her run the farming business.  Larisa has everything she needs to keep livestock at home, and she already gathered feed for the winter.  She has turned to the bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" and requested a loan of 100,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to purchase four steers for fattening and resale.  She plans to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further increasing her livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase four steers for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Vannny

texts.en:
Vannny (in picture) is 35 years old,In photo there are two people(Vannny is stand at the left,The man is Vannny's husband his name is Kong Pheap) lives in the Khsach kandal district of Kandal province Cambodia, around fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City, Her family live along the Mekong river. She has been married since 2002 and has one son.

Vanny is a mushroom grower with 6 months experience, while her husband is a construction worker and has been a fisherman for ten years. So she would like to apply for a loan to purchase mushrooms for planting and piglets to feed. She said that, “I decided to do it because I know how to do it, referring to my experience, moreover I can increase profits to help support my family”.

She hopes that she will help her family get better lives.

loans.use: to purchase mushrooms for planting and piglets to feed.

loans.name: Ana Concepción

texts.es:
Ana Concepción es una señora de 51 años de edad, madre de cuatro hijos todos ya graduados profesionalmente.
Habita en el municipio de El sauce donde ha vivido toda su vida, se desempeña desde hace más de veinte años como profesora de primaria en la escuela de la comunidad San José ubicado a 5 kilómetros del poblado urbano.
Doña Ana se siente muy agradecida con Dios y los inversionistas de Kiva porque gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado terminó de preparar a sus hijos profesionalmente, ya que tenía dos estudiando a la vez en la universidad y se le hacía difícil a ella y su esposo cubrir estos gastos con el bajo salario que ganan.
En este momento tiene la necesidad de un financiamiento para mejorar su salud con el cual piensa realizarse exámenes médicos, ultrasonidos y comprar medicamentos.
Espera que le sigan apoyando.
texts.en:
Ana Concepcion is 51 years old, and the mother of four children all of whom have graduated with professional degrees.  She has lived in the city of El Sauce all her life, and  for more than twenty years has worked as a primary school teacher in the school of the community of San Jose, located 5 kilometers from the urban population center.

Ana is grateful to God and to the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they have offered she finished preparing her children for their professional careers.  At one point she had two studying in the university at the same time, and this made it difficult for Ana and her husband to cover those costs with the low salaries they earn.

Right now she needs a loan to improve her health, planning to have medical exams, ultrasounds and to buy medications.  She hopes to continue to receive support.

loans.use: to carry out medical exams, ultrasounds and buy medications

loans.name: Srikandi 2 Group

texts.en:
This is the fifth loan for the Srikandi 2 Group. They still need a loan because most of them need the training and education. They want to be successful pig breeders. They now have six members; one member decided to leave the group for several reasons. One member couldn't attend the meeting because of illness.

They receive the same loan amount. Beside using the loan to purchase piglets, they also will use the loan to fix the barn. Ni Wayan as the head, could not attend the meeting to receive the loan because she went to the city, and the process was managed by Ni Nengah, the treasurer. Ni Nengah is happy to receive her loan and use it to purchase three superior piglets. She hopes this time to earn more profit. All the profits are used to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase three superior piglets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition for her youngest daughter

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is a 44-year-old married woman from Ilo-ilo, Philippines. She has 11 children.The oldest is 25, while the youngest is 3. She engages in fishing. She catches and sells fish as the main source of income. She has been into fishing for more than 10 years. 

Lerma requested a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy fishing net, fishing weights, ropes and nylon. This is very helpful in obtaining a bountiful catch and improve their daily earning. 

In the future, Lerma would like to expand her fishing business to provide her children with a proper diet and a quality education.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, fishing weights, ropes and nylon

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru: Нигине 20 лет. Она не замужем. Нигина очень умная и целеустремленная женщина. Она учится в 4 курсе Национальном Университете Таджикистана по специальности Мировая экономика. Нигина в свободное время читает книги и смотрит интеллектуальные программы. Она всегда старается расширить свой кругозор и будущим стать хорошим специалистом. Ее родители в этом году не смогли оплатить за учебы Нигины, так как у них было много расходов. Нигина запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Nigina is 20 years old and not married.  Nigina is a very intelligent and goal-oriented woman.  She is a fourth-year student at the National University of Tajikistan where she studies international economics.  In her spare time, Nigina reads and watches intellectual television programs.  She is always trying to expand her outlook and to one day become an excellent economist.

Nigina's parents weren't able to pay her tuition this year because they had many other expenses.  Nigina is requesting a loan to pay her university tuition. She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay her tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for barrels of fish to sell.

loans.name: Dominador

texts.en:
His name is Dominador. He is 54 and a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Vicenta and has four children. Two of his children are in high school and the other two are already working. His wife manages their household while he operates their business. He works hard to continually provide income for their daily needs and the schooling of his children.

Dominador owns a pineapple farm. He has been growing pineapple for two years and it has helped him sustain the needs of his family. Silang is in the highlands, which is largely farmland. Pineapple is one of the favorite fruits/desserts of Filipinos. He sells his product to the market and fruit stores that he regularly supplies and to the local community. He earns a minimum of 10,000 PHP in sales monthly.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan, which he will use to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for his farm. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. He is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to him.

Dominador dreams of being able to plant different kinds of fruits and vegetables to increase his sales. He dreams of sending all his children to college. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for farm inputs and farm fertilizer.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children and one of whom in school, Lucila works hard to support her family.

She has a rice farming business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from weaving native products. Lucila is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase a new variety of rice seeds and other farm supplies for her farming rice business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lucila has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business and to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new variety of rice seeds and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rosenda is 49 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Rosenda has a coconut wine-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more containers of coconut wine to sell to her customers.

Rosenda has been in this business for ten years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more containers of coconut wine to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 44 years old and married with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell, like sardines, noodles, soap, etc. 

Josie has borrowed and paid back 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, like sardines, noodles, soap, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, sugar, salt, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 49 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Marilou has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Marilou has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Jose Sixto

texts.es:
Pedro Vicente Maldonado un Cantón de clima cálido húmedo se encuentra ubicado al noroccidente de la Provincia de Pichincha es un Cantón en el cual el crecimiento y desarrollo es notable, es un lugar con variedad de comercio, aledaños a este Cantón tenemos muchos recintos uno de ellos es el recinto San Vicente de Andoas un Recinto lleno de gente amable y trabajadora en el mismo la gran mayoría de jóvenes y adultos les gusta el deporte incluso de este recinto han salido jugadores que están jugando profesionalmente. 
En este recinto vive y tiene el negocio el señor José un hombre luchador de 36 años él es casado de esta hermosa y larga relación tienen 3 hijos el mayor de 14 años y la ultima de 1 año la esposa no trabaja pasa en casa cuidando a sus hijos, se dedica a la carpintería un negocio que aprendió en su niñez junto con sus padre y hermanos a este negocio le dedica un promedio de 15 horas por día, solicita el crédito para invertir en el negocio , comprará una nueva herramienta para su trabajo, con esta nueva inversión mejoraran sus ingresos económicos y la calidad de vida de su familia, el señor José agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Pedro Vicente Maldonado, a warm, humid place located to the northwest of the Pichincha territory, is a region that has notable growth and development. It is a place with a variety of commerce. Neighboring this region are many areas, one of which is San Vicente de Andoas which is full of friendly and hard-working people. This is the same place where a large majority of youth and adults enjoy sports, including this place where many professional players have come from.

In this town, Jose, a determined, 36-year-old man, lives and has his own business. He is married and from this lovely and long relationship he has 3 children older than 14, and the last is one year old. His wife does not work; she stays at home watching the children. He works in carpentry, a business he learned in his childhood with his father and brothers. He dedicates an average of 15 hours per day to this business. He is requesting a loan to buy a new tool for his work activity. With this new investment, he will raise his earnings and quality of life for his family. Jose thanks Fundacion Alternative and Kiva for the support and opportunity given.

loans.use: to buy a new tool for his work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate his house, and replace the windows and doors before the cold and rainy season

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгуль 41 год, вдова, мать 5 детей. У Айгуль среднее образование, много лет занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы и 30 овец, также на земельном участке Айгуль выращивает фасоль для реализации. Дополнительно она продает молоко. У Айгуль есть все условия для содержания скота, летние и зимние сараи, курятники, заготовлен корм для скота. Ежемесячная прибыль Айгуль составляет 10,000 сом (KGS), однако этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь Айгуль и ее детей. Поэтому она и обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 125,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 25 овец для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Айгуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, что поможет ей улучшить благосостояние ее семьи и дать своим детям достойное образование.
texts.en: Aigul is 41, has five children, and is a widow.  She has the equivalent of a high school education, and has been farming for many years.  She currently has two cows and thirty sheep on her farm, as well as a plot of land for growing beans as a cash crop.  She also sells milk to earn some additional money.  She has everything needed for raising livestock: summer and winter barns, chicken coops, and feed for her animals.  Her monthly income is 10,000 som, but this isn't enough for her and her children to live comfortably.  As such, she's seeking a loan of 125,000 som from Bai Tushum to buy 25 sheep for fattening and resale.  She plans on using any extra money she earns due to the loan to continue to buy more livestock, as well as improve her family's quality of life and provide her children with a quality education.

loans.use: buy twenty five sheep to help bolster her income

loans.name: Ardiana

texts.en: Ardiana is 38 years old and has three children between the ages of 10 and 17. Her husband works for an electrical company. She has started to plan for a business hatching and raising chickens from eggs in an incubator.  She is very optimistic that she will be able to sell the chickens and have a successful business doing this. She is very excited and looks forward to this work. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase an incubator. She is very grateful for the opportunity to start on her dream of something new, and she thanks all of the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase an incubator for raising chickens

loans.name: Budhima Shg Group

texts.en:
The group "Budhima Self Help Group" is composed of members who are all eager to improve their families’ economic situations. Rasmita, the lady seated with her raised hand, is the secretary of this group. 

She is a married woman of 24 years, and is in the business of selling personal care products and ladies’ fashion items, work that she learned from helping her husband. She will use her loan portion to invest in the purchase of more personal care products and ladies’ fashion items so that she can sell them to her customers. 

Other members of this group are engaged in petty businesses such as grocery store, general store, vegetable selling, etc. All are very happy with this loan and would like to thank Kiva lenders for the credit provided to them.

loans.use: to purchase more personal care products and ladies' fashion items.

loans.name: Phuong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Phuong, born in 1976, has been a member of M7-MFI since 1995. She and her family live and work in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family life is quite difficult, with the main income coming from plant cultivation and hired outside work. Because she has to cover living expenses of the whole family and her three children’s tuition, she and her husband have just saved a very little amount. After many years of working hard, she has just saved a little amount, but it is not enough to build a solid house. 

Having known the M7-MFI’s saving and credit program for a long time, she decided to apply for a loan from the organization. She expects after borrowing this loan, she can be able to realize her long-standing dream to build a solid house for her children to stay and study in.

loans.use: to build a solid house

loans.name: Thanh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thanh, born in 1973, currently lives with her husband and her son in Mai Son district, Son La province. She is an official who is in charge of population issues, but with little salary. As a result, her family faces many difficulties. To earn additional income, improve family life, and better her child's living conditions and learning, she decided to invest in raising chickens in the garden.

She hopes this loan that she borrows from M7-MFI will help her take advantage of her family’s available resources, to develop the model of raising chickens in the garden with high economic productivity. She will work hard to have money to repay the loan to M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to invest in raising chickens in the garden.

loans.name: Thom's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thom is a Thai ethnic person. She is 40 years old this year. She has three children: two married daughters and one little son. Her family lives in Mai Sơn district, Sơn La province. 

Thơm is a pioneer in the advocacy of women practicing saving through the M7 Microfinance Institution’s groups. She has 20 years of participation in this program. Her family has a plot of land for planting coffee and corn. Because of barren hilly land, she has to buy muck annually, cutting grasses and trees to compost to improve the soil. Looking ahead, she needs to buy more organic fertilizers for coffee trees to help increase crop yields. She hopes this new loan will help reduce her family's burden and they will have a bumper crop.

loans.use: to buy more organic fertilizers for coffee trees

loans.name: Phong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Phong, born in 1955, lives in Mai Son district, Son La. She has two children, and they are both married. She has been a member of M7-MFI for fourteen years, with ten past loan rounds. 

The main income for her family is from planting corn, sugarcane, cassava, and coffee, and with funding supported by M7-MFI, she invested in the purchase of inorganic fertilizer for plant investment. After a long time, she found that the use of inorganic fertilizers has many components that directly affect drinking water. More fertilizers will cause discolored land, and productivity is not highly effective. Therefore, she decided to transfer from inorganic fertilizers to organic fertilizers, and this change requires more funds to invest.

Mrs. Phong hopes that with this new loan, she will invest in the plantation and gain high productivity, while also contributing to environmental protection. In the future, residents of where she lives will transform their farming practices, improving the quality of life for the community.

loans.use: to transfer from inorganic fertilizers to organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Loan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Loan, born in 1988, is an ethnic Thai person. She and her family live in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her family consists of five members: Loan, her husband, and three small children. Having many school-age children causes her family a lot of financial difficulty. She wants all of her children to have the chance to go to school to be literate and to escape poverty. 

She was recognized as a member of M7 MFI in 2009 when she got her first loan to build a mud-walled house with room for her children to stay and study. During the repayment period, she was always as an exemplary member who complied well with M7 MFI regulations. After years of use, her family's house has deteriorated, so she needs more funds to renovate the house. With this loan, she and her family wish to have better living conditions, which would  improve and enhance the health and morale of the family.

loans.use: to renovate her family house

loans.name: Xom's Group

texts.en:
Xom, born in 1972, is an ethnic Thai person. She lives with her family in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her family has four members, including Xom, her husband, her son and her daughter, who are all hardworking.

Her family's main occupation is farming year after year with fields in the mountains, but it is just enough to eat. She thinks it is because of living in such a remote area, as she has less access to scientific and technical progress in crop variety and farming techniques to increase productivity. She thinks that if she wants to change her situation, she needs to have capital that she doesn't have. Therefore, she really wants to borrow a loan to buy fertilizer for her coffee garden to create more income for her family.

She hopes that the loan will help her family fertilize the coffee garden well and that the next coffee season will bring her family a better crop. She will work hard to earn money to repay M7 MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her coffee garden

loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Huong, born in 1973, is a Thai ethnic person living in Mai Son district, Son La province.  She has been participating in the M7-MFI program since 2013. In her time of working M7-MFI, she has always been an excellent member. 

Mrs. Huong is a teacher, and her family's monthly income depends on her salary. Her husband is working very far from home, and leaves two little children to her. Therefore, she has to do everything. 

She had borrowed a loan from M7-MFI to invest in livestock breeding. After selling the output products, she has saved an amount. This time, she hopes that M7-MFI will continue to support her to borrow a loan to expand the her business of raising pigs and chickens.

She hopes in the future her family income will be more stable, and her children will have more ability to secure their education to become useful citizens for the society.

loans.use: to expand her business of raising pigs and chickens

loans.name: Bayanmunkh

texts.en:
Mr. Bayanmunkh, 41 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi services to local people since 2008. His wife is unemployed and stays at home, taking care of domestic work. Their daughter goes to high school. He has a son who has been living with his grandparents since birth. Also this year his son began studying at university. 

He is requesting a loan of 2,700 USD to pay tuition fees for his son. It is his responsibility as a father to help his son get a necessary education. In the borrower profile picture, the client is together with his wife while their daughter was at school.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for his son

loans.name: Yeny

texts.es:
YENY, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y eligió estudiar la carrera de Educación Inicial ya que le gusta mucho los niños, considera que tiene mucha paciencia y le agrada la idea de saber que será la responsable de la formación del futuro del pais.
Paralelamente a sus estudios ella ya trabaja en un centro educativo como auxiliar, con ese trabajo ella puede cubrir algunos gastos como materiales que les piden en la universidad ya que ésta carrera demanda bastante trabajo manual.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en el pago de las mensualidades del tercer ciclo y así poder estudiar tranquilamente sin la preocupación de la falta de pago de la mensualidad.
Yeny desea agradecer a los inversionistas por el gran apoyo que dan a los estudiantes.
texts.en:
Yeny, 21, is single.  She chose to study early childhood education because she likes children a lot.  She thinks she has a lot of patience, and she likes the idea of knowing she'll be responsible for the development of the future of the country.

In addition to her studies, she already works in an educational center as an assistant.  With this job she's able to cover some expenses such as supplies the university requires, because there's a lot of manual work in this program.

She's going to invest the loan in paying her monthly expenses for the third term.  That way she can study calmly without worrying about the money to pay the fees.

Yeny wants to thank the lenders for the support they provide to students.

loans.use: to pay her monthly fees for her program in early childhood education

loans.name: Jeofre

texts.en:
Jeofre is a 42-year-old married man from Iloilo, Philippines. He has one daughter who is 18 years old. He earns a living through his buying and selling of both fresh fish and dried fish. Dried fish is very easy to sell since this is one of the staple in every Filipino household - usually cooked for breakfast. 

Jeofre is asking for a loan to buy more stocks of dried fish and fresh fish to sell. Through this loan, he will be able to improve his income and not run out of stock from time to time.

Jeofre dreams of making his business a success in order to provide better for his family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fresh and dried fish

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is married and has five children. She is 52 years old and lives in Maloro, Tangub City. 

She earns a living offering manicure/pedicure services. She now has been in this business for about 30 years and is well known for the nice quality of services she offers.  

She has already purchased some new manicure sets and was able to save from it. Her service is self-sustainable and has become profitable, with a net profit of about PHP 5,000 per month.
  
Evangeline is seeking a PHP 50,000 loan. She would like to use the loan to purchase special items for her foot spa services. 

In her previous loans she has never had a delinquency. Evangeline is very diligent and loves accuracy, which only adds to the effective management of her venture.

loans.use: to buy special items for her foot spa services.
